The first time we stayed there the cafe didn't have many choices, but since they have expanded it along with a small selection of snacks (pretty pricey, but more convenient than going out to a grocery store).

The pool is large, but can get busy - as well as the music being way too loud sometimes! - the cocktails they serve are very good.

The fitness center is pretty large, they have something like 6 or 8 treadmills, some free weights and about 6 or 8 fixed weight machines - it does get busy in here though.

This is now our "go to" place to stay in Vegas (we have tried Bellagio, Wynn, Paris) and if the thought of not having to walk through a smokey & loud casino to get to your room is appealing you should definitely check this place out.

The valet parking is 10 steps from the front desk, so you again don't have a long walk to get your car.

We will be back again in December and are looking forward to it.

The husband and I stayed here a couple of weeks ago for 3 nights. We really liked Vdara...the smell that they pump in is amazing...I bought some scent sticks in it to bring home with us (you can get them at the spa). Every employee we encountered was pleasant and helpful. We never got anything at the market, the line was always really long and we didn't want to deal with it. It's centrally located, and is connected to the Bellagio by a covered walkway. It's also right next to Aria. I don't get the people who complained about it taking forever to get to the strip. Yeah, it took a few minutes, but I can imagine it would take the same amount of time if you were staying in a casino by the time you walk through it to get outside. We loved that the property was non-smoking, and that we had a refrigerator in the room to keep bottled water, soda, beer, etc. in.

I would highly recommend this hotel, and wouldn't hesitate to return!

A friend was able to hook us up with the friends and family discount so we decided to check this place out. 

Check in was easy and the staff was super nice. 

The room was very modern, simple. Loved the aveda bath products! We had lots of towels, two bath robes, and two sets of slippers. 

Kitchen has a keurig coffee maker with coffee enough for two people. We called for more, and they brought some, no extra charge. The fridge had two vdara water bottles. When we called for the coffee, they even gave us extra water bottles too, no extra charge.

We had to call twice for extra bed linens and for the sofa bed to be made up. But the lady who came to do the sofa bed was very nice. 

We wanted to check out the spa and called for specials for hotel guests- that was a bust. No discounts, no specials, no nada! The spa was VERY pricey. 

It would have been nice to have a city center directory in the room to know what eateries in the vicinity were open late and etc. 

It was a good experience. We'd stay again (with the friends and family discount)!

I've been coming to Vegas for years, staying at the whole gamut of hotels from Best Westerns (uhhh scary) to this place, Vdara (a classy joint).
The hotel doesn't boast the best restaurants or clubs, but it is known for its spa and low key vibe. 

Compared to all the other hotels, the air quality was not only smoke free, but actually fragrant! Yep, they were actually blowing in scented air- smelled like candy. Mmm candy...

The room I stayed in boasted a magnificent view of the strip. It was wonderfully clean, beautifully decorated, and spacious. The moment I walked in, I was instantly at ease. With most of the hotels in Vegas you can't avoid 'casino' smell. You know, booze, smokes, and someone else's left over good times (ewww). This place, however, was clean. I'm pretty sensitive to casino air, so when I relaxed comfortably in my room hack free and sans bloodshot eyes, I was ecstatic.

Vdara is the hotel to stay at when you want a relaxing weekend in Vegas, or in my case, you're there on business.

Every suite has a kitchen and sofa bed! There are no casinos, no smoke, and it's brilliantly located mid-Strip!

I've stayed at vdara twice now and have been impressed on both occasions. 

* STUDIO SUITE *
On my first stay at Vdara, I decided to book two adjacent rooms for my birthday so my friends could stay in my room and my other friend could have her friends in hers. I loved my experience here but I will admit that even having 4 people with the extended sofa bed does get a little crowded, despite it being almost 600 square feet. 

* EXECUTIVE CORNER SUITE *
On my second stay here we celebrated our friend's birthday and decided to go big! We booked the adjacent studio suite next to it to fit more guests and even though it was a long walk to the end of the hall, the view was AMAZING! The room itself was amazing! One bedroom suite with 1 bathroom that connects from the bedroom and the dining area as well. You also get a full-size refrigerator and kitchenette at your disposal. My only gripe here is that the hallway to the dining area is pretty tight, but other than that I loved my stay. 

* PARKING *
Probably one of the most annoying things about Vdara is that it's tucked away between (and behind) Aria and Cosmopolitan. They do not have their own self parking structure so you're forced to do valet. On the times that I've stayed here, it was still complimentary, but I believe with the new parking rates only gold members get complimentary. 

Because it's valet-only, expect to wait several minutes for your vehicle to arrive, especially during peak hours aka check in and check out. 

* GETTING AROUND *
Because Vdara is conveniently located near everything, it's just about walking distance to your destination! You can utilize the tram that stops at City Center Aria to Bellagio hotel (and Monte Carlo alternatively), or you can access a bridge by foot that will take you into Bellagio's casino level as well. You can also opt to walk to the street to access Cosmopolitan. 

--
Overall, this isn't the most glamorous hotel on the strip nor is it the cheapest. But considering the location, room amenities and features, this is a viable option for getting the most "bang for your buck."

(43\/100)

The hotel rooms are a bit cheaper than its competitors considering the quality of room that you get.

I've stayed in the Deluxe Suite, corner Business Suite (Rm 6002) and Vdara Suite (Rm 43010).

The Business Suite and Vdara Suite are basically the same except that the view from the business suite that we were in was the Aria Shuttle (looks like the Disneyland monorail). The view at our Vdara Suite was pretty nice, we could see the strip, including the bellagio water show.

List of things that impressed me:
- kitchen sink\/stove\/cabinetry
- separate door for the bedroom
- pull out sofa, dining table
- full sized stainless steel refrigerator
- electronic blackout curtains\/shades
- washer\/dryer set
- bathtub
- 2 free water bottles per night

List of things we needed to call for:
- extra towels
- setting up the pullout sofa
- detergent
- pots\/pans\/cookware
- extra soap

Convenience Store
The walk to the nearest convenience store is a few minutes away. Around the roundabout to Aria and through Aria's entrance, you'll immediate see "Elements" which is Aria's 24\/hr convenience store.

Cosmopolitan
We found that walking outside alongside cosmopolitan was the quickest way to get there. It beats walking through Aria, then the mall, then over the bridge.

Earl of Sandwiches
Again, walking right alongside the Cosmopolitan hotel was the quickest way to get to Earl of Sandwiches.

Planet Hollywood vs Vdara - Go Vdara
If your decision is to either stay at Planet Hollywood or Vdara, I would probably stay at Vdara based on the quality of the room that you get for the price. No, it doesnt have a casino, but think of that as a good thing, for most.

Customer Service
The front desk was extremely attentive to our needs. Housekeeping was fairly quick, with the exception of check-in times. Make sure to request that your sofa bed get done when the sun is down, you'll get a lot quicker service this way. Be nice to your housekeeping lady that fixes up your room because most likely, she'll be the one fixing up your room the next day as well, tip her the first day at minimum.

Late Night Munchies
Sorry, no late night munchies at Vdara except for room service, you'll have to walk to Aria for that.

Cafe Downstairs
The food takes about 20 minutes to get, so you'll have to be patient. Luckily, I was working on my laptop using my tethered internet, so it was a pleasant time while I was there.

Free Wifi (512kbps included)
Don't expect fast internet, it's slow, for free. Fast if you pay? I'm not sure, I didn't rely on their internet, I just tethered.

AT&T iPhone 5 Reception
The reception is good when you're on the lower floors. I had LTE on the lower floors. However, up on the 43rd floor, it took forever for pages to load while browsing. Reception was also a bit choppy for the people I was talking to on the phone. It's not the hotel's fault, it's just that I was too high up.

Pool
Don't expect much, it's a little pool with a bunch of seats to lay down on. They provide towels. They check your room key before letting you enter. There's a large rectangular spa as well. The music is ok, could be louder and more modern selection.

In short, my stay was great.

We don't gamble and love everything about Vegas but the cloud of smoke so this place was pretty perfect for us. It's an easy walk to both Bellagio and Aria. 

We had a rental for the first 24 hours while we were in town and the valet was always quick and easy to use. After that we used Uber and the pick-up spot was well-marked.

Our room was a corner suite, Bellagio side on the 50th floor. The view was fantastic! This also meant that we had only one neighbor and the shared wall was the kitchen, shower\/bathtub side of the room so there was next to no sound transfer. 

The bedroom is surrounded by the bath and living rooms so in there, the most you'll hear is the "thunder" from the Bellagio fountains. From the living room, I'd sometimes hear someone else's door close but that was it.

The room was clean on the whole. Our fridge worked great. I appreciated having a make-up vanity but do wish it had been on the window side because natural light is better.  

And yes, the automatic window shades are pretty cool. They do a great job blocking out the strip lights at night but it would be nice if they had less gaps for those days when you're trying to take a day-time nap. 

No, there is no coffee in-room but you can get a $15 coffee maker from Target or even ship yourself one from Amazon (you have no idea how many Prime boxes I saw there!) if you need a caffeine fix first thing in the AM.

After staying at the Cosmopolitan last week for 3 days I think in kind of spoiled: :-(.
I'm comparing item for item though:
The room was not well cleaned, surfaces had glass and hand marks, bed was caving in, toiletries awful bring your own, bedding was soft but very worn, sliding bathroom door did not work, fitness center was good, customer service was nothing special.
The view was amazing though, we had a suite , with incredible views to the east and south of Las Vegas. We are on the 49th floor so if you are going to stay try to get a floor that's up high. Oh yes I would say one good thing is no casino which means no smoke and no noise from people getting in late and  partying.
Hands-down if I could choose between the Cosmopolitan and this hotel I would say I'm going back to the Cosmopolitan!

They have the slowest housekeeping. I called for towels 3 times to get them after hours. I had to tell them many times that I have a late checkout but they still knocked on my door over and over to clean, refill drinks...

Vdara is one of my favorite hotels in Vegas. I love the fact that it is nonsmoking and nongaming. It is only steps away from both Aria and the Bellagio, so it easy to get to casinos, restaurants, shows, and clubs. After a day or night on the Strip, coming back to Vdara feels like entering a sanctuary. When you first enter the lobby, you will immediately notice an enticing fragrance.  

The rooms are very modern and comfortable. The panaroma suites have an amazing view and a ridiculously large bathroom. If you can get a good deal on a room at Vdara, I highly recommend staying there.

4.5 stars. 
-.5 stars for the utterly confusing lack of signs leading to the entrance, and the utterly confusing signs when you're AT the entrance turnaround. 

But overall, this place is GREAT. I've stayed at the Aria, which is right next door and I think everything about Vdara is so much better than the Aria. We stayed in mid-June with a killer deal from Hotwire ($89\/night!!). My boyfriend tried the "sandwich trick" (look it up if you don't know what this is - it's totally worth it) and we were upgraded to a suite with a view of the Bellagio fountains on the 52nd floor. Even though for a suite it was very small, they utilize the space very well. The room was spotless, the bed comfortable, and the bathroom was extremely spacious!! Not to mention the Aveda bathroom products! 

It's a non-smoking, non-gambling hotel, so it's definitely not for everyone. But for people like us that need some time away from the smoke-filled rooms, half naked women dancing on tables, and the everlasting DINGDINGDINGs of the slot machines, it was perfect. The staff is extremely courteous and responds quickly to requests (we called to ask for sheets for the sofabed and they were here within minutes). Plus, even though the whole CityCenter is a bit far from the strip, the Vdara has a walkway that connects to the Bellagio for easy access to the center of the strip. 

Overall, a great place for some luxurious peace and quiet.

One of the nicest hotels in Vegas that I've stayed in. The staff is accommodating, the rooms are plush and gorgeously appointed and the views from the top floors are to die for. Also, the food in the cafe downstairs is good. My friend said the pannini he ate was "quite possibly the best sandwich he'd ever had.

Vdara is a great value and centrally located, in particular it's great if you are attending a convention at the Bellagio because of the connection from Vdara to the conference center. The staff is friendly and the lack of a casino makes it really easy to stay at; only downside, it is starting to look a little worn in the rooms.

Warning: this review is from a photographers point of view...

We stayed in the panoramic suite .... and it was absolutely wonderful for natural lighting, I did a little photo shoot with my girlfriend and we got some epic shots. 

We will definitely be staying there again :)

I gave it only 4 stars because out of the 3 nights we stayed there, turndown service only came once :(

The hotel is nice. Two stars for non smoking. However checkin was horrible. We arrived at 3:30 and our room was not ready and they told us it would take an hour. It wasn't ready til 5:30 and it was smelly and not very clean. We asked to be switched rooms. We almost missed the Zarkana show because of their tardiness in getting us a room in time. On day of checkout, we asked for extended checkout which is 12pm. I got a coffee and when got back to the room at 11:15, the key was deactivated and I couldn't get in. They sent a bellman but took a while. I stayed with Vdara before when it was brand new and the service has gone downhill. Not staying here in the future.

I have stayed here a few times and have always enjoyed my experience. When we arrived we were checked in quickly. I was very impressed by the suite (we stayed in the panoramic suite). It was spacious, clean, modern and had great views. I really liked the fact that it was a non-smoking, non-gambling hotel. Vegas can be so busy and hectic that it was nice to get away from the hustle and bustle. I felt relaxed every time I stepped back into Vdara. But if you did get the urge to gamble it was just a short walk through a corridor to Bellagio. The staff was always pleasant and super helpful. Housekeeping always did a great job. I thoroughly enjoyed my stays and would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a more peaceful hotel stay. I would definitely stay here again.

My sister wanted to stay here during our visit.  Our room didn't have a view of the strip, it was more of a view off the strip and of the freeway.  The bed was comfy and the pull out couch was lumpy and not comfortable at all.  I did like that the hotel is smoke free.  There was a little kitchenette with a fully stocked mini fridge, but we didn't use it-we used the other mini fridge to store our waters and drinks.  

There is a Starbucks and a market in the hotel.  It's on the tramline and close to the Aria hotel.  There is a bit of a wait line for taxis sometimes, depending on time of day.  There is no casino in the hotel, but you can walk to Aria or other nearby casinos for that.  Also, when you walk into the hotel, there are staff standing by the elevator asking to see your room key card before you enter the elevators.  There's a doorbell on each room and it lights up in a different color, depending if you want housekeeping or not.  I had to call housekeeping several times for extra towels, and sometimes it would take awhile for housekeeping to come.

Overall, it's a nice hotel to stay at.  It's clean and one of the newer hotels in Vegas.

The hotel itself is clean and beautiful, however we were promised a room on the 50th floor if we waited 1 hour after check in (so 4 pm). According to them they just needed a supervisor to approve a stain removal on the carpet. I called at 4 to see if it was ready, they said 1 more hour. Called back at 5, still not ready. At 6:30 I finally got annoyed and asked what was the deal with my room. They said I wouldn't be able to stay in that room because of the same freaking stain! They couldn't have told me that 2.5 hours before?! So annoying. Anyways we were put on the 30th floor so it was definitely not the view I was expecting. They did nothing to compensate for the wait all I got was a "sorry the room was very dirty

I stayed there at least 8 times the past 2 years. And with the employees and everything around the city center you get the most for your money. The bartenders down stairs very humble and cool to the front desk everyone very chill. Coming from Hollywood and stuck up people to get away this hotel will be the only place I will stay and that's that

I might have just found my new favorite hotel in Vegas. Notice I said "hotel" and not "casino" that's because this is hotel\/spa only w no casino which is a huge plus because it means this is a smoke free facility!!! If you really have that itch to gamble because u can't sleep in the middle of the night Aria is literally across the way and Cosmopolitan as well as Bellagio are about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Booked this hotel through my CC for my 3rd anniversary and I'm happy I did. When I first arrived I had a regular "suite" and I asked the helpful lady at check in if there was any possible upgrades since I was here for a special occasion, she simply said "let me check for you" and a minute later she said "how does a corner suite on a high floor with a view of the strip and the Bellagio fountain sound?" Obviously I said "it sounds amazing". When we got up to the room and opened the doors first thing we noticed was the wrap around windows that gave us an amazing view of the strip N a clear view of the Bellagio fountains. Then I realized it felt like I was walking into a really expensive apartment that you see on TV. Had a dinner table for 4. A washer dryer couch with a pull out bed a mini kitchen with full size fridge and a bathroom. Now let's talk about the bedroom, if laying on the bed you can see out to Bellagio the Venetian the palazzo n other hotels on the strip it was relaxing. The master bathroom was pretty big, I was initially upset because there was no tv in the bathroom but what made up for it was the view, once again the Bellagio fountains. Haha. All in all this place gets a 10 out of 10.

So where should I start I checked in on Friday and the person at the front desk was kind of rude. The parking is ridiculous because it's valet only. But let's get back to the room I got My key went upstairs walking to my room and was pretty impressed at the beginning then went into the restroom and noticed some streaks on my toilet if you know what I mean I mediately called housekeeping who never came. Saturday comes around and I call for housekeeping again in the morning went down to the pool around 11 AM came back up at two housekeeping still haven't came into my room nor the toilet from Friday so again I call and I will also go downstairs to talk to the hotel manager who assures me that housekeeping will clean my room today but it's already 8 PM and I said OK we're about to head out so it would be nice to come to a clean room. We get back in from Saturday night and the room still has not been clean.
Yo go back downstairs and the Manager tells me that housekeeping said someone was sleeping so they couldn't clean it. No one wast sleeping we were all out. Sunday morning comes around and we walked to the Bellagio and I make a sports bet. $100 on a three-leg parlay to win $462 I get back to my room which is still dirty by the way I place my sports ticket on the table as I always do so when I get back I can check my games. We go downstairs for about four hours go swimming have lunch decide to come back upstairs and what do you know the room is clean but now my ticket is gone and it's already a winner I have to make a claim and was told I would get some kind of response from their risk management which was closed on Sunday but I was told they were going to get a hold of me on Sunday which they didn't nor did they Monday.
I've never spent this much on a hotel and I wish it would've been a better bachelor weekend for me but this hotel really made it one of the worst stays in Vegas. 
Now if they stay true to their word and fix everything for me because a cologne from my roommate is missing and they said they didn't find it so it's just an ongoing of negative. But if the hotel comes through with what they say I will take this post down.

Beautiful location. The rooms are clean and modern. I has the deluxe suite. Room was bigger than expected. The bathroom was large with a tub and shower. The hotel is on the tram line with Aria, Monte Carlo and the Bellagio. You are so close to the Bellagio you just walk across a walkway to get to it. The tram is close as well. I love that this hotel is like a hideaway right in the middle of all the hype if city center. You are also right next to the Cosmo. The hotel is smoke free and has no casino. These were a plus for me. If it is for you, this is the place to be. O and the staff were great. The concierge was knowledgeable and got us on the lists for clubs and a pool party.

My group got upgraded from our original suite to the hospitality suite so my review will encompass that experience. 

The Vdara gives you a great sense of luxury and comfort from the very start. The hotel offers free valet and we gave the bell hop's all our luggage including drinks and food and they brought it up to the rooms on their own. 

The room itself was extremely spacious. We fit a group of 9 into the space with ease. Anything we needed was brought up. From silverware to cleaning. 

The rooms were cleaned in the morning and again touched up around 6 pm. This ensured that we never ran out of supplies. 

The beds were extremely comfortable and each living space offered a separate climate control. Bath was large enough for our larger males to use with comfort. At the end of the trip this hotel offered complimentary limo service back to the airport. 

I found several deals on Groupon for similar rooms. Would come back. Downside is no on site casino,  but Aria is within 3 minutes of walking from the front desk.

Birthday Shenanigans  oh ya ! Came here on the weekend of my birthday and loved my stay here. 

Pros: 
1. Rooms are pretty spacious, I was able to accommodate my whole party 
2. Having the ability to get extra room keys with no problem
3. Non-smoking which was heaven for me since I have asthma 
4. Housekeeping provided us with as many towels\/linens\/blankets as we needed 
5. 5 minute walk from Marquee dayclub\/nightclub

Cons: 
1. Finding the valet area was a nightmare, all three cars got lost in the process. 
2. Only valet parking service is offered by the hotel, making it pretty inconvenient when we were in a rush to go somewhere
3. No pedestrian walkways\/ sidewalks around the actual hotel itself. Any time we wanted to get on the actual strip we had to either walk through Aria or Cosmopolitan. 

Final Verdict: 
Pros outweigh Cons, Thumbs up in my book!

This is a beautiful and aesthetically pleasing hotel to stay at! My friends and I have visited twice. We've stayed in the Panoramic Suite & the 2 Bedroom Penthouse. Service was always nice as we would often ask for extra towels, blankets, and pillows. 

**The Penthouse came with 4 complimentary passes to their Spa Utility which was very nice!!**

The suite and penthouse were like small apartments\/condos, which made the stay homey and feel extremely luxurious. The only cons would be the lack of restaurants, casinos, and plazas within the hotel, but a 5 minute walk could take you to The Strip or Bellagio (which is connected to Vdara).

Will definitely be coming back and recommend this Vdara for a luxurious and pleasant stay in Sin City!

I really liked the hotel. Its really modern and clean. The spa is amazing and totally worth going. Im taking a star away because they did not offer early check in and there is nothing to do in the hotel.

We have stayed here once a year for the last three years. We always think about staying somewhere else, but end up here. Two things I like about the Vdara, that may be a reason why some wouldn't want to stay here. One: No smoking. I don't smoke. With so much smoke everywhere in Vegas it's nice to come back to the hotel away from it. Two: no casino. I'm not a huge gambler. I like coming back after a night out and it's an easy trip up to my room. Now if one you smoke or two you are an avid gambler, this may be a disappointment  to you. 

Upon driving up to the hotel, the gentleman out front begin the awesome service that the Vdara offers. The bellman start by helping you unload your car to be brought to your room when you are ready. The valet then takes your car and you are set for check in. The wait to check in is not long. After a long drive it's nice for such a simple process of getting up to your room.

The rooms themselves are beautiful with wonderful views. We have been lucky enough to have views of the Bellagio fountains. All rooms are suites. The room this year that we had was the executive sweet. We had a living room, full kitchen with dining area, one and a half baths and a separate bedroom. Don't forget the in room washer and dryer. It was basically a small apartment. 

Also the fitness center is very nice. My husband enjoys the spa area after a night of drinking. I usually enjoy either one of their facials or massages. Both well worth the money. 

It is a short walk to the Aria and the Cosmopolitan for your gambling needs.  

Most likely we will stay here again next year.... Just can't beat it.

I stayed here for just 1 night tacked on to a weekend family reunion at another hotel; I'm still trying to find a "go-to" Vegas hotel with nice rooms at reasonable rates and hopefully a good comps program attached.  For a 5-star hotel, Vdara was a mixed bag.  It is definitely a good price for such a high-quality hotel.  The front desk was cheerful and accomodating, and when I got to the rooms (which I think are all suites?) i was very impressed with the kitchenette\/living room\/bedroom layout.  The bathroom was clean and very spacious with a nice deep tub and separate shower.  Unfortunately the towels weren't stocked as well as I'd have liked, there was only 1 face towel.  Also, the previous reviews mentioning getting anything from housekeeping is true: I waited 20 minutes for a corkscrew before calling again and waiting another 15 after that; they blamed it on a malfunctioning elevator.  I also tried out the room service which was very professional and tasty to boot.  I went over to the Aria to gamble a little but was disappointed they don't even bother to track table game players wagering less than $25 a hand.  Guess I'm just spoiled by Reno; next time I'll ante up and see what I get for my paltry action, if anything.

In a nutshell:  very nice rooms with great views.  The employees I met in person were all very nice and professional.  Housekeeping was a pain trying to get stuff from.  I liked the laid-back no-smoking no-gaming atmosphere, but with all of that in walking distance.

Rooms are big and views from the upper floors can be stunning. A few things need to be changed, though. Called for extra sheets and it took more than 30 minutes for housekeeping to come up. The water pressure in the shower was poor and for a place that wants to market itself as a high end hotel, this is not acceptable. There is a $22.40 resort fee every day, which includes WiFi so I guess I paid $22.40 for WiFi daily. The exterior already had broken glass\/plastic on the floor above us that we could see from the window. The sofa bed is not comfortable.

Check-in was easy as was check-out. There is no casino, which can be either good or bad depending on your personal preferences. Also there isn't really a restaurant but the deli does sell bottled drinks and alcohol. If you want to walk to another casino, you can walk mostly indoors to the Bellagio, which is a plus, but if you want to go to the Cosmopolitan, you have to walk outside and down the stairs then across the driveway leading to the hotel. All in all it was fine but I don't think I would stay again.

Danielle at valet was very rude. She dropped my valet card on the ground and didn't even say sorry. Later on when I went to pick up the car (which took forever) she gave me a horrible attitude. The valet is the face of the hotel and the first people I meet when I walk in. I shouldn't be treated that way.

I hate cigarette smoke and it's practically inevitable to escape it when in Vegas,  unless you stay at Vdara Hotel :) because they don't have a casino.

After walking around through cigarette smoke infested casinos, coming back to our hotel was like heaven. The minute you walk through the doors, you smell the freshness of being in a spa. It was definitely relieving and it's what I loved most about this hotel.

Other than that, the rooms are very spacious, modern, and clean. Elevators are quick. The hotel connects to the Bellagio and Caesars Palace, so we didn't have to walk too much under the hot sun. I would stay here again.

Stayed at Vdara for one night.  Check-In took about 35min, they had 3 front desk staff available and about 5 other guests in front of me.  They took their time to upgrade us to a Bellagio view room which was nice.  However, few minor issues with our room, light under the kitchen sink stopped working & the bathroom sink was draining water very slow. Didn't bother to call and complain since we were just there for one night. Checked out via television and decided to call to provide my email address for a copy of the folio & that's when I decided to provide them with issues we had. Front desk said, "oh yea your room is actually scheduled for maintenance today".  If that was the case, why would you even let a guest stay in that room knowing you would be doing maintance that next day? Left to pick up our vehicle from valet and geeze, if we knew it was going to take an hour to get our car we would've checked out sooner.  Anyway, I gave 3 stars because Vdara has that resort feel without the Las Vegas chaos surrounding you, but not sure if I would want to stay there again.

The Vdara pleasantly surprised me during my recent Las Vegas foray. Upon entering I was immediately greeted at the front desk by a gentlemen with a tablet computer who asked for my name. I gave him my info and he informed me that I had been upgraded to a penthouse suite. Now, I was staying by myself and now I had a room larger than my apartment. Awesome! I'm not sure why I need 4+ TVs in my room but it was awesome. 

For those of you complaining about the lack of food options. You're seriously 50 feet from the Aria! Can you not walk across the street?! 

I personally love that fact that this is a no casino hotel. It means I don't have to snake through three miles of casino floor just to get back to my room. 

I will be staying here again.

Really enjoyed staying at this hotel. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Rooms were amazing. I would definitely stay here again. They only draw back is there are not a lot of dining option in the hotel itself. The hotel also is set pretty far back from the strip, so venturing out to get food or entertainment can be a bit of hike. Although, it does have very easy access to the Bellagio and the Aria.

Vdara is a solid 4 star hotel.  It is away from the hustle and bustle of the Vegas strip yet it is close enough that you can walk to the Aria and Bellagio casinos to gamble. Our view wasn't too impressive (the 15 frw) but I am sure that some rooms have a better view. 
The good: Nice large rooms and bathroom, friendly and fast service, Quiet, Modern, Aveeda products in the bathroom,
Needs improvement: Shower pressure is low, no coffee maker in the rooms, not too much going on in the hotel (not even a place to get a snack), the pool is very average
Would be nice: Robes in the hotel room, a small tv in the bathroom, bath bubbles for the wonderful tub
Vdara is not the best hotel that I stayed in Vegas but it is a solid choice for travelers who are not into the typical Vegas experience.

First time here and we will be back. From the initial greeting of the front desk staff, to the bellman that assisted us with our bags, the hospitality staff and all of the employees in the hotel, we could not have been treated more like royalty.

Our room was a corner suite which included a guest half bath, full separate kitchen, stackable washer and dryer, work area desk, pull out couch and a master suite with the most luxurious bathroom separate tub and shower dual vanities and a wraparound interview that was breathtaking. 

If you have not stayed here before I highly recommend this property which is located in the center of all the action just one block off the strip.

We have found our second home away from home and will be back soon. Thank you Vdara!!

I don't know why I still really love this hotel .The location is hard to beat (centrally located in the City Center, just across the street from Aria and The Cosmopolitan).

They've now added a few convenient additions to the lobby - a Starbucks and a cafe open until midnight.

The rooms are spacious and the wifi is super fast and dependable. The beds are super comfy and the suites come with a pull-out sofa (couch) so it can easily fit 4 people. The kitchenette is perfect for making coffee in the mornings (Just request thru housekeeping).

The resort fee has gone up to $32, but it does include wifi, 2 bottles of small water daily, and access to the gym. The gym is still awesome and has a good number of machines. Overall, Vdara offers everything you'd want in a quality "Boutique feeling" hotel  sans casino!

I love the fact that Vdara caters to those who wish to stay in the heart of the strip, but do not wish to contend with gamblers, partiers, and smokers. This is definitely the hotel for me! 

Beautifully appointed, modern rooms, large garden tub, kitchenette, and a view of Bellagio fountains. The rooms are quiet and have automatic blackout shades, comfy beds, and ample lighting.

Try the Rosés are Red drink in the Vice Versa bar! It tastes like summer! For wine lovers, their house Cabernet is better than most!

Consistently great service from all hotel staff, from the front desk to the bartenders. Vdara is an a-typical Vegas hotel experience, and I'm absolutely a fan!

Summary - Upscale hotel with some service deficiencies

Pros - Great views, modern attractive suites, comfortable bed, excellent spa, easy to get to room (compared to other Vegas Hotels).  Nice soaking tubs that fill up fast.

Cons - Hit or miss service, below average valet service, pull out bed as bad as they get.

The rooms are clean, comfortable, quite and attractive.  The panoramic suites have great views of the city - the city corner suites aren't quite as nice but still have good views.  The spa at the hotel is one of the best anywhere.  There is no casino in the hotel (which is actually a plus for me) so it is easy to get to your room without walking through 500 yards of smoke before making it to the elevators.  There is a short walkway that connects the hotel to the Bellagio and the Aria is about 100 yards away for gambling and better food.  

If you have a car you will be required to use the valet service, which is horrible at this hotel.  On our last trip we were there 5 days and when we tried to call down to have them bring out our car they never answered the phone.  One time we wanted to run across to the Aria Hotel to grab a quick coffee and asked went to the valet desk to ask them to bring out our car so we could pick it up in 20 minutes - they refused.  When we checked out of the hotel we brought our baggage and valet claims to the bell desk, who told us we couldn't give them to the desk and had to go flag down someone outside.  Bottom line is that the employees weren't helpful - especially for a hotel that wants to be upscale.  We never waited less than 10 - 15 minutes for them to bring out our car.  The good news is that if you don't drive to the hotel you can bypass the valet.  

Housekeeping was generally good and the staff was friendly.  The only exceptions were occasionally (3 times during a 5 day stay) they would show up at our room to bring us things we didn't order.  This really wasn't a big deal except one time someone at hotel called after we explained that we didn't order any plates and in a demanding voice wanted to know exactly what we ordered.  "Nothing" we explained again - it was really weird.

I spent several days in the Vdara and was delighted with the room I was staying.  I know, you're probably thinking, " you were in Vegas what were you doing in your room?" I'm not much of a gambler and my knees\/back are ache all the time due to being an idiot when I was in my twenties.  I was also out in vegas for a friends wedding, enough with the excuses though.

The room itself has to be one of the best hotel rooms I've stayed in.  The room and bathroom were huge and it even had a cook top, fridge, and small sink.  It is also just far enough from the main strip that I could see it but didn't have to deal with the nightly rowdiness. 

Now I'm thinking that most people who go to Vegas go to gamble or see shows.  That is where the Vdara was great to stay in for me.  The Vdara doesn't have a casino attached to it but the Aria and the Cosmopolitan are literally the next buildings over.  So if I did want to spend a few dollar I could have just walked over, my knees would have hated me but hey you only live once.  If I wanted to see a show the Main strip wasn't more that a tram ride or 10 minute walk as well. 

There is a Starbucks, nice little bar, and separate restaurant\/store on the first floor.  All of which while great, pale in comparison to the great eats in Vegas.

If you're headed to Vegas to hang out and don't want to deal with children running around or the annoying smut peddlers I suggest you check in to the Vdara.

This place is sweet. Complimentary valet, non smoking, need I say more?

The breakfast is and guest services is amazing, me an my new fiance have no complaints.
The rates are great even during BIG weekends.

Will return!

I honestly expected a little more from Vdara. The suite was nice and spacious and the view spectacular but it was missing a few details especially in the bathrooms. First of all, lack of shelves and space to put your stuff. We're chicks! We have A LOT of stuff! Then lack of hooks, as in there was only one. One! C'mon really? One hook for such a large bathroom made no sense. The furniture including the bed were not that comfy. Kinda thin and 'springy'. The room service along with housekeeping were phenomenal tho! We ordered in quite a few times and it was delicious and the service extremely pleasant and courteous. Expensive tho. Wi-fi, forget it, worst connection EVER. Elevators were fast, you do have to show ur key card to get up to ur room FYI. The hotel has no casino so it's quieter, less smoky, and more laid back. Check in was pretty fast but then again it was a Thursday so I'm sure it gets crazy for the weekend. Valet services were good but the guy didn't help us with our bags when were leaving! Wtf! For the price and location (off strippish) I expected a lil more. Encore is still my number 1.

I have nothing negative to say, just leaving. It was such a perfect room with great service, the Vdara is extremely sanitary and smells so clean. Will definitely be returning to my next visit here in Vegas.

I'm not surprised this place has a 3.5-star average. A clear step below Wynn\/Encore, Bellagio, Cosmo for wow factor. It's very nice.  It's just not that nice. As the review count has piled up I'll limit mine to a few tips in summary of our stay.

THE SAGA WITH THE VIEW:
Though we booked from an external travel site as a part of a package, don't be misled by the "upgraded view."  Wife booked & added a modest upgrade (additional fee) on the travel site to get a room with a view.  Called right after booking to inquire and\/or request a Bellagio fountain view.  Told "No prob, call back on morning of your stay (2 mos later) to confirm."  

[You guessed it gentle reader ! ]  Morning of, Desk Agent #1 @ hotel--"you are confirmed for 'pool view,' that is all your reservation guarantees, cannot offer you more."  
Wife--"but we don't arrive until midnight."  She is given number for "external reservations agent."
Agent #2 --"Sure, no prob, you are confirmed for a Fountain view. Enjoy your stay."

Arrive on delayed flight @ 1am Las Vegas time [You guessed it !, dang, you're good, reader!]     Desk Agent:  "So sorry, we could not confirm that preference for your booking. But you do have a pool view!"  [pool view= overlooking taxi pull up of Aria, & if lean face against window, can see pool sitting in its vacant, winter glory.]  

Wrapping up the long part:  they did move us to Fountain view on floor #31 (Room 31-008) the next day.  Completely worth the move!  Views= incredible @ a fraction of the price of a Cosmopolitan fountain terrace room.

STAFF OTHERWISE:  Elevator guys, business center attendant, doormen, front desk, & taxi stand guy are all very pleasant to deal with.  

ROOM LAYOUT & FEATURES:  Other reviews are accurate--bed is comfy, tv is good, bathroom is spacious, in-room art is pleasant. Blackout shades are far from it, but we mostly slept in the 2-9a range, not living la vida loca, so we were ok.

HOUSEKEEPING:  Rooms both clean. Daily service was poor. Didn't pick up glasses in room (cough:::carried over from another resort); left us without a single hand towel when making up room after Day #2. Wife called requesting turndown service on Day #1 @630 pm, told "sorry, need to request before 5" !!

SHOWERHEADS:  Oh yes, believe those other reviews.  This place boasts its "green" qualifications.  Why would anyone think they would stop short of small-capacity toilets, and restrictive-flow shower heads ?  This is not the rainforest shower you were hoping to wash away all the tension in your life.  It's true... you're going to have to work at removing the conditioner in your hair.  Wife took all baths, with exception of a single shower to wash hair, during our stay.

WALKING TO OTHER RESORTS:  Aria is easy, stay left of the taxi stand, take the sidewalk; don't go right, you'll have to walk right through the middle of the driveway around taxi traffic!  Bellagio likewise is just a short walk way & you're there coming into the conference area, shops, garden, past front desk to the casino floor.  Cosmo was clearly re-planned when MGM sold it off.  You have to work to get there!  Best route: to the left by the taxi stand, down the outdoor staircase (you're then walking briefly through the service alley!) into the street level parking \/ taxi entrance to the floor of Cosmo (highly recommend the Chandelier Bar & Wicked Spoon buffet there).

THE VERDICT:  Since I started writing this review, I've changed from 4* to 3* back to 4* and finally *3.  You'll see what I mean when you stay.  Proximity to City Center\/ Bellagio \/ Cosmo & the possible view of fountains (but see above!) are awesome.  Stayed here after Encore & Wynn last 2 visits.  It's not in the same bracket as those.  We're unlikely to stay here again because of the choices available (and because I am a Steve Wynn nut).  But if you find good rate, when they're not full from conventions, book here with confidence.

My boyfriend and I stayed in one of the suites facing the Bellagio Fountain for two nights, and I cannot think of a single thing to complain about during my entire visit. The suite had a small kitchen, a living room with a couch, two tvs, a King sized bed and a spacious bathroom. The cleaning service was spot on: they thoroughly cleaned everything and even organized our belongings in the bathroom. The front desk was amazing too. They answered every question we had and were courteous and polite. This hotel is the sister hotel of the Aria, and doesn't have a casino. It's connected to the Bellagio hotel through an outdoor walkway and you can also access the tram  from this hotel. It's right by the Paris hotel and across the street from the Miracle Mile Shops. I only wish I had spent some more time at this hotel to really check out the bar and the pool. Will be definitely staying at this hotel whenever I come to Vegas.

Vdara is a great option for someone who wants comfort and a reasonable price in Vegas. I've stayed here twice and love the fact that it's easy to access other places on the strip but it's not overrun with crazy drunks and screaming party-ers. The bathroom was nice and the bed comfortable - ask for a view of the Bellagio. I drank champagne and stared out the window and was totally content.

1. Paper-thin wall: can hear my neighbor talking, opening\/closing their closet. 
2. Poor quality: they use cheap stuff to decorate their room, shower is tiny. 
3. Very noisy: loud music coming from the pool all day long...and it's the same song over and over...I was on the highest floor.
4. Horrible customer service.
Made a reservation for Vdara through Get A Room.  Vdara wouldn't honor it and wanted to move me to The Signature.  Rooms at standard rates were still available.  Looks like a "bait and switch" game!

Always love staying at this hotel. air is clean, rooms are very clean as well.   No self parking available which is not an issue because their valet services are very good.  Their valet parking garage is right next to the hotel, so retrieving your car is lickity split fast. Non smoking hotel and no casino located on premise. 

rooms are very spacious and nicely laid out, there is a small kitchen area that includes table seating for 4, sink area, kitchen cabinet space and a mini frig.  Flat screen tv and sofa seating for at least 2.  Bathrooms are very spacious with separate shower and large soaking tub. 

room service food is always delicious.  jumbo shrimp cocktail comes with 6 on a plate, chicken wings were flavorful and crispy, only downside was their minestrone soup... tasted more like tomato sauce.  overall, great room service experience.

This is a lovely tranquil hotel on the strip. 
Its one of the newest as it was built as part of the new city center and all though it is pretty central on the strip you hardly sense it. 

It has no casino but the value you get for a suite is unbelievable. We had a Panoramic Suite for less than $120 per night. 

The view was phenomenal. 

My one nag would be that it is VERY difficult to find the pedestrian entrance at night... especially if you have had a few drinks!

This was my first time at Vdara and I was excited for this "5 star" resort experience. Unfortunately, it felt more like a three star hotel room. The pull out bed was horrendous, even with the feather down pad that you have to request. They don't provide cots and they talk to you on the phone like you're bothering them somehow. The regular bed was fine though. 
The room layout was not what the front desk rep described and was not very intimate or private. 

The internet was unreliable and it took some time and effort to get the front desk on the line to ask for a late checkout and for your car to be pulled up from valet, both of which they could and would not do for you. I did not feel valued or very welcomed as a guest and it was an overall disappointment. I would not recommend this hotel to friends. Frankly, the best part of the room was the view and bath robe.

Just don't stay here.  We chose this property for the smoke free and gambling free aspects so we would feel comfortable with our daughter.  There are no good restaurants and the pool was so windy they sent us to Aria.  Aria had a way better pool, but there was smoking and not another kid.  In fairness, the whole cheapo, weekend gettaway, family vacay during our daughters Spring Break was a bad idea.  Kids are just not a great idea for Vegas, despite all the kid friendliness that is suggested online.

Great experience on the 55th floor. The only problem was the phone line did not work in suite. We could not order blankets for the pull out bed or room service. I was not going to go down to casino each time I needed towels and sheets. That was The only issue I had. Great vibe and love the view!

This is a beautiful, modern hotel with nice rooms, but it is not for me. Too far to walk to anywhere good and I miss having a casino right there. Aria and bellagio are nearby, but neither of these are great places to gamble if you are a low roller like me.

A couple of positive notes: the beds are great, the tub is nice (but is smaller than it looks and fills up fast), the little fridge and kitchen area are nice and the elevators are fast. We are on the 50th floor and have a great view, but can hear the freeway pretty loudly. Also the blackout curtains are pretty useless. The toiletries are ok, kinda generic looking, but according to the literature placed in the bathroom, they are "specially formulated". They work ok and smell vaguely of baby shampoo.

Anyway, if you are on a business trip and hate Vegas (i.e., not me at all), this is probably a great choice for a hotel.   I probably wouldn't stay here again personally unless the price was amazing here and terrible everywhere else.

Loved this hotel. Check in only took about 3 minutes!

We stayed in the executive corner suite and it was perfect. Our room was definitely impressive. It was very quiet and peaceful. We had 1 full bathroom attached to our bedroom- bath tub, shower and two vanity sinks, a second mini guest bathroom near the entrance of the room, a huge living room area, four person dining table, washer\/dryer, built in security box, a kitchen in a separate room and a small office work area. 

I loved the convenience of the washing and drying machine, we were able to do all our laundry before leaving-saves us the trouble of having to do it back home. The full kitchen was perfect as it allowed us to warm up our leftover food easily. The kitchen included a Keurig machine, a dish washer, microwave oven, stove and huge refrigerator\/freezer. The hotel is valet only and it saves us the time to drive around and look for parking, it only takes us less than 2 minutes to drop our car off at the valet line and head straight to our room.

Security here is good as well, your room cards will be checked before you enter the room elevators and enter the pool area. Housekeeping staff did a very nice job cleaning our room everyday, check in staff was nice and pool attendants were very attentive. 

I like the doorbell in front of the room, the powered shade\/blackout curtains and the house keeping\/do not disturb button.

Wish I could've stayed longer! Next time, we will be back with our little dog.

We stayed her last year and had all the essentials we needed. We of course thought we would book our stay again. We are very disappointed this time. They have taken all the essentials out of the room such as a coffee pot, silverware and plates. We asked about the coffee pot and the response is that you can have one for $20 a day. We suggest you go to Starbucks in the lobby. It is $6.00 for just a regular large coffee. I asked who to lodge a complaint to, and the suggestion was to say something on your exit survey. That does not make sense, especially since the stay will be over and the general manager Mary Giuliano has a message to contact any team member for anything to make your stay more enjoyable. At $250 a night you expect at the minimum to have morning coffee.

Love, love, loved it! Now every other hotel I stay in has to live up to this experience. The fiance and I were there for an entire week and it seriously felt like home.

Customer Service: Really quick. We got everything we requested within one or two hours, no matter what time of the day it was. Everyone was nice and friendly.

The Room: Comfortable. Clean. Modern. I would totally like to steal their interior decorator. It's a shame the vanity is a single but that counter space is to die for. I didn't understand the bedding. It was a sheet that covered the comforter and then the flat sheet? The sheets were scratchier than expected for the amount of stars.

The Amenities: We only hit the gym, which wasn't 24 hours (bummer). Do they think people don't work out at night? Limited hours but we made it work. Gets a little crowded but outfitted with TVs, water bottles, towels, and magazines.

I don't even know why their wasting my time or theirs.

I post a review then they reply to my review and then they don't follow up like they said they would in their reply. 

Who gets these people?

Our go to hotel for Vegas. Very good house keeping service and very friendly staff. I love the fact that it doesn't have night clubs or casino, so you can relax very well in the hotel. You can easily walk to aria for great food and for gambling. That's what we do all the time.

Long walk from the strip to hotel. Best part of the whole week was when I got my "RESORT FEE" 4 days $84.00.
$84.00 for what. November? winter? I guess walking by the pool is worth $84.00
Don't get me wrong it is nice the room was great but thats all.

I am checking out tomorrow and this was a bad enough experience that I am taking my time to let folks know.  I booked a corner suite for my wife and I and a deluxe suite for my two daughters.  I was willing to paya bit more for this hotel becaue it represents itslef to be an "all suite"hotel.  Unless you book a corner suite, the other suites are just rooms with a kitchenette.  The TV did not work in the corner suite and I got a recorded message saying they valued our privacy enough that they were not fixing the TV?  The deluxe suite had a horrible mattress and the room in this non-smoking hotel reeked of smoke and the room next door has a frat party that is continuing to rage on as I make this post.  Also, do not be fooled into thinking this hotel is "on the strip."  Get ready for planes, trains and automobiles just to get to the strip.

I will pass on Vdara next time and I haven't even checked out yet.

The spa was nice and I had a great massage.  Otherwise, no me gusta.

This was my staging ground for the epic fail Rock and Roll Las Vegas 1\/2 Marathon on 12\/4\/2011. Big ups to fellow Yelper Hideki K. for securing this room via Jetsetter. We had 6 people rooming up in this spacious corner suite with 2 beds. We were on the 35th floor with gorgeous views of the Rio in the distance. Luckily for me, my room mates were quite the partiers and clubbers, so I got to sleep in one of the beds for both nights I was there.

The Vdara hotel was as amazing as it is. Its quite sqanky as it was luxurious. Its connected to the Bellagio, so you can manuevor in between the hotels. There is the tram to go to the Monte Carlo from the Vdara, so that was a free option for me. I learned the hard way, when I had to spend $15 to go from the Vdara to the Mandalay Bay, when I could've did the trams from Vdara to Monte Carlo, walk to Excalibur and take the tram to Mandalay Bay. Ugh. I guess that's the price for being fast.

The Vdara's lobby was pretty classy, but normal for Vegas, as it was supposed to be as large and exquisite as it gets. I haven't seen the casino yet at the Vdara, so I can't comment on that. Do they have a casino? LoL. But yeah, it was a nice, posh property to be in. Recommended totally!!!

This is my first time in Vegas and loved it! The Vdara is beautiful, new and quiet! The staff is wonderful and very helpful! The rooms are extremely clean and housekeeping is really on top of keeping the rooms clean and tidy. Our view was awesome! We got a room looking out at the fountain and strip! There is no casino floor which is a huge plus to us because we came to town for work so there are no lines waiting for cabs to go out or come back during any time of the day. There's no having to walk through a huge casino to get to and from your room. This price is decent for the quality. Our next time here we will for sure be staying here again!!!

This place is gorgeous!  I went to Vegas for business and got an amazing suite with a small kitchen, beautiful bathroom with a large garden tub, a shower, a living room area and a king size bed.  Everything was clean and the room service while you are there are very thorough.  The room service is fast and delicious - expensive but what do you expect for room service in Vegas.  The staff are all very accommodating and they offer the ability to check out on your cell phone - you don't even have to go to the desk.  Would love to stay here again.

This hotel just screams "make love to me." Originally this started as a relaxing\/peaceful solo birthday trip and I wanted a hotel that reflected just that. After 2 people hopped on the bandwagon it turned into a girlfriends trip. Keep in mind that all 3 of us are laid back easy breezy type of people so there wasn't a need to change hotels. From booking the hotel (through MLife) to the checking in, process was super duper easy. At check in I was afraid to try the $20 trick so I just casually asked if there was any complimentary upgrades and was upgraded from a regular city view room to a room on the 43rd floor with a Bellagio fountain\/high roller\/Paris view which was awesome. Then I asked the check in clerk was it ok for me to tip him because I wasnt sure if it was appropriate or not and he said "only if you want to" so I gave him the $20. For some reason, those check-in people just look too poised\/immaculate to accept tips...IMO. Anyway, up to the room we go after presenting the elevator attendant our room key (already I feel safe). Ok, I havent traveled in 2 years and the last time I checked into a hotel I had to swipe a room key, well at the Vdara you just wave the room key in front of the would be key hole...I love it, its the smallest things that mean so much to me lol. As soon as I opened the door I was wishing I had brought the boyfriend along. Lets just say we probably wouldnt have left the room. Wall to wall windows with excellent views of the bellagio fountain and paris hotel. Deep jacuzzi like tub, perfect for bubble baths and separate stand alone shower. For some reason housekeeping kept bringing just 1 washcloth and about 6 towels. That wasn't a problem though because when we called they were there in less than five minutes. And housekeeping did come daily (without request) but prior to my stay and reading countless reviews, I read that they only come upon request. Bed a little to soft for my liking but nothing to complain about. Blackout shades and curtains work by some remote thingy on the wall which was cute but that got old after the first day. Returning to the hotel after a drunken night you can forget about closing the shades. Even though this hotel sits off of the strip a little I loved the fact that when returning to the hotel at the end of a long hot Vegas day of walking and touring you don't have to wrestle through a smokey, crowded and loud casino constantly saying excuse me and dodging people with club passes just to get to your room. And if all of that tickles your fancy at any point of your stay just walk across the roundabout to Vdara's sister the Aria and get your fix which I did. Glad I did too because I won $542.26+$89.05 Because this hotel is off the strip, other than staying there, it's no other reason for outsiders to be there. Hence the peacefulness and relaxation.
For some reason 2 of the things that stuck out to me the most was, 1 when my girlfriend went down the hall to get some ice she left the door cracked, within 30 seconds of her being gone a hotel employee knocked on the door to make sure we were ok and if we were aware that the door was open. I told you I felt safe. And 2, the tv had my name on it lol. I told you it's the little things that mean so much to me:)
All in all Vdara has spoiled me with the peace and serenity so I will definitely be back. Just hope I can get a comped or heavily discounted room.

I wish I could live at Vdara! This hotel is super chic and clean! I love that it's smoke-free and has no casino. The staff, especially the front desk gives exceptional service. I work in the customer service industry and I wish whoever teaches the Vdara staff would come to my work and teach us a thing or two about customer service! 
The rooms are not your typical Vegas resort style rooms, it's not huge, but it's comfortable. I stay in hotels weekly for work, but wouldnt dare take a bath in any of the bathtubs (I stay at Hilton and Sheratons)but the tub at Vdara was spotless! 
Will definitely be staying here again.

Beautiful! Vdara sent a car out to pick us up from the airport & as soon as we arrived. A fruit basket was delivered to our room. As soon as we unpacked our bags, we left the hotel to grab a bite. When we came back, our belongings were neatly placed away. (The housekeeper placed all my makeup brushes on a white towel and they hung all my clothes in the closet.)  We were on the top floor penthouse with an amazing view. Smoking is prohibited, which is a PLUS in my book. I enjoyed coming down to the lobby without feeling like I'm suffocating from smoke.

2nd time staying at the Vdara a lot has changed for the better checked in with their early check-in on the mobile app it was super simple we showed up in the lobby they literally handed us our keys and we went up to the room. The Hotel layout is so well thought out instead of the rooms going deep from the door to window, the are shallow with the longer wall containing all the exterior windows. The views are spectacular we were only on the 38th floor but could see the entire eastern side of the valley, the Bellagio fountains, High Roller at Linq and Paris Eiffel tower...Beautiful. Lots of access to the neighboring resorts Aria, The Cosmopolitan and The Bellagio, easily get to the strip or hang out in a great space with everything you need already here. Thanks Vdara.

It's funny, sometimes when you find yourself whining and bitching like a little baby, it seems so appropriate at the time, then some time after, you really feel like a freaking idiot.

My assistant booked a stay here for business, and did it on Hotwire.  In general, when booking a 5-star Hotel using their service I'm usually fine with her doing it and don't care.  In this case, I was livid.  A Hotel with no casino in Vegas?  Blasphemy.  A Hotel not directly on the strip?  Well my God I might as well have booked in LA and driven to the strip.  A Hotel with no club?  Impossible.

In fact I was so pissed I got on the phone with them and, "blah blah blah, I'll never use your service again, you are the worst thing to happen to humanity, etc, etc; insert some tears and expletives; blah blah blah".......and still stuck there.

Then post stay, revert back to paragraph 1.  Not the first time nor the last I've made a horses a*s out of my self and then had to admit it later in my own mind.

I absolutely loved the Hotel.  The rooms are modern and gorgeous.  The pool and spa areas are excellent.  And ultimately not having a Casino there when you are Zombie walking back to your room is not only refreshing, but probably saved me more money than I care to admit in not wasting money at tables in a state where you have no business even being awake.  No smoke, no noise, no nonsense.  No getting sucked back in for multiple more cocktails you don't need.  It's like an island respite in the middle of the madness, which was just really, really refreshing.

And my concern of it being in "Antarctica"?  Its a 2 second walk from Aria.  Also getting cabs\/transpo out was a breeze, as you don't have a million wastoids in line from the casino.

I would definitely stay again.

Vdara was an awesome place to spend my weekend in Vegas. They upgraded my friends and I to a corner suite with a great view of the strip. I don't believe we were charged for the internet - it was included in the mandatory $18 hotel fee. Our room was cleaned every day, and housekeeping was very attentive to our needs.

I love the simple and modern layout of this place. There is a little market and cafe right downstairs. I also appreciate the fact that there's no casino, because it doesn't smell like smoke and you don't have to navigate through a million slot machines just to exit the hotel.

Really a nice place to stay if you don't need or want a casino in your hotel. I really enjoyed the smoke free lobby and short walk to my room.
The staff were friendly throughout the hotel. I was there for only 1 night, but found myself pool side twice. They played fun music, but not ridiculously loud. They could've used 1 more waitress poolside to take and deliver orders.
All the rooms are suite style, king bed on 1 side and a sitting area with a pull out couch on the other. There's a small kitchenette area which they hotel says they'll bring dishes up if you need them. I liked the large bathroom too.
The hotel is a short walk to Cosmopolitan and even closer to Aria.

Pros:

Beautiful rooms
Real close to the Bellagio

Cons:

Pathetic help:  from front desk to housekeeping to pool help. Something is real wrong with HR. 

A MAJOR HIKE to the Strip, or anywhere except the Bellagio. 

Nothing to do there except hang out in the  beautiful room.

This hotel may not have a casino but it's walking distance to Aria and you can gamble etc. there. Vdara is all suites which are very clean and decorated in contemporary fashion. The staff also provides excellent service. Our bell boy even gave us a tour of the room and all its functions when he came to deliver our luggage. The rates were not bad as well. I will definitely consider re-booking at this hotel when coming back to Vegas.

Astonoshing hotel. We booked a Vdara Suite and were complimentary upgraded to a City Corner Suite. The view is breathtaking. You can see the city center and the strip from the 180 degrees panoramic window. It is a huge room that has a full kitchen, washer\/dryer, dining table, living room, and two bathrooms. Definitely the nicest hotel room I've ever stayed at! The front desk staff was very nice as well. I shall post pictures so you can see our room.

I love this place, I would have gave it 5 stars but when I got my room the floor was soaking wet and I learned that the aircon was leaking. They immediately offered to switch my room, but I already started drinking, and didn't want to move. This place is a good modern sexy joint for you and some others. There's a fold out couch, incase your random strangers decide to crash the night away. Anyway, there's a stove, a dining area, a microwave, and an awesome bathroom. Vdara has an amazing view to the strip as well. City center is the place to be if you're trying to be on the central strip. Otherwise I really liked staying here because there wasn't a casino down below, it was retail....my favorite!

I stayed Memorial Day weekend of 2017.

Cons:
Only complaint I have is how ridiculous the parking situation can be. If you are like my boyfriend who doesn't use valet parking for anything then you won't like the parking situation. The closest self parking lot was at the Aria. I think we paid roughly $45 (left the car there until we checked out) the 3 days we stayed at Vdara. 

Pros:
I booked through the hotel website which gave me the option of paying for early check-in. I did, also you can do mobile check-in through this up to 24 hours prior to your arrival. I checked in on my phone around midnight the Friday we were arriving. We left LA area around 3:30 am arrived in Las Vegas around 7 am. After breakfast we walked around one of the hotels and I got an email that our room was ready it was already 9 am at this point. Not bad.

Arrived at check out desk they have a separate line for mobile check-in don't have to wait as long. Check in was easy!

The room was absolutely perfect, the view was amazing. We got the Fountain View Suite.

I wasn't planning on checking out late on that Sunday but we called that same morning and asked if we could and they said no problem just added the additional charge. Late check out is 2 pm. Which was awesome considering the night before we were out until 5 am!

This hotel is beautiful. It has the best smelling carpet of any hotel I've ever been in, like they must shampoo their carpet everyday. The rooms are spacy. We had a corner suite, it was about 850 sq. feet. More than enough room for 4 dudes. The room itself is luxurious. The complimentary shampoo and soap is specially made from Australia, had to google that. This place is located in the middle of the strip, behind the Cosmopolitan. There are back entry into the Bellagio and a tram that will take you to Aria and Monte Carlo. You can also walk to the Aria. Vdara has a nice gym, it's small but gets the job done. Pool is basic, nothing special.

Just a few knocks on this place. Parking is ship (don't wanna curse). You can either self park in Aria for 10 dollars a day. Or you can pay for valet 18 dollars a day. The self park is at Aria and I would consider that pretty far walking to Vdara, like 5-10 minutes maybe. Can we call an engineering flaw? The valet parking is no good, why pay 18 dollars a day for probably the slowest valet service on the Strip. Their valet is just incredibly unorganized. Maybe they have a contract with Payless Car Rental, who knows.     

Haters gonna hate. There's no casino or club in Vdara. As a young club rat, I was not a fan that I had to walk to Aria to follow my dreams of winning 100 million dollars and bad itch (rap song quote). Because that's all we really want in life right? 

Vdara is extremely classy and puts a nice calm resort in the middle of the strip. That's a good contrast to the craziness of Vegas.

Book the room for the 18th only to find out that they booked it for the 14th call to figure out what we can do about it was greeted by a rude this receptionist Miss Maggie it's not that Maggie was so rude it's more to the fact that I work in customer service and she had no customer service or Hospitality for my situation her answer to my question was it'll be an additional $300 if you want those dates great customer service or should I say great sense of being a Salesman and being at the room was already booked very frustrating when you're trying to do something nice for someone else and the person on the other end of the phone chooses not to help you but help themselves to your funds thanks again Maggie appreciate the hospitality

Since this was one of the newer hotels in Vegas I was anxious to check it out.  But I should have stayed somewhere else.  Let me just say not a 5 star resort more like a 3 star at most.

I have stayed in many hotels in Vegas, and this is the worst experience by far.  Upon arrival we had to wait almost 20min to check in.  It was 9pm on a Friday night and they only had one person working at the front desk.  I prepaid for my room before my arrival and upon check-in she informed me that I had to pay an additional $18.00 plus tax per night for some BS resort fee.  

I am not usually a person who complains and I am usually easy to please, BUT there are so many more things that made my experience an unpleasant one.

1. The room was very small and cluttered with too much furniture (Not what was posted on the site in square footage)

2. The water pressure sucks.

3. Every time I wanted my car from valet I would call in advance to request it and no one would answer the phone, I had to call multiple times in a row.

4. The same goes for customer service at the front desk (no one would answer the phone), poor customer service skills and not accommodating to your concerns.

5. They have a full kitchen minus the oven but it seems to me they do not want you to use it since there is no cookware, utensils, glasses, or plates. Just 2 coffee cups.

6. The AC\/Heat in the room did not work properly.  I am in my late 20's and it seemed like I was having hot flashes because their climate control is messed up.

7. Back to the BS resort fee, it is suppose to cover the daily paper, bottled water ,and coffee but no one brought those items to my room each day I was there (3 nights).

8. The day I checked out I noticed that there was a big scratch on my BMW and it was not there when I got there, so I had informed the valet and he told us we would have to speak with security and file a report.  It took over 35 min for the security guard to show up!!

Needless to say I WILL NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN!!!

Staying at Vdara was amazing. Our group had a high floor so we have a nice view of the Las Vegas strip. The suite was very spacious. It has a nice kitchenette and living room with a nice flat screen tv. The decor was very modern and cozy. One thing to note about staying here is that there is no casino below. So it was nice to return to our room with it not being too noisy or busy with people. This hotel is an easy walk to the Cosmopolitan and the Bellagio which neighbor the hotel. I would love to stay here again. Excellent service and rooms.

Really great service. The room was very clean and the fountain suite view overlooks the flat Nevada plains as well as the Vegas strip along with the Belagio fountain show.

Highly recommended!

We love staying at the Vdara. Every time we come to Vegas we make sure we spend at least one night at the Vdara so we can enjoy the beautiful panoramic view room complete with a full kitchen and beautiful bathtub with a view of the city. 
The service here is unparalleled...you'll feel well taken care of the moment you walk in. They have one of the nicest, most accommodating staffs of anywhere I've ever stayed and I love the robes and slippers that come with the rooms. I feel spoiled when I stay here. They also don't allow smoking anywhere in the building except outside near the valet and it's super clean feeling inside as a result. 
During the summer season their pool is beautiful too - on the smaller side compared to some of the bigger hotels but still beautiful and there's a big hot pool as well. They've got a great fresh food bar and snack shop downstairs too, complete with boars head snacks, sandwiches, etc. and a fairly large cold section for alcohol. They set you up to have everything within reach you need for a fun stay. 
Couldn't recommend this place enough!

This place is very nice. There is no smoking, no restaurants, and no casino. There is a Starbucks, and a bar to get drinks. Every room is a suite and is worth every penny you spend for it. For all your gambling and food needs, you can easily walk over to the Aria which is right next door.

Love this hotel!!!checked in last year in August to celebrate our anniversary and they gave us an upgrade. We were so shocked when we saw our room! It was an amazing panoramic city suite, the best room ever, jaw dropping view! Customer service was nice and the parking attendant gave us some tips for a free parking. Short walking distance to Bellagio as well. Thank u Vdara for the upgrade.

i want to give 4.25 stars

its very nice! has amazing rooms, there nice and big and reasonably priced! the rooms are very classy looking, good service at the front desk , they take the MLIFE card so that helps

the bad thing is that THERES NO CASINO
the good think about that is that theres no annoying dirty casino smoke smell but its vegas! you kinda want that feel! its a 7 minute walk to belaggio thats a good think but kinda bummed when you wanna gamble fast!! hahah and your tired... from all the walking

I really enjoyed my recent stay at the Vdara.

It was nice to be able to have a mini fridge in the room without having to pay $$ per day! 

It was also nice to be self contained, although I'm not sure who would really use the rest of the kitchen whilst in Vegas..?!

I really liked the large windows and electronic blackout blinds. We had a nice view overlooking the Vdara pool and the Aria across the road.

My one complaint would be that there is no indoor walkway to the other casinos. It might sound lazy but it is a luxury to avoid walking outside in the 115F desert heat to get to a casino or nice restaurant- especially if you sweat lots in the heat (!)

The modern esthetic of City Center is by far my favorite in Vegas (you can almost forget you're in Vegas- almost). Vdara itself has many positives in its favor and I would certainly stay here again. For one, its small (that's a good thing). No one wants to go schleping across a huge smoke filled casino in an attempt to find room elevators. The pleasant Vdara lobby (complete with a small cafe, bar (with a fantastic outdoor patio), and Starbucks) is perfect in size. I can glide right up to reception and than walk a few feet to the room elevators- perfect. Oh and there's no smoking in this joint. Yippee!! I can breath. I also appreciated that the hotel wasn't one giant ice box. Thank you for keeping the hotel at a reasonable temp. 

As for the rooms- I'm not sure why they wasted space on a full kitchen. You can bake a cake in your room if you so desire, although barely any pots are provided making the whole kitchen area confusing. I suppose for longer term business stays (I'm sorry you're stuck in Vegas for a prolonged business trip) it would be helpful, but I imagine most people stock the fridge with booze and ignore the cooking range. Perhaps this was originally imagined as condos that never came to fruition? At any rate, it was just weird. The bed was comfy, however there are no rooms with 2 queen beds. You have a king bed and a pullout couch, which can be converted into a bed. To my dismay I slept in the pullout couch for one night, and although it was rather creaky, it turned out to be surprisingly comfortable. 

I didn't make it to the pool (boo- all day conference and pool closes by 6pm or so), but I did book a facial (will write a separate review). Last thing- it was pretty convenient to some larger casinos- super close to Bellagio (including its tram), Aria and Cosmo.
