It includes the water, gym access, and internet. Many hotels do this, it's not unusual. 

Advice: Take advantage of the kitchenettes. Purchase some food to put in the fridge. Something we wished we would have done was place an order with Von's a few days ahead to have them deliver groceries on the day of arrival. This would have saved a ton of $.

Got a suite on the 52nd floor. 
If you have a M card, use that to get your room because we got a pretty good discount. 
Things to note is that, IMO I think it's better to park at cosmo self park instead of Aria. Great staff, great room. it's just so nice inside. You're right next to Aria and Cosmo. And you can take the rail to Belaggio.

And it's nice that it's not a casino. so no smoke smell here.

The Vdara Is one of my favorite hotels when I visit Vegas. They are a Non-smoking Non-Gaming property owned by the MGM Group and I prefer to this hotel for a couple reasons. While most people go to Vegas to go crazy and unleash, I prefer to unwind and the Vdara is comfortable and allows its guests to go out for fun or have a good time but come back to a calm and peaceful enviroment to rest. The rooms here are beautiful and offer great rates in comparison to other Vegas hotels rates'. The beds are comfortable, the rooms are spacious and the property is quiet. You don't have to worry about being woken up all night long by loud music or deal with drunk people passed outside the door to your room because this hotel, while not the most expensive, Is simply classy and they offer great amenities, and services. This property offers awesome customer service, a great location, and modern touches which are overlooked or simply outdated at many of the older properties.

Stayed here for one night as a Valentine's Day staycation with my partner. The hotel is valet only. The lobby was large, definitely gave off a luxury feel. Check-in was quick, and after inquiring about a late check-out, Alyssa, the front desk employee who assisted us, offered a complimentary 12pm checkout instead of 11, since another guest was booked for that room later in the day. Fine by us!

The room itself was just like the photos on their website - very modern furnishings. We were on Floor 20, and while our view did include Lake Bellagio, it was very off to the  end of the window, but nevertheless nice to look at night - didn't have to crane our necks or anything. I was expecting the view to be like that anyway, since Vdara is off the Strip and behind the Cosmopolitan, which dominates better views of the lake than Vdara.

We ordered room service, which promptly arrived in the estimated time. The server was very courteous and chatted with us as he set the kitchenette table with our meal, which was all elegantly plated. I ordered the Cedar Roasted Salmon with beurre blanc, with sides of polenta and butter-poached baby vegetables (it also came with a bread basket). My partner, who is vegetarian, ordered the Vegetarian pizza and Roasted Pita chips with spinach dip. For dessert we both ordered creme brulee. Everything tasted excellent!

The bed was super comfortable, I slept like a baby. Absolutely heard no noise from other rooms, and only one or two occasional noises from people using the elevator, since our room was right off it. I did want to use the shower in the morning, but didn't because I would've had to blow-dry my hair (which they already offer in the vanity drawer) and forgot my heat-protecting styling serum at home. Toiletries provided were shampoo, conditioner, body wash, facial soap, body lotion, and body soap.

Everything was mostly great, but a few things prevented me from giving this a full 5 stars:

- One of the lampshades was very wobbly - found this out by accident when I bumped into it. Are they supposed to be wobbly? Not sure what happened there, but figured for a luxury hotel it would be more secure.

- Robes only available upon request. 

- The toilet paper rod was also strange. Only one end was attached to the wall by design, and it wasn't secure either, so getting toilet paper meant being careful not to tilt the rod and have the roll fall off it. 

- 4 body towels, 2 hand towels, but only 1 face washcloth. 

- Mini-fridge is MUCH TOO SMALL, roughly half of it is usable space. While our dinner was delicious, there was also a lot of food, so storing it in the fridge overnight required re-plating the food on the saucers to fit. 

- The air conditioning system is very dusty. I noticed dust starting to accumulate on the dark surfaces, and floating in the air. That needs to be looked at.

Overall, though, it was a great stay - would've liked to stay here for an extra night, and hopefully will get to do so in the near future.

The Vdara valet damaged my friend's car, and they were not helpful at all. They didn't try to resolve the issue, and only did their best to fight against us. The customer service really needs a huge improvement before I would consider staying here again.
clean smoke free hotel with wonderful service! lovely room with huge bathroom and fully equipped kitchen.

If there was a choice I would choose half a star the room is nice and everything but the only problem is they were on locked down so we couldn't even enter our room for a goo amount of hours. Called font desk and they said to enter throw areas which were closed off. And they had to talk to there security and they said go to areas which was closed off to finally got to our room and called front desk asking for a discount n they said no that they are not responsible of the lock down that supposedly all the areas were open. Never stay here again rip off doesn't help there own customers out

This is one of my favorite hotels in Las Vegas. The rooms are all nice, clean and quiet. The service is good too. If you are looking for a top-notch room in the center of the strip, this is the place to go. The Vdara is much nicer than most of the other MGM hotels.

This was my third stay at Vdara. We mainly stay at this hidden gem now because it offers such large modern rooms with great views for usually a lower price as compared to casino hotels. For this stay we had booked a corner suite, but got upgraded to a panoramic suite after a nice sandwich tip. We had a gorgeous view wrapping suite on the 49th floor. With view of the front of the strip in the living room, views of the mountains in the bedroom, and views of the bellagio fountains from the bathroom\/soaking tub whats not to love? 

If you can deal with not having a casino then really give this hotel a shot. It is directly connected to the Bellagio and a short walking distance to Aria. A plus side is that the Market Cafe is now open later hours as compared to before. So if you really are thirsty or desire a snack you can get one at 11PM. Also, the pool is a bit smaller than Aria's so be prepared for it to be crowded unless you go early in the morning or evening. They have umbrellas up for use as shade for all chairs so its much appreciated in the hot 100 degree heat. Valet is also pretty efficient. I like being able to just take the elevator down to the lobby and walk up right to valet, rather than walking a mile through a casino to get to valet. 

All in all an enjoyable vacation and we'll be back!

Against my better judgment I decided to give the Vdara a whirl which is supposed to be comparable to the Trump, except it's on the south side of the strip.

First impressions: beautiful lobby; front-desk girl was flawless. The rest of our hotel experience? God-awful; The Vdara should be embarrassed and ashamed.

They act like being "eco-friendly" is a perk. 

--There's no water pressure so it took me a half hour to shower. 
--The maids do not service the rooms.

Boom. That's the definition of eco-friendly.

The hotel maids DID, however, STEAL my cute club clothes hanging in the closet; Lost and Found obviously said they don't have them.

Having a choice between 2 queens or a king is standard in most hotels; Not the Vdara. U get one king unless u pay double the price.

"Remember, insist on one king-sized bed -- because two queens is kind of gay." -- Stephen Colbert http:\/\/on.cc.com\/NsdThP 

...Did I mention there's no coffee maker? Cuz there's not one ... Imagine that. A 5-Star "resort" with no coffee maker. That's a basic amenity, folks.

If you want an upscale hotel on the strip book the Trump. It will not disappoint.

Aaah, The Vdara! Run away! Here, let me help you: 
http:\/\/www.trumphotelcollection.com\/las-vegas\/

I read a number of reviews (both good and bad) before deciding to stay here on a brief 40 hour Las vegas hiatus a few weeks ago.  I had never stepped foot inside the Las vegas City Center since it's completion in 2009 even though I visit the city\/Strip three times a year.

This is a nice hotel for many of the reasons a myriad of other posters have noted (clean, non-smoking, non-gaming, quiet, nice rooms).  

I stayed in the City Corner Suite which has 1 King, a pull out sofa bed, separate shower and bathtub, kitchenette (with stovetop, fridge, microwave), dining table, two flatscreens, and a washer and dryer unit.

The fridge\/freezer has an ice maker, so if you like to relax and get plastered before or after you donate multiple hundreds to the local economy, it's a nice, convenient perk.

The negative regarding the room is that you apparently need to bring all of your own connections to whatever entertainment devices you would like to use, if need be.  I'm assuming the hotel probably has USB cables and audio\/video chords if you ask, but it's odd in this day and age that there isn't some sort of audio-steroe-DVD player in the actual room.  I had my ipod and the girl at the desk told me there was a cable to connect it to the TV in the work desk, but I couldn't tell you where the actual connection was as I looked for a solid 15 minutes (and this was well prior to being plastered).

They also give you a couple Keurig coffee's, but I didn't have a coffee maker in the room.  Again, I'm sure you can get one if you ask.

There are two coffee cups and some random cocktail glasses supplied in the room, but no pots, pans, plates, utensils.

That's just nitpicking there and none of the above comments bothered me at all because, again, it's a nice room, the bed's comfortable and it has a unique layout.

As far as the 'convenience' of the hotel, I find some of the reviews laughable where people say it's off the beaten path and it's confusing to get in and out of.  My guess is that, if you're driving there, it could be a bit challenging, but you just have to take a ramp where the arrows point up to the two hotels (Vdara and Aria).

If you're walking around (like most human beings do who visit this city), you're 8-10 minutes from the Strip if you walk through either the Bellagio or The Cosmopolitan.  The Bellagio is literally connected to Vdara while you have to walk outside, down a flight of stairs and across one lane of traffic to get to The Cosmopolitan.  There's also a tram that's in between the Bellagio and Vdara, but I'm not sure where the hell it goes to.  I think it goes as far south as Monte Carlo, but not positive.

You can reach the southern end of the Strip by walking outside and through the Aria, which is a three minute walk away.  I'd say it will take you twenty minutes to walk from the Vdara Lobby to, say, the NYNY (which I did three times).  So it's really no big deal at all unless you're extremely high maintenance (sorry fellow reviewers).

If you're looking for a change of pace from the regular Strip scene (as I was), give this place a shot.  You could do much, much worse and I thought the $ for the rom type was a very good bargain.

Beautiful modern furnishings, spectacular view,  gorgeous bathroom and the most relaxing and comfy bed I've ever slept in!  Also, cannot say enough about the attentive, kind and BEAUTIFUL staff at the Vdara.  There is no casino or smoking and that was nice for me as I prefer to leave the chaos on the outside. I will choose Vdara whenever I go to Vegas.

Minus one star for the pickle-ish smell in the common areas.  I wish I didn't have to do this, but it was pretty stinky.  Oddly enough, the husband did not even notice it!  Go figure.

Nice hotel but not perfect.
Pros: fancy and new room, helpful staff, great view
Cons: have to call service to get robes, no indoor access to aria or bellagio, poor quality shampoo

The Vdara is a new sleek and modern hotel located slightly off the Strip adjacent to the Bellagio. What makes this a superb hotel, at least for me, is that it is a non-smoking and a non-casino hotel. The peace and quiet is a stark contrast to the chaos going on next door - and if you are in the mood for gambling or chaos the Bellagio is a mere 3 minute walk away. 

The rooms are quite large (about 600sf.) and very well appointed, they feature a small kitchen with stovetop and sink (albeit without any pots, pans, silverware or dishes - so not sure what the intent was here), the living room has a small two-person dinner table and a nice living area. The bathroom is larger than most hotels and has a large deep tub in addition to a separate shower. The room itself could be compared to a high rise luxury efficiency - one could stay here long term without ever getting the feeling of being in a hotel.

Breakfast, lunch and dinner can be had at the Market Cafe (a combination of a bistro and convenience store) on the lobby level. The Market Cafe serves a great breakfast and makes some mean sandwiches and desserts. The convenience section has a fair selection of foods and drinks to get you by in a pinch including a limited selection of Dean and Deluca goodies.   

The Pool area located just above the lobby area in the front of the hotel is very nice and has 3-4 pools scattered around. However, as with most hotels in Vegas it is oversaturated with chaise lounges and is more reminiscent of a cruise ship than a hotel. So get there early if you are planning to get a tan.

This is one of the nicest hotels (what can I say I am a sucker for modern amenities) that I have stayed at. The rooms are large well equipped and comfortable. Until something better comes along this will be my hotel of choice when staying in Las Vegas.

We stayed at the V'dara for four nights;  even though I had preregistered, and was supposed to go to the mobile express check in, I was directed to a regular check in line. It seemed to take too long to check in, even though I had confirmed my registration in advance. The clerk insisted on being presented with the same credit card, which I used to preregister. What is the difference? If  another credit card clears,what difference does it make?

I did not like that we were were separated from our luggage; instead of it being sent to the room with us, simultaneously, as there were bellhops available. The valets knew to rush over to our taxi, and  take our luggage when we came out of our taxi. However, I didn't like the fact, that the hotel would not let the taxi driver pull to the extreme right side of the road, adjacent to the hotel. Instead, he had to stop in the middle of the road, and discharge us. It was dangerous to have done so, as my wife uses a wheel transport  chair, and the valet made no effort to make sure  that she was safe, (as there was cross traffic), while I was checking the taxi for luggage, which the driver forgot to bring out. Basically, those so-called valets are just like sharks who circle swimmers, as they can't wait to get their next tip.

As  we were going to the elevators, the hotel clerk told us that the telephones were not working, but would be fixed by the morning. In fact, for our entire four night stay, the telephones did not work. I had to use my cell phone several times to contact the main desk.

The  rug in our room (47-008), was old, and worn, and should have been replaced. Incidentally, the first night that I was there on Nov. 5th, it was difficult if not impossible to sleep, as I heard a car continuously racing around the block, with a loud grating noise. The hotel staff never told us that a racing commercial was being filmed. They could have located our room on the other side of the hotel, away from the area, where the noise was coming from.

There was something wrong with the tv remote control (it may have needed a new battery), as it was difficult to get the tv to come on.

There were no hooks on the bathroom door, to hang up pajamas, or towels. Also, the main clothes closet was not that wide, and there was wasted space on the side.

The so-called cafeteria for breakfast, was one big rip-off. We were charged $58.00 for french toast, eggs, and some blueberry muffins, which tasted terrible. At least, when I stayed in a hotel, in New York City, the breakfast was included. I didn't like the attitude of the hostess, as she tried to tell us where to sit, and didn't like when I told her where I preferred to sit. Also, the waitress seemed to rush us, with our selection. Even when I came back, or ordered food to go for breakfast, it was still expensive.

Incidentally, the V'dara rips guests off pertaining to the drinks (non-alcoholic), in the refrigerator, (orange juice, diet coke, etc.), as well as various snacks, such as Snickers, M & M's, Pringle's Potato snacks. When I asked the person who replenished the snacks how much they were, she told me to see the prices on the tablet in the room. I was shocked when I noted that the prices for those snacks ranged from $7-$8.00, each.  

The V'dara is not in a convenient location. There are other non-smoking hotels, which are closer to the Strip. Incidentally, although the hotel is non-smoking inside, I still had  to walk through cigarette smoke outside,  as the hotel makes no effort, to control smokers outside, who are still on hotel property.

Last, there were no instructions on how to control the heating, fan, and air-conditioning. It took me several nights to figure out how to correctly use those controls. It was either too hot or too cold in the room.

Regarding the plus sides of the V'dara, the elevator service was excellent, as we did not have to wait that long for an elevator. However, there were inconsiderate guests who insisted upon piling in an elevator, and crowd the other occupants, since they were too lazy to wait for the next elevator. In one case, I saw a bellhop racing by us with a luggage cart, and go in an elevator with some  guests. Since I knew that it would be very crowded to squeeze in, I waited patiently for the next one. However, that arrogant and rude bellhop yelled out  in a nasty tone  "GOING UP". I shouted back that I would wait for the next elevator.

The workout room was very nice, with very nice treadmills, etc; the pool area was also very nice. However, I was not impressed that the so-called Manager of the hotel never sent me a follow-up response, after I voiced similar concerns on the V'dara's own internal survey. In New York City, when we stayed at a hotel, their staff contacted us by e-mail, after I critiqued that hotel.

In summary, on our next trip to Vegas, we will definitely not stay at the V'dara, even if it was for free!

I booked a room in this hotel to show my folks a good time. There is no self parking and I went around 2 before  I gave in to Valet Parking. I then asked for my room but since they didn't have any suite in the category I had paid for I was upgraded to a business or an executive corner suite. I was delighted at this point thinking I had made the right choice. The room however was a disaster. Many of the door knobs would just drop off. The windows were so dirty that the view was of no use. We had to drop the curtains so it wouldn't look dirty. The curtain dropping mechanisms were pretty cool though. There were different settings and switches to move them up and down. That was the highlight of the stay. We went in to the bathroom only to find the bathtub downright dirty. There was a sticky substance all over it. That was not the worst of it. One of the beds had a bedbug crawling over the pillow. When we notified the management, all they said was - we have logged an issue. Thank you for reporting it. Well. Thanks is all well and good but they did not even offer to change the room. I am  not going back again - ever. Expected more from MGM resorts.

I like that its quiet and secluded from the strip, but also steps away from the Bellagio and the Aria. My only complaints is that the rooms are falling apart quick, making it look kind of shitty and the AC sucks. Dropping number 2's sucks if you are there with another person, bathroom echos and privacy is non existent. and their hallways  and elevators are kind of warm, but the lobby smells nice. 
You might be wondering then why the 4 star, it is still very comfortable and nicer than a lot of other hotels.

Avoid their Cafe, food sucks and is over priced.

At first I was hesitant about staying at Vdara since it looked so far away from the strip on Google Maps, but was pleasantly surprised at how convenient and nice the hotel was.

Firstly, there is no casino downstairs.  That actually turned out to be a good thing since it wasn't loud, smokey or teeming with bleary eyed drunks and\/or people losing money.  On the contrary, it was quite classy and relaxed inside.

Secondly, the room itself was pretty sweet.  Small kitchenette, 2 large flat screen TVs, SUPER comfy bed, ginormous nice bathroom with separate shower and bathtub.

The amenities were okay.  The gym was pretty nice with lots of complimentary things such as headphones, unlimited waters, towels, etc.  There were a handful of cardio machines, some weight machines, etc.  The pool and area was so-so, but that was alright.  

There is a walkway from the hotel lobby to Bellagio, which is a bit of a walk, but no more than 5 minutes.  You can also access Aria right across the street, but it was a bit frustrating since you have to walk around a circle outside (we all wondered why there wasn't an above ground or underground direct walkway).  

The only thing that was kind of annoying was that there was an awfully strange smell by the entrance of our room, like stinky feet (and no, it wasn't from us).  We were hardly in our room enough during our trip to bother mentioning to the front desk, so I'm not going to make a big deal out of it.

All in all, it is a very nice, modern, clean hotel situated only 5 minutes from all the action of the strip.  It's a great reprieve from the sometimes gaudy, sketchy, smokey environment that you get from other hotel casinos.  Would definitely recommend it to anyone and I would stay again next time I'm in town.

So the hotel is nice. The experience was ok UNTIL - I got charged random charges that they did not explain and when I called to get an explanation I was met by their front desk rep named AUDREY (or AUDRIE) she was short and rude from the beginning. Then she became even more rude when her explanation of the unlawful and unwarranted charges ended up confusing my fiancé and I even more than we already were by her. When I tried to clarify with her and go over WHY they charged an additional $189.65 (which I think we can all agree is cause for concern considering there was no reason for it and the amount was pretty specific) she interrupted me while I was ALREADY speaking and tried to talk over me. When I didn't let her talk over me- she finally kept quiet so I could finish what I was saying. I made sure to pet her know I was done asking my question by ending it with a simple "please explain" and she sat in silence for a rude 10 seconds before she began with a completely snotty and self-righteous "ARE YOU DONE?"  
I couldn't believe how terrible her customer service skills were in its entirety. I could not understand how this girl has a job working the front desk where she has interactions with guests all day!!!! She needs to be fired and\/or retrained severely. Or she needs to get a job where she doesn't have to deal with people since she clearly cannot handle it diplomatically and kindly. I am calling the manager as well- to make an official complaint as well. 

After being rude in her half ass confusing non-explanation - she ended with saying what should've been said in the beginning. That the additional charges will be dropped and refunded. 

On another note- the Vdara has NO right to just go ahead and place significant charges to your account (in addition to payments that you already made for the room and the deposit) without telling you why or at least letting the guest be aware of what the charges are for. 
Also, the valet scratched my new vehicle while in its possession. There were no scratches on it when we gave it to them and in the morning we noticed there was a significantly noticeable set of scratches on the front bumper with red paint which means they hit another car that was obviously red. 

Honestly I  would've given it 1 star but I kindly gave it two because the room itself was decent. 
Overall- I would highly recommend staying somewhere else. There are plenty of amazing other hotels (as I go to Vegas quite often) to stay at with rooms just as nice if not nicer- where you will have a better experience from valet, to front desk. 

AUDREY- you are a terrible representative and Vdara would be justified and would benefit greatly from letting you go. If you do not like to deal with people you should not be in customer service. 
Learn some people skills as it will help you in life.

This has been, by far, one of my most enjoyable stays at Vegas. Their slogan "do Vegas differently" is exactly in line with their services. The rooms are spacious and better than most that I've stayed in on the strip. Their bathrooms are AMAZING, especially if you enjoy baths. I got the least expensive room and it was still very nice. The front desk and concierge were some of the friendliest that I've encountered.  I really appreciated that the lobby isn't a casino maze and they have a wonderful lounge with live music. I would definitely reccommend. The food is pricey (as is on most of the strip), but it is MUCH better quality. 

Also, very easy to get to the strip and if you want to get to a casino the Aria is right next door. I will be staying here again!
Nice quite hotel. Nice change from the others in vegas. No casino and no smoking. Very nice pool. Laid back atmosphere.

No stars for me. Me and my husband stayed in an executive suite and honey.... it was trifling to say the least. The room was very dusty, our dining room table was dirty as well. We had to wait an hour to check in to what we thought was going to be such an amazing room. Our tub was filthy.  It had hairs in it so I immediately requested the housekeeper to come and re clean our room. We never received our robes after asking for them on several occasions along with receiving our cook wear three days into our stay and we were only staying five days.   They did not have a garbage can for the kitchen either and not to mention im pretty sure I was bitten by bed bugs. I do not recommend this place to anyone!!!

I secured an amazing 3 night deal with this impressive hotel where it was a true pleasure to escape the noise and smoke of the casinos.  I paid a resort fee of $25 per day and for what I used I really had to savour every sip of those $12.50 33cl bottles of water!  The room was spacious, very comfortable and the towels were so thick and fluffy I could hardly close my suitcase.
Housekeeping is the worse .. good luck getting your room cleaned .. called 5 times never happened..never coming back..

Great hotel. Had a suite on the 52nd floor. Have an amazing view to one side of the strip from my windows, open the door to the hallway and see the other half of the strip. 

Suite is really big. More usable space than the Aria. Washer\/dryer, full kitchen with stove top, microwave, refrigerator, etc.  love this room.

AMAZING for photographers. I could shoot here for a month and still not explore everything.

Arrived at 9:20am and was told I had to come back at 10am to pre-check in. You can't just put me in the system now? That was weird

I hesitate in my decision of giving this hotel a four star or a five star.  And it's only for one reason: THE COFFEE!! This hotel is an oasis from the smoke-filled casinos that are in every corner. If you're a smoker, this hotel is not for you.  The entire hotel is non-smoking! Ahhh!!
The rooms are beautiful!  Each is equipped with a kitchenette with microwave, fridge, and cook top.  But there is no coffee maker!! :(  so every morning I crack my eyes open and shuffle down to the lobby to the Starbucks. :(. If there was a coffee maker in the room like every other hotel I've stayed in, this would be given a five star.
There is easy access to the other major hotels on the strip.  Just walk to the Bellagio, from there, there is access to a tram that will take you to Monte Carlo.  Or you can walk through Bellagio and get to Caesars Palace - all without being outside for any length of time.  
I will definitely be staying here on my next trip.

I would give this place all the stars, but we had some issues regarding our room keys, as well as dealing with the front desk staff.  Besides that, the service was great!  The best part about the Vdara and the surrounding casinos in the area is its location!  Sandwiched right in the middle of the strip, you have everything you want (two malls, casinos, nightlife, etc) and still retreat to the hotel after you've had your fill and need to replenish your strength (2hr naps suffice) to start the madness all over again.

Valet staff is dope, bell services were dope, housekeeping was dope, room service food was delicious, but we just had an issue with the front desk with our keys.  My brother ended his night early at 2am on one night, and he had to wait an hour downstairs to get back into our room.  Our second issue with front desk was when we were looking for a lost item in the room. We were asked to wait in the lobby while they made the necessary phone call to security to check, the male at the desk never got back to us on our query, even when there no longer were lines of people who needed servicing.  When I had gone back up to the desk and asked the lady working next to him to please follow up, she got us our help in less than 5 minutes.  All this while the first worker was listening, he didn't even bother to acknowledge that he helped me previously.

The panoramic suite that we had was awesome!  I wish it was my apartment, just not in Vegas, if that was the case, I'd probably be in a lot of trouble every weekend, hopefully not every night.  The one other thing I did not like was that the pool was unavailable due to construction the weekend we were there, we should have had some of the hotel fees reflect that.  All in all, I would still return here because I really do like the fact that Vdara is a Hotel Resort and not a Casino Resort.

Nice rooms and good staff, however at the end of the stay they tried to charge is a "resort fee". It's for the "complimentary" wifi and water. If you complain long enough they'll waive it, but it's complete horseshit.

Use to love the Vdara as it is a non smoking hotel. Back in the day they use to have pots, pans, utensils etc to use in the kitchenette. we have been back through the years as our to go hotel, things have drastically changed and charges just continue to add up. From being able to utilize utensils, etc to now having to be charged for using pots, plates utensils etc. per day. they even charge a fee for a coffee machine per day for everything.  Parking  is no longer free in Vegas, Vdara charges the most 18 per day. We ordered room service they charge a normal 4.95$ fee to bring the food to us, now they charge another 4.95$ for a 2nd person for a 2nd set of silverware. Really 9.90$ to deliver horrible cold food when you order hot breakfast!!! That is on top of the gratuities. Over 56$ for breakfast. Today I went down to the cafe in the Vdara to spend over 25$ for a very cold eggs Bennie!! Even the hollandaise sauce was cold. I will no longer stay at this resort. They charge for every little thing. From a place I use to love to a place that has gone terribly wrong!!!

Stayed in the city corner fountain view suite and overlooked the fountain at Caesars it was beautiful to watch the show from the room and the view of the strip was amazing! The hotel is a great location and I love how there is no smoking feels very clean and your right in the middle of the strip so everything you want to do is close by. Definitely would recommend this hotel.

I stayed here for a week and it was wonderful.  The convention that I went to Vegas for was next door at the Bellagio.  I had stayed in the Bellagio for the same convention a couple of years ago and was stuck in some faraway wing that I think was further than walking across the connector from Vdara to the Convention area at the Bellagio.  It was actually a joy to NOT be staying in a smoke-filled, noisy casino.  I could walk a few minutes and go to Bellagio, Aria, Cosmo if I wanted that scene or just chill in the calm, quiet, fresh and cool room with a view at the Vdara.   It was cheaper, too!  While my friends were all waiting in a huge line at Bellagio to get a ride to the airport, I was able to just walk outside the Vdara and immediately jump into a cab.  Oh, beware... the cab drivers are often crooks... It shouldn't cost much more than $20 to get to the airport.  I told the guy I knew the best way so don't mess around and it cost me $15 with no traffic.  

Loved the completeness of their housekeeping crew.  Wow!  My room was put back together and then some so that when I returned from a day out, I was welcomed by a fresh room, with all the tiny details put back into place... they wrap the dryer cord around the handle and put it back in the drawer, straighten out any magazines you've looked at, put any cosmetics you have lying about haphazardly all in a row on a small towel on the counter, hang up stuff in the bathroom (I had a shower cap and nightshirt thrown on the tub), line up my extra shoes that I had all over the room, etc.  

The bathtub was fabulous.  I read a book and had a glass of wine (large ledge around tub) in there one night.  So huge, the water runs fast so fills up in no time, and is hot so you can keep the temperature where you want it very easily.  There are dimmer switches on many of the lights in the room.  The shades and blinds are on switches by the door.  

Very "green" hotel.  Turn-down service- I only had twice but was surprised that they freshened up the room, gave me two new bottles of water along with a glass on each nightstand, put down a little mat next to the bed on both sides with slippers on it, left a sweet treat, and put away the decorative cover and pillow on the bed.  Quite a surprise.  

The only bummer things were that I couldn't find a plug near the bed to charge my phone, which is what I use as an alarm clock.  Poolside food service was slow, slow, slow.  I couldn't believe how bad they were!  I actually couldn't stand waiting any longer so got up and had them box my lunch "to go" when it finally came out.  They couldn't even get drinks to people...I'm talking WATER, etc.

Excellent location, especially for the price. I appreciate having a non-gaming option on the Strip, it made the hotel feel quieter and our room was virtually sound-proof. The bedding was super comfortable, however I thought there were a lot of little things missing. I'd have appreciated a dvd player for the room, and my xbox that I brought couldn't get an internet connection. Wifi in general was slow and\/or completely unresponsive. The kitchen was also missing anything in the way of cutlery or plates which was odd since there's a two-burner cook top. I've previously stayed at The Signature and those amenities where provided, so I guess I was expecting the same. Over all these are rather small nit-picky details and wouldn't deter me from returning. All of the reasons I booked it where amazing, 1. Price 2. Location 3. Spa bath 4. Kitchen.

Oh Vdara, if only I was writing a review for your actual hotel room, I'd give you 5-stars, but unfortunately due to your poor management, you definitely would NEVER deserve 5. 

I booked the "Vdara Suite" (800 sq ft vs the 500 sq ft of the regular deluxe room) in February for Memorial Day Weekend (yes..3 freakin months in advance), knowing prices were going to go ridiculously high as MDW got closer. Once arriving on Saturday, after waiting in a ridiculously long and slow moving line in the lobby, I checked-in thinking everything was a-ok. Too bad once I arrived to the room, I was shocked by how small it was. Um...this definitely CANNOT be a suite--one, it only had 1 bathroom, no separate kitchen, and everything was much more cramped than what I remembered in the pictures online. I called the front desk to see if there was a mistake and of course, they put us in the wrong room. 

So giving them the benefit of the doubt and knowing MDW is one of Vegas' busiest weekends, I figured it was a small mistake and they could move us to our actual room quickly. Too bad they end up telling us because it is MDW, they completely sold out of rooms and OVERBOOKED so they had no choice but to DOWNGRADE us into a smaller room. Apparently, hotwire or expedia sold more Vdara rooms than they had available, so in order to accommodate those rooms, they kicked a few of us who  actually BOOKED ON VDARA'S WEBSITE into their regular rooms. 

To compensate for this "mistake" they did offer us $100 room service credit and $60 off our two-night stay (which wasn't much of a discount considering we booked it 3 months ahead--so our room was already cheap to begin with and they were going off the current-day rates) but ONLY after we complained and made them realize they put us in the wrong room. To think they weren't even going to tell us they managed to downgrade our reservation, until we walked in and realized something was off about our initial room, is ridiculous.

I heard good things about Vdara and had high hopes for a good stay here, but unfortunately I will not be coming back.

This was my first time visiting or staying at Vdara. Our stay was excellent- beginning with valet and extended throughout our stay. Vdara staff are amazing and really made us feel welcomed.  

We were upgraded to a corner suite upon check-in and the room was absolutely amazing! Stunning views of the strip, Bellagio fountains and more. the room sas comfortable and had features such as a washer- dryer, full kitchen including dishwasher, stove and full sized fridge. The rooms were sleek and comfortable. We requested extra pillows and blankets from housekeeping which were delivered promptly.

Valet, housekeeping, cafe and front of house staff were all superb. very friendly, welcoming and accommodating.

The hotel just turned 5 years old but is very well maintained and clean.

My only complaint is that the market closes at 10pm on week nights - but it is December (slow season).

We will definitely be returning!

I stayed here over New Year's 2011\/2012.  My first impression of the place was standing in a long line waiting to check in and watching a mom with her baby as the baby puked all over the floor.  The mother scurried away as if nothing happened and we watched from a distance while people unknowingly walked through baby puke!!!  Not exactly the best start to our Vegas weekend.  I don't hold Vdara accountable because the staff took care of the situation very quickly.  Just know that I'm NEVER a fan of bringing any child of any age to Vegas.  Unless you are 21, stay away!!!  The long line moved pretty quickly and we got to the check-in counter around 4ish and were told our room wasn't ready.  WTF?! We had early dinner plans!  Well, they realized it was their mistake so they offered us a variety of options and made up for it.  We hung out in the trendy bar\/lounge area and got our buzz on with no complaints.  Anyway, we got a great rate for a corner suite that overlooked the Bellagio fountains.  I shopped around extensively and this place had the best rates and the room had a lovely view and was brand new, very clean, comfortable, and decorated modern and tasteful.  I must warn you that this is NOT a casino and smoking is not allowed ANYWHERE!  I know that sounds great but when I'm in Vegas, I like to have a little drunken cigarette here and there...well I couldn't here, damn!  And while it was nice not to have to walk through a casino the size of a football field in order to get to our room each night, casinos are where all the great people watching takes place.  I would definitely recommend this place to folks who hate smoking and\/or casinos but are visiting Las Vegas for whatever reason.  For me though...as long as I have a bit of party left in me, I'll stick to the smoker friendly casino type establishments!
This place is well priced and the suites are amazing! It is also located on the strip which makes it a perfect place to stay. I will definitely try to book my rooms here in the future.

Spent a Friday and Saturday night here and really loved the hotel. I love that there's no casino and thus no smoking, so it actually smells good when you enter. It's much less crazy, and a nice, relaxing retreat from the party of Vegas, yet it's only steps away from it when you want to resume the insanity. It's really the best of both worlds. I love that it's free valet and that you don't have to walk a half hour through a self park garage, through a casino, to get to the reception desk. We had a painless check-in, were given a great room on the 40th floor with awesome views, including the water shows at the Bellagio next door.

The rooms themselves are great. They are spacious, modern, and clean. There was a living room, kitchenette, bedroom, and large bathroom. We didn't use the kitchenette at all, though I guess maybe it would be nice if someone was staying for an extended period of time. It almost seemed unnecessary in Vegas, though. It would probably be helpful for families with babies or small kids. Anyway...the room was great. One thing I thought was odd for a 5-star hotel, was that there were no robes in the room. Not a big deal, but it's something I'd expect from a hotel like this.

The only real negative of the weekend was on Saturday we realized we forgot an important toiletry item and called down to ask if it could be brought up to us. Sure, no problem. We waited for 20 minutes and then called again. They said it would be right up. We waited another 20 minutes - nothing. Finally, we gave up and had to run out to CVS. This was pretty frustrating, again for a 5-star hotel. For this kind of place you would expect much better customer service (ie: not waiting 20 minutes for an item you request, and if they do make an error and need to be called a second time, at that point make sure that the item gets there). This left a bad taste in our mouth. Even when we went out for the night and came back, we were half expecting the item to be in our room when we got there, since we were assured twice it was "on its way," but there was no sign of it. We also had a slightly longer wait than what I would think is normal for our car from the valet when we checked out on Sunday. They don't have the kind of valet where you can call down for your car so it's waiting when you get down there...you have to go down yourself and show the ticket. 

Overall, we really loved how new and clean this hotel was, and how comfortable our room was. That being said, what would have been an excellent stay was put off by the poor customer service. I would consider staying here again if I got a good deal, but I'd be extra sure to bring EVERYTHING I needed because you can't rely on them to bring anything to your room, no matter how long you wait or how many times you call.

Only good thing about this place is location- there's a connector walk to the Bellagio. Otherwise, this hotel really isn't that great. The TV barely works, it's hard to find any of the light switches, the elevators are so slow even at 6am, the valet is slower than the elevators, and the rooms are not that clean (big stain on our bed sheets). We liked our hampton inn 100x better when we were at Zion National Park. Won't be staying here next time.

A sanctuary in the middle of the LV strip.  That's how I felt as I stepped into Vdara.  I loved the fact that it was a non-smoking property.  I managed to find a deal so the room came out to about $145\/night the last week of December.  

For hotel guests, valet parking is your only option.  But it's free, so it's not a big deal - just make sure you tip the staff.  The valet staff were quick and friendly.  

As other reviewers have said, it's a condo so included is a small kitchenette w\/ a microwave, stove top, sink, fridge, and mini-bar.  You need to call housekeeping to request plates & pots though.  They are a green property so they don't have it available unless it's requested.  This is why they get 4 stars instead of 5.  I made a request but they never delivered it.  I ended up having to toss my leftovers as I did not want to bother with it anymore.

The best part of the room was the soaking bath tub!  I took a bath every night I was there and loved it!  (TIP:  go visit Basin White at the Grand Canal Shoppes and buy a couple bath bombs.)  The bed was super comfy and the shades were nice.  My only other complaint is that there were gaps between the black out shades so that was kinda annoying in the morning.  Other than that, we really enjoyed the room.

There is a walkway that connects Vdara directly to Bellagio so that was very convenient.  You end up being around Jean Phillipe Patisserie so make sure to grab a cute little pastry to eat!

Vdara definitely impressed me so I would stay here again!

HANDS DOWN BEST HOTEL IN VEGAS!!! First off there is NO CASINO in this hotel so therefore, no nasty smoke smell!! They also have a HUGE gym fully equipped with leg, arm, back machines, free weights, ellipticals, treadmills, and bikes! It closes at 8PM but that's ok because it was hardly ever busy when I went during the late afternoon hours! (2-4PM)

Our room was AMAZING! We didn't opt for the suit but just had a standard deluxe room that came with a mini kitchenette with available refrigerator and stove, king sized bed, huge and GORGEOUS bathroom, nice view of the strip, and a huge couch! 

I literally didn't want to leave this hotel and could picture myself living here foreverrr!! Hehe :) Hotel staff was extremely friendly and even let us check out late (12PM versus 11AM) for FREE!! There are also a lot of small snack stores downstairs with healthy foods and, of course, a Starbucks! 

There's a FREE tram that takes you to Mirage and Aria and Vdara is conveniently connected to Bellagio which is connected to Caesar's Palace.. So you won't have to do a lot of outside walking that deathly Vegas heat!!!  

Overall, A MUST STAY while in Vegas!!!!! Loved it here!!!!

Vegas living! Let's face it. When you're going to Vegas you're hardly going for a cushy bed and a relaxing spa experience. You're pretty much going to test the limits of your liver (in public) and return home with empty pockets. In that respect the Vdara is everything - and more - that you might need from a hotel.

I'm writing this review imagining my hotel needs from a more regular sort of vacation. The Vdara is relatively new and right off the strip, the sister hotel to the more well known Aria. The location is right in the middle of the action, and most large spots are walking distance; the Bellagio is connected in a back passageway. The facilities are clean and modern, and the gym is the best I've seen in a hotel. Iced towels, personal water bottles, any machine you might need, leather seats embroidered with "The Vdara."

As for the room, we stayed in a suite. The bed is up to par but the roll it sofa bed is seriously thin and wiry. If you have the misfortune to draw that straw, be sure to call room service and request a mattress pad (or two). The suite comes with a bathroom and a half, with the half bath having no towel rack. How are you supposed to dry your hands? Neither bathroom has a fan. The shower pressure is weak and the hotel shampoo\/conditioner isn't great. Any girl should BYO. It seemed like a strange mix of luxury and flaws, since the suite had all the aforementioned issues while having a fancy Keurig coffee maker, a stove and a jumbo refrigerator complete with ice maker. Not sure how much use you'd get out of that in Vegas, but there you go. Overall the hotel is nice but could use some more thought invested in the utility of their setup.

Vdara is a super nice hotel. some may expect it to be cheaper since there is no hotel. but it's not. however, what it lacks in hotel, it makes up in customer service and interior design.

our corner suite was spacious and was about $200-$250 a night. There was 1 bed room, 1 1\/2 bathrooms, 1 kitchen, 1 living & room. There no smoking inside the hotel so it smells wonderful!

i loved the full bathroom! it had a shower, bathtub, 2 sinks, and a huge mirror. the shower was all glass so you had the view of the city lights while showering!

wifi was free but the Ethernet cord is much faster!

the other thing I liked was that there were 2 elevators. one for bottom half of floors and the other for the top half. convenient!

i also had dinner at the cafe in the lobby. i recommend the steak wrap!! DELICIOUS!!

i would definitely recommend this place for someone who wants a sophisticated hotel to stay in while you're in sin city.

Spend $500,000 to "buy" a unit, $600 in association fees and having to spend $30\/night when I stay in my own unit I just spent 1\/2 million dollars on?  Plus then when I'm not in my unit, I have to put my belongings in a locker so Vdara can rent the unit I 'purchased' for $500,000 on as a hotel and have the Clampetts who are getting "my" condo for $55\/night off of Priceline?

Sad, sad, sad and so "pre bust" mentality.

This Hotel is AMAZING !!
we made the reservation through M life and we have got good price for our room !

We checked in on Tuesday for one night and they offer us an upgrade to one of their executive  suite on 34th floor ! OH MAN that suite is spectacular ! All the employees are professional and they made our stay very beautiful experience !  

It's very clean and elegant !

Got the panoramic suite for my and my girlfriend and it was perfect.

This suite is has a total apartment\/condo feel with room, living area, kitchen, and bath all sectioned off.  Search around Youtube for a walkthrough.

I never get room service, but figured experiencing it wouldn't hurt and surprisingly the food they offered at this hotel was superb!  

What I love most about this room is that it is still on the strip, but pushed back a bit which takes you away from all the chaos.  Also this is a non-smoking hotel with no casino.  LOVE THAT!

It is valet-only, but is complimentary.  I did tip them, but at the end of my stay.  The longest you'll wait for your car is about 10 minutes, but I'd say the longest I've ever had to wait even during checkout was 5 minutes.

Such a great suite!!!

Alright, so I've been to the strip once before and I've seen MUCH better than this. I'll list my pros and cons otherwise I'll be here all day typing.

****PROS:
- Location: Middle of the strip, Bellagio is literally attached to the building. 

- No casino\/smoking (Not sure if this is pro\/con? I don't care either way)

- Door bell to your room! haha

- BEAUTIFUL room. (Deluxe Suite) The whole setup is gorgeous. Walk in from the door with a kitchen, dining table, living room\/bed which is split between a wall with two TV's on each side. There's a window that stretches from each end of the room. The bathroom has a HUGE tub with a shower head AND a separate shower. With GREAT lighting. Also, the bathroom has a magnified mirror for all you beautiful ladies! A blow dryer, cotton, q-tips, wonderful smelling shampoo\/conditioner\/bodywash

- SO MUCH sink space

- Ice machine on every floor

- Friendly staff!

- A safe that is EASY to operate (you know some places are difficult)

- Electric curtains, let's get fancy (which blocked out light pretty well)

- Reading light above bed

- Room service ALWAYS came within reason

- Touch-sensored housekeeping\/do not disturb sign

- Lighting had dimmers

- 35% discount on Zarkana through Vdara



****CONS:
- The bathroom right beside the bedroom?

- NO DISHES? You must call them to bring it up, didn't wait long - but still annoying. Their excuse is they're a "green" hotel.

- Fridge is TINY. Cannot even fit doggy bags.

- If you're cheap like me, DO NOT OPEN THE LEFT SIDE OF THE FRIDGE. EVERYTHING IN THERE IS WEIGHED, did you catch that?! EVERYTHING IS WEIGHED, YOU MOVE IT, YOU PAY. I found that out the hard way. And TOLD them to ERASE my charge. Also, I had a water bottle missing, which I told them as well, so you may want to look and see if everything is there. 

- Water pressure in the bathroom sink?

- Bed was SO uncomfortable and the sheets suck - Bad combination, I was freezing my entire sleep.

- Drawer space?? 3 drawers, and a few tiny shelves. Ridiculous.

- Their complimentary waters, I thank you for the miniature bottles that held nothing in it.

- NO coffee maker, but there's coffee mugs..... Ok.

- EXPENSIVE! And for what. This hotel is not that great. Just because they love the earth doesn't mean they should over charge. They love what's in our wallets too.

- Resort fee, see told you they love our money.


Will I stay here again? No absolutely not. It was a nice hotel and all, but if it wasn't for the conference I attended here, you would have never seen me pay that kind of money. Nope. Vdara got lucky.

We were traveling through Las Vegas on Thanksgiving and used Hotel Tonight to book a last minute room at Vdara. The rooms are nice, spacious and clean, and the staff is very professional.

However, we booked this room to primarily use their pool and jacuzzi, which is part of a $44+ facilities charge. We accepted this fee however we did not know that the pool and jacuzzi would close at 5 pm that night. When we called the hotel around 2 pm that day, the representative did not even mention their early closing hours either. Had we known they would close the facilities so soon, we would have moved on to another place to stay. 

When I went to complain to management, the hotel manager I spoke to looked at me with a condescending Cheshire cat grin (he said he gets a lot of complaints about this fee and it showed) and said that this fee was mandatory for each guest and he could not refund us the resort fee because then it would not be fair to the other guests. I understand that in theory but it's up to other people to complain about this fee if they're upset. This was our problem so we complained. He said he could not reimburse us the resort fee even though there was no open resort to use. He also claimed they notified Hotel Tonight to update their app to include the resort hours. Hotel Tonight responded by saying that they always update new information. I believe Hotel Tonight as we've used this app many times before and have never run into this kind of problem. I think Vdara just never communicated these new rules to them.

It seems odd to me that a respected hotel would close their public-access resort at 5 PM on weekdays. The hotel manager claimed there was not enough staff to manage the resort but when I looked around, there were many people working (even concierge staff to greet and guide guests at the elevators). This is a huge hotel run by MGM, it's hard for me to believe that they had problems filling such positions. Once again, a huge hotel company collects "resort fees" from people who aren't even allowed to use it. 

This resort fee also includes wifi, which didn't work well. So we basically got nothing for this fee. 

I have no complaints about the rooms or building. It's a very nice hotel for people like us who don't want to stay in a hotel with casinos and allows smoking. If you're ok with paying close to $50 for a mandatory resort fee and not be able to use it, then that's your own decision. We were not happy with this as there was no resort to use. We should have been told, the 9-5 PM resort hours are ridiculous and this is another way for big hotels in Vegas to collect easy fees that they know people will pay  to stay in Vegas.

Beautiful architecture, amazing modern rooms with a mini kitchen; living room, LCD TV, separate shower and bath, slippers\wardrobes, and the bed will make you sleep like a baby.

The downside, there is nothing to do here. Only some bar and restaurant, but even then it's quite dead at these places. At least it's a walk away from Bellagio or Aria which contains the casino and is smack right in the middle of the strip. I went on a Monday night and it was $130. I wonder how much it is on the weekends.

I'd only go here in the future if i get a special or on the weekdays, otherwise you can get more value for your money at other hotels.

Clean, crisp, refreshing. This hotel is a breath of fresh air in the midst of a hazy cloud of cigarette smoke that is Las Vegas. This city is one of my favorites but is absolutely out of control with second hand smoke. It gets in the air ducts and is sent all throughout the hotels and casino floors. Being a smokeless hotel, Vdara acts as a sanctuary for those who don't smoke, or want to leave the smoking to outside. 

We had a few issues with the room within our first night at the hotel. Phone didn't work, and the microwave oven wasn't working. But, there customer service was top notch and they got us into another room very quickly, with bell service to assist with the transfer. The second room was problem free, and spotless. Everyone from front desk staff to housekeeping greet you with a "good morning", and are happy to be serving you.
I won't stay anywhere else when I'm in town.

I really wish I could leave a better review because I expected a 5-Star experience, but what I got was a 4-Star at best.

Upon arriving we had to go back downstairs to switch rooms because our original room had white stains all over the couch. The room we got next was missing one of its lamps. The lighting in general was too dim (I want my room bright if I need it to be). The shower had soap suds all over, making me wonder if they ever cleaned it. Our fridge was also not working (the side that we needed to use - the $$$ snacks side worked just fine). We requested the front desk to make sure we didn't get charged for swapping the snacks into the non-working half of the fridge so we could store our food in the working half, yet they still managed to stick the charge in there (good thing I checked before leaving). Finally, the valet took 30 minutes to find our car. No idea what happened there, but it kind of summarized our stay at Vdara in general.

Pros:
- New (exterior is nice)
- Non-smoking (no stink)
- No casino (less mayhem \/ lines downstairs)
- Decent view of the Bellagio fountains (had to upgrade one level to get this)
- Located in the center to the strip
- Really close to two major casinos (Cosmo and Aria)

Cons:
- More expensive than other non-casino options on the strip
- Rooms' maintenance seem to be somewhat neglected by the staff
- Pool & jacuzzi close at 5PM

Overall, my experience at Vdara was below average. I expected more. Trump is cheaper and had no issues so I'll be using them instead of Vdara next time.

My girlfriend and I go to Vegas four to five times a year, and will always stay here or the Aria. This place is amazing, great rooms, great views. And the service is impeccable. Ask for Julian at the concierge desk and he will take care of anything for you. The best. Great Vegas experience from someone who comes often for business and pleasure.

no casino and no smoking in the lobby...how awesome is that?
large, stylish rooms.
comfy bed.

You will like this hotel if you are like us and you:
- don't gamble
- like a quiet night after a day of events
- like to avoid crowds and hustle & bustle
- don't smoke

Basically, this place fit our needs. While the hotel offerings are slim compared to the giants on the strip, its proximity to Bellagio, Aria and the City Center tram makes it accessible. For some it might feel out of the way. We saw Vdara as an escape from the craziness of the Vegas scene. We found all of the staff to be helpful, kind and courteous.

Room: We had the executive corner suite and it gave us amazing views in every room. We were able to get a good package deal on Expedia. The flaws were truly minor: a whistling sound from under the door, a dryer that was fussy (but, come on - we had a washer and dryer in our suite!). Overall, the room was pleasantly quiet, bed was comfy, the 2 TVs worked great.  The cleaning staff did a phenomenal job and even went beyond your typical housekeeping work (winding charger cords, placing a towel under our toiletries, etc). We pretty much loved our experience with our Vdara suite.

Spa: Small, but enjoyably so. Again, the courteous staff made the experience lovely. The cost for day use seemed very reasonable for the use we made of it.

Massage: We had the couples massage. I got the deep tissue and my partner got the hot stone. Our massage therapists were very good at their jobs and we were very pleased.

Bar: Excellent cocktails in a relaxed environment.

Market Cafe: Our go-to for a snack or breakfast. Great quality food. Unfortunately, service was lacking in comparison to the rest of the hotel. Though, it might have more to do with the maturity of some of the workers. Also, at one point, three of our credit cards wouldn't compute. But it was a system error, not our cards.

Location\/Transportation: Very easy to get a taxi out front. Very close to the Bellagio\/City Center tram which can drop you off at the Monte Carlo. From there you can cross the street to the Las Vegas Monorail at the MGM Grand. Or from the Crystals stop, you can get to the Blvd for walking or a bus.

I was impressed with the rooms and the location.  I was pleased that there was not a casino at this location.  These are the pros. When we arrived, I placed my luggage on the kitchen counter since it was higher than the table (and I'm tall so it was easier to look in it). Unfortunately when they turned the unit,  they left the electric stove top on but it doesn't turn red so I didn't know it was on.  Part of my luggage was touching the stove top and it caught on fire.  They reimbursed me for the damages and they were semi caring.  What was worrisome was that the room filled up with smoke and the smoke alarms never went off! I am concerned that this may happen again in the future and something tragic happens.  My next call will be to the fire marshall!

This is a great "Hotel Only" hotel in Las Vegas.  It is very modern in its design and I cannot remember a better night's sleep.  The rooms are fantastic with 2 TV's living space, kitchen, and a very large bathroom.  The hotel is right next door to the Bellagio but it is somewhat of a walk to get there.  If you are looking for food...good luck...they have a restaurant downstairs but the quick bites are not around.  Overall, a great experience even though I am writing this review based on my stay 1-2 years ago.

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE, LOVE Vdara!

why it didn't get a 5 star from me:
1) i found 2 strands of hair. one in the shower and one in the toilet! [ i didn't complain]
2) no late check out
3) no self parking

why i totally loved this place:
1) i love that there's no smoking in the hotel.
2) i love that there's no loud slot machine. no gambling involved.
3) no long walk to get to the hotel room
4) i saw the rio, bellagio fountain show, and all i can say is the view was A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!
5) the decor was up-to-date and very classy!
6) its a suite! 
7) i love that there were plenty of long mirrors for you to see your outfits! 

the bathroom had a tub, shower stall that is super roomy, blow dryer, plenty of towels [including a beach like towel], one of those magnified mirrors, and plenty of closet space. 

two tv's, a couch, dining table, stove, microwave, & small fridge that had both a section where you can place things and a mini bar.

one of my best hotel rooms yet! i was super impressed. 5 minutes walk to aria.

Great value for your money. One thing I don't miss is the smoke that permeate throughout casino to the hotel reception through to even the non-smoking rooms and the burnt holes in the carpets and sheets. This hotel lobby actually smells nice, like a spa. No lineups at the checkin counter so first impressions great.
To my room, I got the cheapest Deluxe room facing the pool and the colorful art by Nancy Rubins I think. so I have no view of the Bellagio fountain but it's not a horrible view either so I'm happy. Room was close to 600 sq feet (huge). Bed linens were good quality (no cigarette burnt holes, phew), bed itself was a little on the soft side. we have fully stocked minibar, two-burner electric cook top, convection microwave, 42-inch Digital LCD flat-screen television in living and bedroom areas and a laptop-size electronic safe. The automatic roman blinds took maybe a minute to understand how to control (as mentioned by many others the gaps will let the sun permeate into the room so bring your sleeping masks) The thing I had trouble with are the light switches, simply put they are weird. 

Bathroom...wonderful. I love coming back to have a quick soak (nice size bathtub), separate showers. No Aveda products as mentioned, they now have cheap bath products. 

You have to ask house keeping if you need robes, slippers or any utensils for the kitchen. Housekeeping crew left a bad impression on the first day they threw away the conditioner I brought (I left it in the shower). 2nd day they took all our glasses and never replaced them. 3rd day they did not give us our 2 bottles of water included in the resort fee.

Wireless internet worked fine, good reception in our rooms.

If you don't like Valet parking your options would be to park @ Bellagio self park and walk 5 minutes back to the hotel or park @ Cosmopolitan and walk up to Vdara. I think Bellagio is a better option. Quickest way to the strip is if you go through the doors besides Silks, take the stairs down and there is a walkway to the strip or go through the side to Bellagio (longer but mostly indoors)

Not many dining choices, just an overly expensive cafeteria and a lounge. But close to Cosmopolitan's wicked spoon buffet (quickest way is take the stairs down, cross the covered taxi area to the hotel reception and take the elevator up to the 2nd floor.

I really enjoyed my stay here.  The price is excellent for what you get.  The location is great - very convenient.  The air is "fresher" than the other hotels (I usually get nauseous inside cigarette smoke infested areas... not the case here!).  The room was very modern and roomy.  I liked the layout a lot.  Only complaint is that the cleaning crew forgot to empty the previous guests' leftovers and water bottles in the fridge.

Aside from its magnificent view (21st floor panoramic room), the service is unbeatable. When we arrived in the room, a coffee was missing (there was supposed to be two in the fridge). We called housekeeping, and they came up within 10 min with 4 coffee refills. Also, because the hotel is smoke-free, the air is fresh, and your clothes won't smell smoky after going down to the lobby. On the last day of our stay, we decided to do laundry so that we would not have to carry a load of dirty clothes back home. We called housekeeping, and they gladly brought up two boxes of laundry powder and fabric softener.

As for the location, my only complaint is that Vdara has no indoor connecting pathway to nearby casinos. We went during the middle of winter, so we had to endure strong, gusty winds while wearing teeny tiny dresses and heels outside. 

But aside from that, I genuinely like the hotel a lot. I would recommend it for those who are looking for a relaxing and calm hotel. If you are seeking for fun\/gambling, you can find it in the casinos (Cosmo, Aria, Bellagio) nearby.

This is a great hotel with a very nice modern design. It's PERFECT for those wanting to avoid the usual loud casino hotels with people smoking. I absolutely loved this place. Very classy, cosy, and easy to get to your room. Vdara also has a great location. It feels like having your own personal residence. The service is also top-notch.

My friend and I decided to try Vdara based upon her experience with her husband and the fact that it was non-smoking which for me was a PLUS besides not having to wind your way through a huge casino to get to the room elevators.
The front desk was efficient and accommodating and check-in was a breeze. Our room on the 11th floor looked great but the bed was SO badly broken down I just had to complain. Not to mention the coffee maker I planned on in the room was no longer free and cost $20\/DAY, outrageous for a single cup but I'm sure Starbucks downstairs complained and that's why they were removed.
So the next day when I complained we were moved to another suite on the 27th floor... A corner one with a good view although we were working and the view was not a priority. Teresa at the front desk was gracious and included the coffee maker at no charge for which I was grateful. The new location was a bit smaller with a different layout. My complaint here was the lack of working lights, 3 were out including the critical one over the vanity. One of the blackout shades in the living room was just plain gone. The showers sucked in both rooms because you couldn't adjust the head up or down but just side to side and the new room's shower reeked of sulphur and make my skin break out. But the bed was gloriously fir and comfortable.
Although I love the non smoking, I may return to my favorites.. Bellagio and Palazzo.

I've been to Las Vegas plenty of times--both for work and fun.  And have also stayed in many hotels.  Both nice and not so nice.  Vdara hotel is a dream for me. Located just off the Strip, it is one of the newish properties of City Center.  

It's uniqueness is that it does NOT have a casino, which is personally a huge plus!  

Gorgeous new and sleek\/modern architecture, a variety of places to grab food to go or sit to eat, state of the art gym facilities, pool (without music blaring).  I booked my room several months ago on Jetsetter for $159 and have a suite that is triple the size of my apartment with 2 bathrooms, living\/dining, full kitchen.  I love the blackout shades, comfy big beds with white duvets and down pillows.

Service is a little spotty at the restaurants, but that's the only downfall I can seem to find.

I must sound like I'm 90 years old, but there are only so many times you can put up with a smoky casino, the music, crowds, etc.  this hotel is like a slice of heaven just steps away from all of the action.

Easily one of the best hotels I've stayed with in Las Vegas.  Something just feels different about this place and I think that is due in part to the fact that there is no casino in the lobby.  Instead, you'll find a great bar, a Starbucks, hotel cafe and super quick and easy access right to the Bellagio!  No more walking out in the heat and the crowds!  The staff is so helpful and polite, and happy to help!  

I have to mention the parking.  How many places will you ever go to that offer FREE valet service?   FREE!!  The valet staff here are impeccable.  Extremely courteous, professional and literally all of them RUNNING back and forth to get cars, load luggage and offer assistance.  Whether it's 9am or 4pm with the crush of everyone checking in, their attitudes and service remain consistent = 100% professional and smiling.  It's pretty impressive and definitely makes you feel like an important and valued guest.

The rooms here are a delight and I haven't had a bad view yet (not to mention a bad price: there are always fantastic deals!).  Whether looking down at the pools and neighboring hotels or the massive expanse of the desert skyline merging into the downtown strip - it's just beautiful.  Everyone knows how the strip lights up at night, now just imagine watching those lights and the Bellagio fountains from your room!  And um, let's talk about those windows - push of a button to go up or down for the privacy shade or blackout shades?  Say what?!  Once again, left feeling valued and important.  Maybe a little like a rockstar.  

I had the 'spa breakfast' delivered to my room in the morning and the server was top shelf.  Not only did he usher the cart into the kitchen area, but completely laid out my place setting to include arranging my plate, silverware, coffee and juice, condiments and ice water!  The night before when I placed my order I requested a muffin from the cafe that was not on the menu and without any hesitation it was added to my order.

I did not visit the pool on this visit but have been before and the service there is also wonderful.  You can order right from the menu and have the food delivered happily to your poolside chair.  

I left the hotel feeling totally pampered and cannot wait to go back!

I carefully choose hotels, especially when traveling to Vegas.  This trip was different for us because we brought our one year old.  Vdara was at the top of the list because it's smoke-free and no casino.  I came here for a convention and figured to make a family trip out of it.
First of all, I understand that this weekend was HUGE.  Not only were there conventions galore, but also EDC, & the Pacquio\/Bradley match.  Yes, tons of people!  I won't knock the type of people that were at Vdara because it's not their fault.  Let's just say they weren't exactly the baby-friendly crowd...but whatev's.  On the other hand...the pool guy should have been, but wasn't.  As I was checking out the pool, he was quick to mention that "there aren't a lot of babies at this hotel".  Um..yeah, I saw quite a few.  I asked how deep is the pool and this smarty pants replied "as deep as the bottom".  Helpful, wasn't he?  Jerk.
We arrived at 11am thinking we could check-in early like most hotels.  As I entered the line, I got denied.  System failure = no check in until 3pm.  This to me reads, they weren't prepared for the big weekend and quickly had to turnover rooms.  People were sitting on the floor, hanging out outside (& smoking - gee, that's a funny smoke-free policy.  They make you initial some contract that states there's no smoking inside or in the front entrance.  Vdara needs to keep true to their policy and regulate.)  Bellhop was backed-up.  I understand "stuff" happens, but that's when customer service shines...when things go wrong, how do you correct?  An empty "sorry" & free water is a cop out.  Figure out a better solution!  I'm not a hotel professional, but I am a guest and those two weren't good enough. This was a hotel situation and your guests were inconvenienced.   
Another downfall was housekeeping.  I left my daughter's spoon out (my bad) on the kitchen table.  For some reason, housekeeping decided to throw it away.  Hey, that's just great!  They cleaned out the microwave, but just stashed the plate back in without aligning it to the wheels.  They did a good job keeping our room clean, but have to pay attention to details!
Last gripe - called and asked what time is check-out and late check-out.  Snippy Answer:  "Eleven o'clock and we don't have late check-out's at this time."  I wasn't asking to check out late, I was asking for their times.  But thanks for jumping the gun and assuming.  Such hospitality, eh?
On the plus side, the guys at the valet were super nice and helpful.  Bellhops were extremely gracious.  Room service is superb.
BOTTOM LINE:  Looks can be deceiving.  Just like a pretty girl with a nasty personality.  Would I stay here again?  Probably...err...not.  FAIL.  Major fail.  I should have just spent money on the five star hotel I Yelped a couple years ago.  Nothing can match their service.  Words of advice: Slow down, learn to be more courteous, truly care for your guests, pay attention to details, and fix your computers (or come up with plan B).

Why give this a bad rating? This is the best hotel I ever went to for vacation for 2015. I got a room at 15th floor and they reserved me the room of seeing Las Vegas Blvd and the screened advertisements! Thanks Vdara!

I dont even know how I ended up here. Had a girls trip all planned out a couple months in advance. Really nice AirBNB home booked, next thing I know my girl switched it up and we're staying here. Been a while since I'd been to Vegas and I'd never heard of the Vdara.
Nice and easy to find to find right next door to Aria. I was disappointed to hear there's no more free parking in Vegas. You'd think at least as a guest at the hotel parking would be included. Nope! $25 a day. At least hide the charge in the fees or something sheesh. 
Nice lobby, only a cafe & Starbucks available. Quick & easy check-in. Nice elevators although one trip down someone threw up in one...sigh. 
The suite was rather nice. Nice kitchen  and small seating area, couple large mirrors a girl can appreciate. Living area included pullout couch, chair, desk and flat screen. The bedroom was seperated by a small wall. Pretty comfy bed and another flat screen. Bluetooth speaker groove or set the mood. The bathroom was probably the best part. Loved the glass shower. Included a seat to just relax. Too busy to use the tub, but it looked nice. Double sink and light up vanity mirror that was perfect for putting on makeup. Theres a full body mirror, but it or the lighting could be better. 
Service was good as we had to call for extra towels and few minor things. 
Overall it was fine if you're just looking for somewhere to sleep, which is all we needed it for

The Vdara is an excellent place to stay when visiting Las Vegas for business or pleasure. Sophisticated appointments and stylish rooms offer a break from the craziness of the Strip, with immediate access to neighboring hotels and casinos. 

We came to the Vdara for New Years Eve 2017 to get a good view of the fireworks, and the Vdara did not disappoint. After booking a Corner Suite Fountain View room on the 53rd floor, we were treated to amazing views of the city from every room in our suite. Although the room was quite spacious, the floor plan was not optimal, cutting up the space with walls and dividers.  This was a minor problem for this particular room, I've stayed in other lower priced rooms that felt more spacious, even though they were much smaller. 

One of the best things about the Vdara is the reasonable options for dining at the hotel. Unlike the other premium properties in this area, the Vdara has a market in the lobby where one can find a wide variety of affordable options for breakfast, lunch and dinner. 

The staff at the Vdara are top notch. I found every team member to be personable and friendly, ready to go the extra mile to ensure your satisfaction. 

If your coming to Vegas for a convention or business event, you will be well served here at the Vdara. It's close to many convention venues and has everything a business traveler needs at a reasonable price. 

Overall, I really enjoyed my stay at the Vdara and I look forward to returning someday soon. 

5 Stars.

I love this place! My boyfriend treated me to a "staycation" for my birthday and surprised me with this.
