The entire time we were there, from the time we checked in to the time we checkout out, was amazing! Our room was beautiful and the view from the 33rd floor was awesome as well. The entire staff impressed me with how hospitable they all were, especially the bartenders and the bell boys. The only complaint I would have is the room next to us a barking dog but we mentioned it to one of the staff and it stopped. I would come back here in an instant!

There are so many things that went wrong yet still a lot of things I liked about the hotel. I think it has great potential. I'm not sure if they were understaffed during the holiday or all the staff are brand new but they really need to get it together. 

What went wrong:
1) The first encounter at check in took a long time. Then we were checked into a room that's already had guests checked on the same day. We had two rooms. I called the front desk from the other room and was told they will upgrade us due to the confusion but when I went down to get the key, the promise was not documented and not set up. We ended up waiting another 30 mins at the front desk trying to figure this out with a "not so friendly" front desk guy. He seemed annoyed that we are asking for this. He finally set up the new room for us but when I got back up to the room, the TV won't turn on saying I'm not checked in to the room. I ended up having to call front desk Again and after talking to the manager, I was able to get everything straighten out. This whole process took at least 2 hours. 
- the manager was nice about accommodating us and compensating us for all this mess including upgrading our room and waving the resort fee.

2) We literally had to call house keeping 4 times PER ROOM to get extra blankets. Waited at least an hour per room to get what we needed. Finally had to escalate it to the manager again to get something as simple as blankets. 

3) The dog crate was the same ordeal but took 2 calls instead of 4. 

4) The main reason for trying out vdara is for our dogs. We wanted to enjoy the holidays with our dogs and Vdara is a great dog friendly hotel. They provided a dog park next to the hotel, blankets for your dog, a dog cookie, dog crate and dog bowls! Even doggie room service meal (at extra price)! But this comes with a heavy price tag which was NOT provided before booking the hotel. You don't find out until you check out. $75 per night per room dog cleaning fee. This is very pricey compared to most other dog friendly hotels that usually charges a one time fee instead of daily fee for cleaning. You really don't sanitize the room daily while you are still there so why a daily fee? 
This hotel really came with a lot of hidden fees that were not explicit until you get there - when it's too late to change. 

5) For some random reason the same day we checked in and after going through all the ordeal. The key card stopped working for one of our rooms. We had to call front desk again.....

What was good:
1) The rooms are nice and clean. The picture accurately reflects how the room looks. There is a kitchen complete with stove, microwave and oven (but no pots or pans) in some suites. Great views at the room facing Bellagio!
2) Dog amenities are very complete. 
3) Most staff were friendly and apologetic. I feel like the managers constantly have to provide free things for people because of all the hiccups.  
4) They were good about adjusting to the realtime room price which was lower compared to when I booked the rooms.
5) Close to walk to Aria and bellagio. Slight off the strip so you can bypass the strip traffic. 
6) valet service is $18 per day but you can valet at any MGM hotels. 

Overall my stay was not bad except for checking in and checking out. I had to figure out how much I was going to get charged since they keep putting multiple pending charges to your card. I really don't remember having all these problems in the past at any hotel. 

I really hope if was a holiday thing....

I'm not sure if I want to come back. I may consider coming back due to the great dog amenities if there isn't something else available that measures up.

We're here for some "chill out" time in Vegas- get away, relax, light sightseeing, nothing crazy. This hotel is pretty perfect for that.
First- the lovely Kyle checked us in. He was kind and courteous, and offered us an upper-floor upgrade for free. Nice! Also, a lens popped out of my spouses glasses on the way to the hotel, and he lent us his personal eye-glass repair kit. Vdara, if you're reading this, Kyle is awesome and saved the day, or at least saved us a trip to CVS.
The room is gorgeous and big, and on the 51st floor the view was amazing. You can order room service from a tablet next to the bed. 2 tvs. Could fit two more people with the pull out couch. Nice big clean bathroom with separate shower and soaking tub, and the little kitchen is cute, even tho we likely won't use it.
The resort is nice too. The bar in the lobby, Vice Versa, is pretty sweet- the outdoor seating are is very cool. The little market is nice too. The pool is open year-round which is rare in this city. I like the option of hottubbing, but we're here in December so we'll probably skip the actual pool.
My favorite part- NO SMOKING AND NO CASINO. We recently quit smoking, and the sound and energy of a casino can be sort of overwhelming, so we love it. Not like there's not a million casinos within a stones throw anyway- the location kicks ass.
I'd recommend this place in a heartbeat. We'll be back.

Awesome place to be away from Vegas, Vegas if you know what I mean. It's sleek, well designed and free of smoke and gaming. I know, I know I am taking all of the fun outta Vegas - but hey Vdara is a nice place. 
If you are in town for business, Vdara is perfect! You'll be able to focus, and you can show up at your meetings without a cigarette odor. 

Vdara delivers nice views, great design, and superb service. I recommend this hotel for families, business travelers and non-smokers.

This place surprised me with its modernize style suites. We were lucky enough to have a suite facing the strip and the poolsides of VDARA and cosmopolitan. The coolest part is the bathroom view. Showering on your birthday suit with Landscape view and silhouette of the mountain is a pretty good experience I must say. Anyways, 6\/5 would come back.

Would I stay here again?  Probably not.  The biggest problem being the low water pressure in the shower.  Vdara's explanation is that their hotel is "green and environmentally friendly".   I can commend them for being environmentally friendly, but it just doesn't fit my needs.

That being said, the customer service here is great, everyone there was very courteous and willing to assist you.  I ended up wanting to switch hotels due to the water pressure issue, and they were very cooperative and understanding.  I wanted to switch to one of Vdara's sister hotels, and they were very accommodating.   My reservation was through priceline's name your bid and priceline told me they won't be able to make changes to my reservation.  Chinnaha at the front desk went the extra mile and called priceline directly for me.  She was able to get my entire reservation refunded with priceline. 

I had their standard room.  The room itself was extremely nice, it had a small refrigerator, dining table for two, and electric stove-top.  I was even able to hookup my laptop (using HDMI) to the LCD TV.

By the way, Vdara is a valet-ONLY hotel (i think you can self park in Aria's self-parking if you want).

No casino?  WIN
Free valet parking?  WIN
All rooms are suites?  Clean?  Modern?  Luxurious?  Electric curtains?  Futuristic hallways?  Sweet spa for my wife?  Did I miss anything?

The only dislikes were the slow car retrieval, weak wireless network and lack of tea and coffee in the basic suite.  All that probably takes away just 0.2 star.  Very nice place to stay AND it's cheaper than Aria's non-suites,  That is especially true with the show package.

Wow! The reviews here are pretty spot on.  This is more like a 4.5 star review. This place is very nice if you are looking for a classy hotel without the Vegas feel (I mean that in a good way). You get to party in Vegas and then come to a hotel that is smoke-free and slot-machine free.

I stayed here in December with the hubby and we were both pleased.  We booked a regular Deluxe Suite but were upgraded to a City View Suite.. SWEET!  

We got the views of the mountains and it was perfect as we love nature. When we stepped out of our room we got to see the famous Bellagio Fountains from the lobby. I don't need to see the fountains from my room so this room was perfect. 

So why do I not give the perfect score? 1\/2 star deducted because although they have dishwasher, dryer\/washer they do not include detergent or the likes.  We called housekeeping and then personally went to the lobby to get plates, soap etc. Another 1\/2 star deducted because the "free" upgrade came with an additional $15\/per night surcharge in addition to the resort fee. I don't mind paying it if I know in advance I will be charged.

Tip: Try to avoid the cafe in the lobby as it is WAY OVERPRICED!! I live in NYC and I still found the prices for their food ree-deek-u-lus! Shop at Walgreens on the Strip and save yourself a few bucks. Use that $$ to gamble.

Great room in a nonsmoking hotel.  But... no in-hotel restaurant, small bar, less than average pool for size of hotel, few staff and mediocre service.  No casino so hotel must rely on room rates for income.  Concierge's dinner recommendations were all for restaurants owned by owners of Vdara.  There are better options for the price in Las Vegas.

LOOK FOR RATES HERE. REALLY GREAT PLACE
I stayed here for my trip to Vegas. Hands down the suite was amazing. Really nice and mondern place to stay at and it's on the famous strip. Whenever ever you want to gamble, they have their own miniature Casio. Best recommend to just across the street to Aria. Sleeping is the most important tool here in Vegas, so don't search any further. 
Only bad experience is that my fridge doesn't get cold at all. So no nice cooled beers whenever you want.

WORST. VALET. EVER. I would've given Vdara 4 stars if it wasn't for their valet and considering that they only have a valet and no self parking, it's kind of a big deal. The valet parking garage is somewhat close to the valet pick up and as I waited for my car I heard pretty loud screeching of tires and brakes. I hoped it wasn't my car but soon after my car came out and as the valet guy started braking my brakes were also screeching...like wuhhhhhtttt. Oh and I was the only there at pick-up. My car is 3 1\/2 yrs old and my brakes are 6 months old! Even I myself don't make my tires screech and eff my brakes up that much!!! I'm fairly upset and had wished I gotten his name but I was giving him doubt but the moment I started driving my car I knew he messed it up. 



Don't get me wrong though, not all the valet guys are like that but at the same time considering that Vdara is a high-end hotel, something like this shouldn't go on unnoticed! I actually am from Vegas and have high standards for these places and nothing like this has EVER HAPPENED elsewhere. It's quite disappointing that that specific employee had no respect for my car, I honestly shouldn't even have tipped him. Ugh! EVERYONE BEWARE, just park at the Aria for self parking or other surrounding properties and walk rather than having to take your car to the shop -____-
So disappointing. 



I don't write reviews and it's pretty sad that my first one had to be this bad!

My stay was great. The hotel is small since there's no casino but you just make a short walk to the cosmo and there's your casino. Every time my friends and i stepped into vdara we had to comment on the smell. My friend loved it so much she wanted to purchase whatever air freshener they use but never got around to asking. Rooms were a good rate and very spacious, I felt like I got what I paid for, it's not as large of a suite as the ones in venetian or palazzo but like I said you get more than enough for what you pay for. If you're younger and looking for a party then check into Cosmo but if you like quiet and comfortable book here. I've also stayed at the cosmo which was a lot of fun for my bachelorette but we ended up coming back to Vdara to use their spa facility. I've gotten their 50 minute swedish massage twice, and it's wonderful! They employ some different things I've never had done before like placing a hot stone on your lower back i figure to warm and loosen up the area before they get into the massaging. And the other thing I noticed was that they place little warmers over your feet ... it was unusual to me that they concentrated on my feet longer than I've ever really experienced at any other massage but it was nice because I was in heels the night before! Aside from the great massage, the facility is small but nice too. I went with 5 of my girlfriends and though it was small we felt like we had the whole place to ourselves bc there weren't many other guests. There's a small little jacuzzi, warming chairbeds, a sauna and steam room, lounge and quiet room. They have the basics but when we went that's all we needed to relax. I've also been to the Canyon Ranch Spa in the Venetian which was really fancy and nice but also way too crowded.

Definitely one of my favorite places to stay at in Vegas.

The suite my friends and I stayed in was amazing. The layout of our suite was beyond fantastic. We had a kitchenette, a living room with a pullout queen sized sofa, a king size bed with sliding doors, and a HUGE restroom. I love how there's so much sunlight coming through each room and the view was really nice in my opinion! I just realized there isn't a casino on the first floor like every hotel on the Las Vegas strip! I mean, it's all good though... Aria is basically next door! It's also a smoke free hotel! Also, there's no self-parking, it's all Valet and it's kind of a wait to get your car especially during check out.

So much space and that kitchen was sooooo useful. I had such a blast staying at Vdara, even if it was just for a day haha. I'd definitely stay here more often whenever I'm coming to Vegas.

My stay at the Vdara was fantastic, it made the Las Vegas trip flow easily. The location is great, most of the places my group wanted to go were in walking distance.

I loved the non-smoking part the most, in a city where people can smoke everywhere it was nice to unwind in a clean environment. There is no casino inside, so you don't have to worry about crazy mobs of angry people down on their luck sloshing through the lobby just a relaxing place to sleep. They have a lot of little amenities and features that set it apart from other places I've stayed. They have automated black out curtains, the magazines laid out on the coffee table the large tub I didn't use and the amazing 24 hour room service. After a long night of gambling (losing all my money) and drinking (too much) it was nice to be able to come into my room at 3 in the morning and order a breakfast burrito and an ice cold Fat Tire Amber Ale. Also I have to mention the cafe downstairs that had the best turkey sandwich I've ever had in my life; roasted meat with aioli on cranberry bread.

The Aria casino next door is mind blowing too, all of the City Center is. They are under the MGM umbrella. The blackjack tables had 25 minimums, turns out that's not the best setting for a first time player, rookie mistake. But, I had fun and would do this again.

Oh, Vdara. I wish I could like you more, but you're not as wonderful as you look on the outside.

Check-in was at 3 p.m., but since me and my friends arrived around 11 a.m., we wanted to see if they could check us in early. The front desk said they'd have the room ready in the next two hours. 1 p.m. arrived and there was no phone call about being able to check-in yet. It was almost 3 p.m. and by then, we went back to the front desk and they said it was still not ready. What?! At first, they said it would take another half hour or so before we'd be able to go up and I'm not sure what happened, but after a couple of minutes, they said it was ready and we were on our way up.

Although we got a nice, panoramic view of Vegas, we were a bit disappointed to find trash still underneath the sink, sticky table tops, traces of dry vomit on the sheets, and empty bottles left in the refrigerator. While they were very professional about taking care of the situation, it was still frustrating having to call the manager and explain the situation when all this could have been avoided if it was cleaned properly the first time.

Not sure if I'd consider checking-in here again, but the hotel did do its job for the weekend. I'm just glad to be back home now - sans vomit-stained bed.

This place is awesome! I've stayed at several Vegas hotels in the last year and this is the best. The room is huge. The bathrrom has a large, deep tub and separate shower. There is a small kitchenette with table. The living space has two chairs, a large couch and a big screen tv. 

It is the cleanest and most well apointed Vegas hotel I've stayed at thus far.

If your plan is to score a cheap thrill from one who's acting a fool and stumbling out of the club, then take that person to downtown Vegas or find yourself a sleazy motel. If you have quality company that deserves a lot more than weak tricks and theatrics, then consider Vdara. This non-casino, eco-friendly, and smoke-free property is located in the back corner of the City Center area. Write this down playas, if you want to impress your lady friend(s), book a stay at this classy joint. It's mad money.

You can easily walk over to the Cosmopolitan or Aria hotels from the Vdara, including the City Center if you can afford to spend loot at those shops there. Also, there's a monorail that connects you to adjacent hotels if you so choose to take.

Valet it, even if it's a '97 Honda Civic on chrome Enkei rims and an exhaust system that will instantly fail a smog check. If you haven't figured it out by now, valet service at Vegas hotels work on discretionary tip. Don't be so frugal, minimum $2-3 bucks at least please. These folks do work hard especially when it's 106 outside. Besides, I don't think they even have self parking available for you. So bring in that hoopty, it's all good.

Even though there isn't a casino in this hotel, the lobby area can still be quite vibrant and occupied by all sorts of mammals. There's a lounge that seems to attract people at all hours. The elevators are guarded 24\/7 by the grey suits so make sure you have your room key with you at all times. 

We got to stay on the 38th floor and most importantly in a corner room. This place was sick. Windows all around the entire room: from the long corridor\/hallway leading to the full kitchen, passed the washer and dryer to the living room into the bedroom, and finally leading in the restroom. We nearly had 360 degrees of view; it was more like 270 degrees. All the windows are controlled by electronic shades. For a darker enclosure, hit the "black out" button. Stainless steel is found throughout the kitchen which is stocked with glasses, silverware, plates and bowls. The refrigerator is huge enough to store food for a Greek family's two weeks worth of goods. 

The bathroom had a separate toilet section followed by an all glass shower. The separate tub sits right next to it while facing out the windows. You will be able to soak in all the lovely visuals of the city as you frolic in the tub.

The free mini gym offers state of the art cardio machines and weight machines. There's not too many dumb bells to work with so if the place is packed with meat heads then good luck. They offer fresh towels, water, and even headphones to connect you to their equipment. Flat screens were posted all over the place with ESPN blasting away. The gym is located next to the spa on a separate floor.

Calling it a "room" or a "suite" here is by far a total understatement. It was more like an upscale and high end one bedroom apartment or condo. I've been impressed by many top hotels in Sin City but this one just seemed to be very intimate as compared to the others. The Vdara is ideal for couples, honeymooners, people who travel in style, or even for families. But let's say you had 5+ dudes wanting to bunk up in a single one bedroom here, I'd probably pass and look for other options. Otherwise, this place is sick with it.

The mobile check-in will save you an hour at 3pm. I was in and up in my room within 10 minutes. Friendly front desk, but not overly courteous, so so.

The rooms are spacious, the strip\/fountain view was just as seen on their website's pictures. Clean room, clean hotel. It is a non smoking facility and well you get the air and cleanliness that you would expect. 

The hotel's ambiance is boring. It's low key and out of touch with the rest of the ramblings that go down in Vegas. The good parts come courtesy of the walkway to the Bellagio and from the Aria being across the roundabout. Their amenities are subpar. The pool is okay but their bar is terrible. Although I did not have a chance to check their restaurants out, I did find their shop in the lobby convenient for when you need the essentials. 

The Vdara sets out to be what it advertises. A quiet upper middle class magnet. If you use your room for tranquility when you're away from the tables and clubs then you've found a winner. If you like your hotel to feed you the vibes...look elsewhere. Research it for 10-15 minutes, you'll get exactly what you expect.

Upon check in I was treated like royalty,  customer service was great,  my room was one of the best I've stayed in. Bed was so comfortable, everything was clean and the view from room was breathtaking...I definitely will be staying again.

+ Hotel aesthetic 
+ cleanliness 
+ staff
+ rooms

- wifi strength
 

I arrived at Valet and was greeted by friendly staff, helped with my bags (after asking) got all my proper valet & room tags.

The Hospitality Suite I stayed in was immaculate, the hallways are reminiscent of condos. Unfortunately flatware only comes in rooms per request which sucks when you need to finish out your melted ice for a drink.

Full separate sitdown type in addition to a huge shower. I stayed on the 47th floor which had great views of the city.

Plush towels. Security checks room keys at night before boarding the elevator . I plan to check out the pool today, but I'd stay here again for sure

The best hotel I've ever stayed in....and I travel often. My wife and I stayed here for our anniversary. Kyle, at the front desk, upgraded us to a suite as an anniversary gift. Our entire stay was amazing!!!

This is not a luxury hotel but a timeshare\/condo hotel.  I had to be moved three times and still jot great. Furniture watermarked, scratched and dirty. Kitchen cabinets are chipped and worn.  The hotel is not that old and obviously its customers do not take care of it.  If you stay in the animal tower, you will hear dogs barking.  While staff friendly the rooms are overpriced for how they are maintained. But if you are in the mentality that you rented a timeshare or a condo then you will be pleased.  Nice to have a full kitchen but you have to call three times to get cups, teakettle, silverware etc.  Just know going in and you may be happy

came here for a friend's birthday weekend on halloween weekend and this room surprised me. gorgeous! we had 9 people stay in two connecting rooms. two beds and two pull out beds. flat screens in the rooms, kitchen area, BEAUTIFUL bathroom WOW (guys, the shower is amazing. could of stayed in there for days. modeling my future home after their beautiful ass bathroom).

overall, hotel was very accommodating to all of our requests and even when we came back from the club late at night, the security helped us get back in to our rooms due to the cards getting demagnetized!

as for the vdara cafe:
great service and guys, in one day i came here twice and order the same burger\/fries combo because it was BOMB! tho $16 was so pricey. but its vegas.

overall: would stay here again, try to get a better view because the windows are great and big!, wished it had more food choices downstairs, had casinos or something fun to do other than starbucks and vdara cafe

Love that it is a non-gambling\/non-smoking hotel. This makes for a more refreshing, quiet ambience. It is not directly on the strip (located behind Aria, which is on the strip) which I enjoyed. You don't run into the busy, tourist commotion, like other hotels.
Free valet parking, for guests. Hotel guests also get free admission into HAZE night club, located in the Aria hotel
The room was great! Amzung view if the water show at the Bellagio It had a kitchenette,  The room could have been a tad bit cleaner. We noticed greasy hand prints on the dining room chairs, and hair in out tub, (not a big deal if youre not OCD, like me). The sofa bed mattress felt like fabric over springs, so we ended up not using it.
Overall, it is a great place to stay. I will definatley be coming back

Probably my hands down favorite place to stay on the strip. Customer service was impeccable. There is no casino in the hotel and the pool is small, but that does limit the craziness of the crowds. Which is great! 

The Market in the lobby had excellent snack choices. It was also had incredibly convenient access to Bellagio. 

The room was incredible and had a washer and dryer! I would say that if you choose to stay at Vdara, it will not disappoint you.

My fiancé and I booked a room here the weekend of 9\/24. Our total stay was 2 hours and the staff members mistreated us from the valet to the front desk. We ended up canceling the room and staying at another hotel. 3 weeks later we receive a charge of 436.97 on our account stating that it was "satisfying the debt" of our stay. I've spoken with my travel agent, the front desk, MGM resorts international, and my bank as well to remove
this charge. It's been 7 business days and still no refund. Highly recommend staying away from this place.
iI just got back ,I loved it there .I didn't want to come home . I will always stay here now . I have stayed many places in Vegas and this is my husband and my fav .

I like this hotel. Staff are friendly and helpful. A little grocery Store is available at the lobby. Rooms are clean and good looking. 4 Star because the pool is pretty small and not very deep.lol. Items for sale are a bit expensive as well. (Well, I understand why but still.).  Overall: it's a good hotel. Ohhh.. I forgot the tram (free) and a way to go to the bellagio's lobby without going out on the street. I like it

We stayed here for my bachelorette party and the room was awesome! I loved having a kitchenette (despite the fact that we didn't cook at all), fridge, and essentially two rooms. The employees were very friendly and helpful. They took care of our non-working fridge promptly.
The soaking tub in the bathroom was simply amazing. I went to the nearby CVS to pick up some bubble bath so I could enjoy it. The view from our room looked out over the Bellagio, so we could watch the fountain show from our room if we wanted. 
It was nice not having to walk through a casino to get to the hotel elevators to get back to the room, giving the Vdara a more relaxing, resort-like atmosphere. 
The cafe in the lobby is just so-so. It's rather overpriced for what you get, so I'd recommend going elsewhere to eat. That's the only other downside of the Vdara, there isn't a real restaurant inside, so you have to go to the Aria or Cosmopolitan for a buffet or full-service restaurant. 
If you have the time and the funds, enjoy an afternoon renting one of the poolside cabanas. One of my friends treated us to this, and it was the most relaxing time we had there! The cabanas share a small, private pool, plus you get a mini-fridge stocked with fruits and snacks. Each cabana has four lounge chairs and offers food and drink service so you can eat poolside. The crabcake eggs benedict is incredible, as is the berry sangria.

I recently stayed at Vdara for 3 days, and the experience was heaven on earth.  I opted for the City Corner Suite and it was worth every single penny.  The room is 800+ square feet with 270 degree panoramic panty dropping views that are absolutely incredible, washer and dryer in the unit... what more could you ask for.  I had a few friends over that were staying at local hotels and there was more than enough room for all of us to relax before going out, with a bedroom, living room, and full kitchen.  The bathroom alone could hold 20 people, it was huge!  My only gripe was the pull out couch wasn't the most comfortable, but everything else exceeded my expectations to such a degree, that it didnt even bother me.  I'm currently planning my next trip, and I will definitely be staying at the Vdara again.

Its like a veneer of cool. The hotel is really modern and at first glance kind of cool but when you take the time to really look...Youll notice that its kind of fake luxury. The furniture, wall paper , fixtures make you feel like you are in an Ikea show room. The pillows were un useable.
 Really wish we had stayed at Wynn instead.

Beautiful rooms.  I got a room on the 43rd floor, and it was spectacular.  The linens really could have been of a higher thread count (but I'm a linen snob).  The bed was very comfortable,with a nice TV (I know, it's Vegas, but I'm getting older and I want to watch TV before I go to bed semi-sober).  

Service is friendly and gracious.  I love the non-smoking smell, although the perfumy smell is somewhat overwhelming at first.

I absolutely love this Hotel!! This one has to be my favorite Vegas Hotel thus far. I must admit I haven't stayed at all of the 5 star hotels yet but when it comes to this one, you wont regret it.  Its one of the only hotels with out  a casino in it which to me, makes it even more pleasant. The people are nice and the rooms are immaculate. The view can be stunning depending on where your room is and when you get in that bed and hit the button to close the shades, you will feel like you're in heaven. Experience it for yourself!!

currently staying in room 43-026. My 70 year old mom got stuck in the bathroom for almost an hour because the shitty lock got stuck. She was trapped, we tried to call the front desk and was on hold for a good 20 minutes. Gave up and my brother in law finally was able to pry the door open with some tool he had. Terrible customer service.

This is my first time to stay at Vdara.  I stayed at Aria before and I loved it there.   I thought Vdara would have the same quality of resort living.  But I guess i was totally wrong.   I felt disgusted inside the room.  The tub and sink look pretty awesome, but then I turned around and saw some disgusting yellow stuff stuck on the wall.  That was gross.   So I wrote a note to the maid and let her know about the yellow situation on the wall.  I was hoping she would clean it when she cleaned up the room.  Oh well, it was still there.  

And the design of their shower gel and lotion is bad, it's hard to get anything out from those ridiculous little champagne bottles.  Make sure you have your amenities prepared if you stay here. 

Last but not least, I sat on my bed and was going to watch some TV.  I grabbed the remote and saw the power button was all greasy.  I gave up.   No more Vdara for sure.

Took my wife here for her birthday.  Steve who helped us check was amazing and got us upgraded to a penthouse.  Fantastic hotel and the room was fantastic with everything we could possobly need!  Fantastic birthday!

I like the spacious parlor suites at Vdara. There is a mini fridge, microwave, sink and a small electric stove top for cooking. The only thing missing is a coffee pot. The size of the room is nice to have with a desk and couch and 2 tvs. The bed was comfortable and we had a partial view of the Bellagio fountains. We loved that it is a non smoking property without a casino. 
The pool and fitness center are both small compared to other MGM properties. The gym was a bit crowded when I used it and there were only two elliptical steppers. 
We enjoyed the location and it's easy to walk a hall way to the Bellagio to access the strip. 
We recently had stayed at Aria in September and I prefer the Aria. They have a better pool, and huge workout room. I prefer the floor to ceiling glass windows in the corner suite of the Aria and the iPads next to the bed to control the shades and lights in the room. At Vdara you have to get out of bed to operate the shades and lights. However the Vdara does have a small kitchen space if you prefer to cook and save money on food. We ate out during our stay so the kitchen wasn't used during our stay. It was kind of nice not having a casino in the Vdara and it was more quiet. We just walked to the Aria quite frequently during our stay. We did get a great rate direct with MGM Life for Vdara this time. I think next time I would stay at Aria because I missed the Cybex machines and larger fitness center this trip. The pool area is much larger too. When staying in Vegas amenities like fitness center, the spa, and pool is what determines where I like to book. The corner suite at Aria was a bit more swanky than the Vdara parlor suite. I would recommend the Vdara though it just depends what you are looking for. Bellagio and Aria are my favorite M Life Properties to stay at. Make sure you get an MLife card when you stay and use it for all MLife restaurants, hotels, and casinos.

This was my first time staying here. It is not the typical vegas stay. It is quieter. It is less hectic. It feels like going home. 

The rooms aren't rooms, they are suites. Some complain about the lack of "action" here. That's the point. We walked and got cabs to everything crazy and exciting Vegas is supposed to be, then when we drug our butts back to Vdara it was perfect. Quiet and relaxing. Great for recharging and going at it tomorrow. 

The pool area is more hotel pool than resort pool. The cafe and bar downstairs are good. The location is great, short walk to the strip, aria, and bellagio. 

If your idea of vegas is leaving the room to stay in the building for a buffet and gambling then this isn't for you. You sleep here, relax here, eat and drink a little here, then you go out to experience vegas. 

Great water pressure, room temp control, nice views from the corner suites. It gave us a high roller feel. And housekeeping took the time not to just clean up and make the bed, but we noticed small things. A pair of shorts thrown on a chair were folded, our toiletries strewn about the sink were lined up neatly. I know these are small things but they don't happen everywhere. Even other nice places I've stayed on the strip they don't happen.

If I had one complaint, it would be in the billing. The daily $25 resort fees (just include it in the rate) and the 100 dollar per day security charge that they hold onto for a week after you leave. That security deposit seems unnecessary.  

Overall though I loved it.

This was, BY FAR, the WORST Hotel in Vegas I've ever stayed at. I've been to Vegas at least a dozen times, sometimes with family, sometimes with friends. In the past, I've stayed at Paris, Mandalay Bay (suite), Caesar's Palace, Imperial Palace, Monte Carlo, Treasure Island to show you the range of places I've stayed at. 

I just gave one of the newest hotels in the City Center ONE STAR. I'll go into the satisfactory aspects of this first, then go into why I had to end up giving it such a low rating.

My friends had a car accident close to the Strip & since their car was pretty much totaled, they had no way of getting to Vdara. Vdara was nice enough to give them a complimentary limo ride to the hotel. My friends tipped them generously for such a nice welcome.

The room was ok. We had one of the suites with a kitchenette & 2 flat screen TVs. 

That's about it, in terms of what this hotel had to offer, in my opinion. Now I will begin a "rant" of sorts about why I would never want to stay at Vdara again ( and why you should never stay here, if you can help it). 

There wasn't much to do in the hotel, since there was no casino. I noticed 1 bar and 1 little cafe. There wasn't a nightclub or anything else to do at night, as the nightlife section of the Vdara directory was nearly empty.

There is absolutely NO SELF-PARKING. You MUST valet your car (which is supposedly complimentary, but you & I both know that if you don't tip the guy you just left your car with...who knows if you'll get it back the way you left it!). The worst part about valeting your car is that you have to sit outside in the 100deg weather, WAITING for them to bring your car back to you. 

The bellhops I met there were generally the nicest employees I met in the hotel. Of course, you have to tip them (it's the polite thing to do), but it was awkward to me, because the bellhop who takes your bags & loads it onto the carts is different than the guy who ends up bringing them to you...which means that you have to tip...twice. I thought that was a bit lame, but maybe it's just me. It could easily be that I'm not used to staying in hotels like Vdara. 

There were no service elevators in Vdara, so room service, bellhops, you name it, would be crowded in the elevators with you, aka the "guests," which to me, seems pretty poorly thought out. It was no wonder that we ended up getting our bags close to 30 minutes after we were in our room!

In addition to all of the above, I'm going to give one final reason why I will never stay here again.

On the day we were checking out of the hotel, my friends & a poor Italian family were STUCK IN AN ELEVATOR. Yes, you heard right. STUCK IN AN ELEVATOR. Anyone seen Devil, the movie? eek!

The lights in there were like "spotlights" (?) which were tiny little lights which heat up the elevator like no other. I swear, I would've rather been out in Vegas heat instead of cramped in the elevator with 7 others. We were all SWEATING by the time we got out (approx 35 min later). Engineeers had to PRY open the doors. 

We were all trying to get down to the lobby to check out\/leave. The elevator opened randomly at the 3rd floor, and then closed again stubbornly after I pushed the "close door" button several minutes later. We noticed something glitchy but didn't think such a new hotel would have broken elevators. Finally the Lobby lit up but instead of stopping & the doors opening, it decided to go right on up to the 29th floor, seemingly on its own. When we got there, the doors, again, did not open. 

I called for help via the help\/emergency button in the elevator. We were asked a lot of questions, including which elevator we were in...which surprised all of us that they didn't already know which had stopped working. They asked us, more than once, which level we were on, and at the moment, we werent sure since we were stopped & the 29 kept blinking on the screen. It was very sad that the hotel couldn't figure out where we were for the longest time. 

Eventually when we got out, not only were we not offered any complimentary stays\/food, we got tiny bottles of water, which weren't even cold, I might add. To further add insult to injury, they requested that we all fill out tedious forms, BY HAND, with no clipboards whatsoever. They were "incident" reports & when we asked politely if we could dictate to them while they wrote, they said that they could not. We waited for a bellhop to come get our bags & waited 20 minutes. Then we waited again for an elevator to bring all of us down to the lobby. This whole ordeal set us back about 1hr 30 min. All we got was an apology from a security guy. No one else was here to talk to us when we got out. 

I don't know about you, but I come to hotels to relax and enjoy a mini vacation. In the elevator at Vdara, not only were we inconvenienced a great deal and put into great discomfort, but DELAYED in our plans to leave. We got a few bottles of water in return for this experience. NEVER AGAIN.

Just beautiful! I wanted to knock this resort one star for not allowing smoking and no gambling, but you should 100% know this going into booking here, and if anything there are obviously many hotels within a 10 minute walk. 
The rooms were beyond gorgeous. Me and one other shared a 2 queen deluxe suite and it was great. The other ladies including the bride had a HUGE luxury suite, four bedrooms, everything was great.

Great Corner Suite!

Love that its non-gaming when my kids come. They love the monorail! For a quiet, non gaming, no smoky air experience, after a fun night in town this hits the spot. 

Used the washer and dryer, the Kitchen and separate bedroom and auto shades are all super chic.

Self-parking is not available only valet. Here we go again.

This is going to be our "go-to" hotel from now on!  I really enjoyed our stay and ever employee that we encountered was very welcoming and nice.  We were able to take advantage of the gym and the convenience store and Starbucks.  This hotel provides amazing convenience to the Bellagio and Aria.  We could escape the hectic chaos of the casinos and enjoy the quiet of our hotel.  I would love to try the lobby bar and lounge next time we are there.
I loved the kitchenette in our room.  We had leftovers from our lunch and the fridge, microwave and cooktop came in handy when we wanted to heat them up after a night out at the club.  Definitely a great hotel next to it all.

AWESOME. There are not many places in Vegas that are non smoking and you don't exit the elevator into the sound of slots. Vdara has both of those. add in great service, beautiful rooms, a great pool area, a well located property and competitive prices and you have a fantastic getaway in Vegas.

i would have given this place 5 stars it is plush the staff are friendly, the room service is awesome and served butler style. HOWEVER when we got into our room we found trojan magnum condoms (thankfully not used) in a drawer and a plastic cup lid on the floor (not a great start). I know it is a new place but simple cleaning of a room should not be a teething problem. apart from that it is great and would recommend it. the bath is the deepest i have ever been in, I stayed in THE hotel at mandalay bay before and would say there is not much between them but i do like the central location of the vdara.

What a luxurious and modern hotel to stay at..."

VOUCHER:Purchase a voucher from travelzoo which was only $79 per night...

ONE NIGHT ONLY: Stayed there for one night and then had breakfast at the Vdara Market Cafe (best place for a quick & over priced breakfast, I recommend having some PHO instead)...

BEDS: So roomy and comfortable! Loved the hot tub & sofa by the window!

Would be back, back, back, when travelzoo has another special ;)

A beauty in every possible way except one: location. 
Rooms are dynamite. Pool laid back and pleasant. Entire place smoke free and smells terrific. But...location pretty lousy for 'on strip' site. To get there from strip on foot you must walk all the way through Bellagio and out the back on skywalk. A good 15 min (Tired feet at 1am this is no fun) or through Crystals mall. Either way it's a deal breaker. Unless of course you are driving and then access and valet are great. No restaurants might offend some but who cares. Eat anywhere else like the rest of us do.

I really liked the Vdara! I was here for one night for work, and I loved how spacious the rooms were...all suites! I just had a standard room, and that included a kitchenette, sofa bed, and regular bedroom area + spacious bathroom. And don't forget about the huge window! I even noticed that you could call the front desk to have dishes and cooking utensils brought to your room if you wanted.

The hotel is much quieter than the neighboring Bellagio which I think is really nice, but is connected via the tram and a walkway. I think it makes the Vdara a pretty convenient spot if you're attending a conference at the Bellagio, but wanting to get away from the hustle and bustle. Since I'm not a gamer, I also liked that the hotel did not have a casino and was smoke-free. 

Also, they give you Jelly Bellys at turn-down. How awesome is that?!

Beautiful modern hotel in the City Center complex, non smoking, no casino.

For a non-smoker like me, a smoke free property in Vegas was a great win! Gaming isn't available in this hotel, but is in all of the adjacent properties (Bellagio-attached, Cosmopolitan--next door, Aria--short walk around the roundabout). 

Rooms are large and modern, and come with a full kitchen, washer and dryer. It turns out this was originally a condominium building, and those amenities are a nice touch.

A nice spa is located within the property. The market cafe downstairs is a nice place for breakfast, a light bite, or to pick up items to keep in your kitchen.

One thing to note: there are no rooms with two doubles, though rooms come with a pullout sofa. The pullout sofa is pathetic!!!!!!!!! We pulled out the sofa and found the skinniest, creakiest (looked unused) mattress we'd ever seen... with four of us in the room, the two of us tried out the bed and rolled into one another--EEK! The hotel accommodated us and brought up a rollaway, and we made up the couch as a bed (instead of the pullout configuration). Just know this isn't the idea way to sleep four, so plan ahead or book elsewhere.

Resort fee is $25\/night (grrr... pet peeve of mine), but includes free internet (pretty quick, but you need to launch your web browser to activate it before opening apps on a smartphone or tablet), free newspapers and a few other things. Parking is not included, but we flew in, so not an issue for us.

Service all around was friendly and efficient. Nice central location on the strip and we were able to walk everywhere we needed to go (however a cab might be helpful for the more northern- or southern-end properties).

Forced valet. TRASH in the hallways. Dirty toilets. Awful! 
If you like handing over your keys to a complete stranger and\/or have a shitbox car, this is the place for you! I mean, of course, you could park on the strip where parking is limited and you have to wonder if a homeless man is going to use your wheel as a urinal cake. My car is my baby so having to hand it over would be the equivalent of someone saying they needed to bang my wife. Listen up, Vdara, you may NOT BANG MY WIFE! Especially not with your dirty, dirty hallways.

Call it more shabby than chic this time. My last stay the room was right out of a  page from Condé Nast - however, my current room has drawers that won't close, no flatware, coffee pot or even cups. The remote for the tv needed batteries and overall it simply wasn't in good condition.  Worn carpets that didn't seem quite clean.  I put a towel over the sofa cushions before I sat down. . .disappointing for the price.

On the other hand - service was impeccable.

If I can only give this place zero stars I would.  My wife and I decided to try this hotel out and avoid the noise of all the casinos. We have also decided to stay here to see if this would be a hotel to come back to with the kids.   I can tell you this, there is no coming back.  I hate writing bad reviews, but this needs to be brought out.  

As we received the key to our room we realize that our towels and the area of the bathroom counter had black hair all over.   It took housekeeping almost an hour to get here and address the problem.

Next day at the hotel restaurant we waited almost an hour for an order of oatmeal and a toasted bagel.  Our coffee was mostly Cold with very few refills within the hour.  When we try to address the problem with the waiters they've told us that we simply have to wait because they were extremely busy.   After discussing this issue with the manager he apologized and advised us that our food ticket was lost.

When attempting to reach management and or front desk from our room  and were placed on an average hold of 40 minutes.  we address this with the front desk:management downstairs they devised us that they share an operator with the Aria Hotel and that their operator gets backed up occasionally. Not sometimes to get overwhelmed with calls. Again, this is the first time that I've ever heard of anything like this in Las Vegas.

When we left our room Saturday afternoon we kept the light on for room cleaning. When we came back and 1130 at night the room was untouched and no one ever showed up. We showered and used our previous dirty towels. Again we called downstairs, and were placed on hold for a long time after discussing the issue.   We gave up and went to sleep. In the middle of the night sometime around 12:45 we had a manager knock on the door and wake us up. We devised her that we were sleeping and are not in a position to discuss the room in the middle of the night.

Next morning we based our concerns with the front manager who was extremely cold and did not seem to be accommodating. They immediately offered to waive minimum some costs, however, this was not about the money. Instead of addressing the problem, she advised me to contact Expedia and  deal with them directly. Again, I have yet to deal with the such hotel that cannot accept responsibility and admit they're wrong.

I asked for another manager, who came on board and did absolutely nothing different than the previous manager other than offer us credit for A night. We never asked for anything in return we just wanted somebody to knowledge the problem. I was advised that I shouldn't be telling her how to do her  job. Those were the manager's exact words.

Anyways, my wife and I gave up will just suck it up and MoveOn.  I do however would like to bring up Sam's name in the Front desk. He was the most accommodating individual who listen to us and attempted to address the  problem. I can tell you that, this kid can run a major 5 star hotel. He's the only individual I'll remember from the stay of this hotel. So if you do want to take a chance and come to this hotel make sure you ask for Sam.

I have stayed at many hotels on the strip being a local. I am pleased to say the Vdara moved to the top of the list. I used MyVEGAS Slot points for a suite and I'm glad I did. Now I know to use my points here more.

The front desk was quick and pleasant like it should be. Sometimes front desks hold you up. The concierge was the highlight. They got us patio dining at a restaurant I've been trying to go to for a while. That made this staycation more perfect.

The room was gorgeous with a fantastic 31st floor view of the strip. The room was the perfect size for two people and a suite. If you are visiting or local and looking to get away please look here first I promise you will enjoy it. I'm also pretty sure there is no casino in this hotel so it's more quiet and more of a real hotel stay if you don't want to gamble like myself.

We stayed for two nights here for the first time during our most recent trip to Las Vegas. Here is a list of things I liked and disliked.

Pros:
The kitchenette is nice. I don't eat that much and I usually have leftovers (a lot of leftovers) eating out at restaurants. I stored my leftovers in the fridge and was able to eat the leftovers the next day instead of wasting so much food like usual. Housekeeping will bring up any utensils, pots, plates, dish soap & sponge if you call them. I liked the deep bathtub. The bed was comfortable. Housekeeping also brought up slippers and gowns when we called for them.
The one-touch shade and curtain control was nice. 
Complimentary valet parking, could be a good thing, (except if you needed something from your car, you had to have a valet get the car for you and then take it back to park it. A bit inconvenient).
Non-smoking, non-gambling hotel so it was relatively quieter and less crowded, which I think would be ideal for families with children or if you are like me and like to get away from the casino-scene for parts of your day. 
We had a daybed at the pool, which was pretty nice. The service, although slow, was friendly. The food and drinks that we ordered from the pool cafe were delicious.
The little market\/cafe on the first floor served some yummy breakfast options as well as single-items like yogurts, etc. Which I liked. 
Vdara is just a short walk to either Aria and Bellagio which was perfect distance away from the casino-scene but yet close enough to not feel so disconnected from all the action. 

Cons:
We found a lollipop on the floor next to the couch when we first checked in, which just shows that the room was not thoroughly cleaned.  Also the Kleenex box was stuffed on top with what looked like a used, wadded ball of Kleenex with glittery blue eyeshadow on it. Gross. 
When we checked in, the in-room safe was locked - probably the last person checking out left it locked. I don't know if this is housekeeping's responsibility but someone should have checked them and made sure the safe is left unlocked for the next person to use. We had to call security and security had to come in and unlock it, asked to see IDs like we were criminals trying to steal something in the safe that wasn't there.
The toilet in the bathroom does not have a separate door. It wasn't a biggie but if someone's in the bathroom taking a long bath (me), your partner or friend sharing the room with you can't go potty for a while. Also no TV in the bathroom (am I too spoiled?)
The valet showed some attitude when my husband needed to get something out of the car for me at nighttime. Sorry, but if you don't want to get my car out at 11pm at night, don't offer 24 hour complimentary valet service. And this was with good tipping too. Also they drive the sh** out of your car. If you don't want them to abuse your car, don't valet. Our car also smelled like smoke when we got it back at the end of our trip.

Overall, I don't know if we will choose to stay at Vdara again for any special reason but maybe if we wanted to stay in more we may, since the kitchenette is a nice option. And because we had a nice time at the pool. Pretty good in terms of amenities but there definitely some things here and there that weren't all that great.

Rather disappointed with my latest stay. Booked a one bedroom penthouse suite and contacted the hotel to make arrangements for a corner room. I was told it would be noted. 

Now, I understand sometimes these requests cannot be accommodated. But when I was asked, I was told "no" flat-out by the front desk.

Fine. Get up to the room and much to my surprise the windows are covered in a thick layer of something on the outside, making the view (of the freeway) blurry. I couldn't believe it. I called downstairs and was told it was water and would dry up. It did not.

Tried to turn on the TV in the bathroom, but of course, it didn't work.

I won't bad mouth the property because many people have obviously enjoyed their stays here (including myself earlier this year), but for the amount of money I paid for the room and what I received was, to me, nothing short of a ripoff. 

You can't please everyone, and Vdara certainly didn't please or impress me. For that, I won't return.

I always stay at the Vdara when I'm in Vegas since my family has a room here. I love how the lobby always smells so good and how friendly the valet and front desk workers are. The studio I'm always at is always clean and housekeeping is great whenever I need extra items, even cookware! 

I guess the only problem I encountered was that housekeeping once complained about how much towels we asked for. My son loves bubble-baths and he made a huge mess one time so we had to use all the towels to clean up the mess he made. I guess they didn't really think about the fact that I was just trying to help.

I had a great stay here at Vdara. Being sensitive to second hand smoke, this is a great alternative to those that aren't into drinking, gambling, smoking and causing havoc in the town of Las Vegas.

The crowd here were mainly families, and 30+ people. Very few 20 year olds. 

The staffers here were really friendly and welcoming. Room service got me extra towels and eating utensils I needed in a very timely fashion. 

The fitness room, is a bit small, but it gets the job done. It was pretty much packed when I went. (Thursday 9AM). Towels and water were readily available.

The pool was nice and relaxing. I didn't actually go swimming, but I had the chance to sunbathe for about an hour or so.. enjoying a sweet Strawberry Margarita while the suns rays tanned my pale yellow skin haha. Definitely enjoyed this pool more then the bouncing pools at MGM, where kids are shirtless with beers in their hands and hootin and hollerin. 

The bed and pillows felt like home. I stayed at Aria that had a cooler setup with the electronics and whatnot, but the bedding is better here at Vdara. The pillows had the perfect plush to it , and the blankets had the perfect weight on me. 

24 hour complimentary valet service was a bit annoying at first thought, since I had to tip each time I dropped\/picked up a car, but it wasn't a big deal as I originally thought, and the valet guys were all nice, and hustled their behinds pretty quickly to get us our vehicle in a timely fashion. Appreciate that guys!!

Wow, writing this review I can't see anything horribly wrong with Vdara at all. I will not be staying at any other hotel in Vegas. This is the one hotel that screams out ALICE! :)

I stayed at Vdara for the first time and although I was iffy with the negative comments on Yelp, my stay at Vdara was pleasant. I would totally stay here again if I have too! But I probably won't because I'd rather stay at a gambling casino (personal preference).

The rooms are way nice, comfy and cute! The view is spectacular, large TV, cute little dining area and the bathroom is very roomy. The rooms are all very modern. Oh and they have a kitchen too! But it's not stocked which sucked. Ordered room service and the food was good. Ordered hot wings, french onion soup and chicken ceasar salad...YUMMM!

From Vdara, it's not a far walk to Aria or Bellagio if you want to gamble or walk the strip. This hotel is nice and the staff was friendly. The blinds and key cards all worked just fine when I was there!

Oh and for everyone complaining about parking...it's valet! They park your car for you! DUH!

Seriously Yelp, this as good as it gets!

Amazing property, smoke free, lightly perfumed, and no casino. The staff is easily the friendliest! No it's not necessarily the party hotel for people in my age range, but it's definitely relaxing and a nice relief.  Easy walk to Aria (2 minutes) and Bellagio (5 minutes to main part). 

Check-in was a breeze and they offer mobile check in through a link in your email the day of arrival. Stayed in mid-March and arrived around 10pm, a couple people waiting but nothing too serious. There is a 300$ incidental placed on your card but it falls off so long as you don't do anything heinous to the room. 

The suite gorgeous, even the standard suite. Two televisions, large soaking tub, tempered glass bathroom doors, all felt modern and beautiful. The only thing I did not like about the bathroom is that there is no water closet. Rather, the toilet is hidden by a small wall but somewhat visible. If you're sharing the room with a group, there's no way you can all get ready if someone needs to use the restroom.  In a hotel like this a water closet is a must!


The facilities: spa, gym, pool, all had great service. The pool was a bit crowded with people but there were plenty of towels and shaded seats that weren't cabanas. Cabanas can be rented for 125~150$ and up. One had a small semi-infinity pool which was nice. Poolside food is decently priced but it's Vegas so no complaints about the $$$. Didn't get to the hotel bar\/lounge but the small plates sounded pretty good. The gym was small with weights going up to 50lbs, a few machines (treadmill, elliptical) and cold towels to cool off after a workout (big relief!). There's also water to drink up before and after a workout. Pretty nice!

Housekeeping was AMAZING, anytime we needed something, we got it in a good amount of time. All were friendly, kind, and efficient. Room service is expensive but generous with the portions, the pizza was hot, kids grilled cheese and fries  were filling, and the chicken tenders had a nice flavor. Order off the kids menu! The portions are pretty big. 

No casino but Bellagio is a short, semi covered walk over. Go to the Venetian for blackjack though , better odds ;)

Would return!

Making your way to the Vdara is similar to an LAX nightmare, due to its curving driveways which veer off in any which direction either to the strip, Vdara, or Aria.

Once you find your way through the maze, however, you instantly feel like you're flashy money as you pull up to the valet.  No sir, no self-parking in this ritzy joint.  As you enter the lobby, you begin to question if you're really in Las Vegas.  The stillness in the air, and the light piano in the background say, "no," but yet the array of alcoholic drinks in everyone's hand tells you otherwise.

I suppose it was a slow weekend during our stay, so we were kindly upgraded to a one-bedroom suite.  And -sweet- it was.  The decor was classy and modern: dark wood, marble kitchen counter tops, dual- sinks, large lounge-worthy bathtub, high-end appliances including a washer and dryer, single-cup coffee maker, electronic shades, and plasma screen tv's in the bedroom and living room.

My favorite things:

- Aveda bath products! 
- Filtered water from the refrigerator
- Washer and dryer (just because)
- Great quality dishware
- VERY comfortable bed

Things that were just okay:

- No typrical Vegas action (I'd be nice if there was an indoor bridge to the shopping center at Aria, but you have to undergo a short walk outside.)
- The closest nightclub is Haze at the Aria.  A total stinker.  That is all.

The mediocre things are really minor... considering that throughout the whole weekend and upon my return home I kept proclaiming that Vdara has spoiled me rotten.  I don't see myself willing to downgrade anytime soon.  It's too amazing.  Sorry Signature, but you've just been served.

Best hotel I have ever stay! we only spent one night there, and we really had a great time. Everything in this hotel was prefect. There was no casinos so no one smoking inside the build, that really made it a better place than other hotels here. Our room was at 49th floor, it have a great view to the lake, that was amazing.

Room was prefect, great indoor decor, 3 TVs, 2 big ones in bedroom\/living room, the other smaller one was in the bathroom. Bed was good and comfortable, there was a nice tub in the bathroom, I love that tub, time run faster when I was in that tub.

Check in\/out was easy and fast, valet parking is free. Wifi is super.

Only thing bothered me a little was hard to find a exit to street, good thing is tons of taxis out there.

I will go back.
This is the new hip version of Circus Circus......way took my kids. If you don't mind kids jumping on hip leather couches in the lobby, you will like it. I prefer THEHotel

A stunningly beautiful hotel! I love Vegas, but don't love the cigarette smoke. The Vdara helps with that because it doesn't have a casino in the lobby and it is smoke free. Oh, what an amazing concept! Not only were the rooms fresh and new, but it was close to the center of the strip and next to some beautiful hotels as well. Our party got an inexpensive rate, it has a really good cafe restaurant in the lobby, a relaxing pool, and generous concierge staff. Stay here!

No casino! Interesting!

Vdara pool was closed which was super inconvenient!

Starbucks downstairs in lobby was very busy!

Rooms were nice with pull out sofa beds! Rooms have small kitchenette with a sink! Views in the suites were amazing! There's a stove and microwave in the suites but no pots and pans! Very confusing! What's the point of the stove?!

Valet parking costs $13 what the heck?!?

we just recently stayed. Part of the appeal was there was no casino in this hotel so no haze of smoke to walk in while staying there. I would give 3.5 stars, it was going to be 4 however I now realized they never gave us our $75 food\/beverage credit. Never mentioned it at check in and didn't remember till we got home. 
Our toilet was running all night, I reported it in the morning and they sent someone to fix it in 10-15 min. As for cleaning, they could pay more attention to detail. There was dust on the night stands and other furniture in the room. Also, when we opened the blinds there was weird spatter of some sort on the wall. I was disappointed when I called the spa on the last day. They said they closed at 8, I called about 5:45\/6pm to get pricing and see if they could get me in on short notice. After she went over pricing I said I wanted to see if I could get in now she said their last appointment is at 6, so no they could not. I think that the hours of appointments should be clear and posted. If you close at 8, I would think you have plenty of time to see at 6 and still get out of there in time. Especially when there service I was asking about was only 25 minutes (foot and leg massage). Overall the experience was good, but don't rely on the staff to "remind" you of credits included in your vacation package.

The hotel smelled nice (this was VERY important to us as non-smokers). The hotel staff was great (a guy named Justin checked us in and was awesome). Housekeeping was incredible and the food we ordered via room service was superb.

My only complaint is minor: almost all of the light switches were in the kitchenette... even the ones for the lamps in the bedroom. It was weird.

How do I go about not even giving star? First time here and already the worst experience I checked in today and here for 2 nights. We checked in came to the room and everything was fine, we went out to enjoy our weekend to come back to the room only to find the most disgusting thing EVER! In the corner of our bed there was a huge blood stain which is totally disgusting and unsanitary.  How do you go about sleeping on a bed like this? I go downstairs to check in for them to change my sheets really what else does this place have? How do you lay down in a bed like this. I rather sleep on the streets where at least if there was blood it would have been taking care of not like this nasty as@ room. I will never stay here again and keep in mind if you do make sure you inspect the room and make sure there is nothing there because if there is all they will do is switch it out like that's supposed to make sure you sleep good at night. This really sucks if anything, how do I go about getting a refund or leaving this horrible place?

My friend got this hotel from priceline for $150 I believe a night.  We paid for an upgrade to a junior suite for about $50 a night.  

The good: 
The hotel itself is nice, laid back and not the hustle and bustle of the lobby of other hotels - primary reason being there is no casino.  Its really a mix of people who stay at this hotel from what I saw.  Connected to the Bellagio which is nice and a 2 minute walk to the Aria. The pool is actually decent!  The day before we did Ditch Fridays at the MGM so the Vdara pool was a nice change of pace.  Low key, decent amount of people, and was able to locate 3 lounge chairs easily.  Tons of sun in the pool area.  The room was nice, new and clean.  We had a kitchen, washer\/dryer, 2 bathrooms.


The Bad:
 Service and room - we had to call housekeeping and the front desk 5 times in our 2 night stay.  We lit the button for a room changeover, which was never done so we had to call down for more towels.  The AC in our front room wasnt working so we had to call for that.  We asked for 3 bowls and cups and instead we got 3 bowls and 3 plates.  When we tried to use the dryer, it didnt work.

Not a bad place to stay for the price but some hiccups along the way.  I'd probably stay here again if I was going with a gf.

Second time I stay here. The hotel is very modern looking, the rooms are a bit small for the price but Its Vegas you don't spend too much time in the room either way. Both times I've stayed in a Corner suite which has a kitchen and a large fridge. Housekeeping is friendly and don't hesitate in giving you extra towels. The hotel is walking distance from a lot of things and you can even catch the Aria shuttle to take you further down the strip.  I would continue to stay at the Vdara from the two times I've been there.

This is a very luxurious, modern hotel. I absolutely had a great time here. When I checked in, the person helping me was very helpful and friendly. She gave me a complimentary upgrade to the executive corner suite. When we got to the suite, we couldn't believe how amazing it looked! It was very clean and the hotel doesn't smell like cigarettes. It's a nonsmoking hotel so the air was very fresh in there. The kitchen had a huge refrigerator and there was plenty of cabinet space around the room. The bedroom was very spacious and the bathroom was gorgeous! We had a view of the Bellagio fountain from the bathroom! 
If you want to go to the Bellagio, Aria, Monte Carlo, or New York, they are pretty much all connected. There's a tram that goes from the Bellagio to Monte Carlo. From there, you can walk across the street to New York if you want. Vdara is very centralized on the strip. It may not have a casino or many restaurants, but you can easily get to the other mlife resorts. Definitely recommend if you want a nice place to stay and don't mind going to neighboring hotels.

Check in was pretty bad.  We paid $30 for guaranteed early check in.  We arrived and were given a room, went upstairs and realized that there was no showerhead, just a hole in the wall where it should be.  We called down and they said that someone would be up shortly to fix it.  We said that they could come in without us here and walked over to the strip for lunch.  Just as we got our food, we got one phone call saying that we had to come back to change rooms.  I hung up and not 20 seconds later, another phone call saying that facilities could not get into our room, we needed to get out so that they could fix it.  Ok, we gobbled down our food and walked back.  Went upstairs to get our stuff, room key doesn't work anymore.  Downstairs to get get temporary key.  Back to room to get stuff.  Kind of a hassle.  Surprised that we weren't offered a credit for early check in fee, spa passes, room upgrade or anything.  Other than that, it was a nice room and the fountain views were amazing.  It is a bit of a walk to strip.  It is also a bit quiet without a casino or much dining, which might be what you are looking for.  Pool is small, but met our needs.  I would probably give it 3.5 stars if that was an option.

First experience yet will be my last stay. The hotel mistakenly didn't document our damage deposit. This was obtained at the check in of our stay and when it was time to check out- they stated it was never received. While checking in we were informed that this was a mandatory deposit that would need to be paid upfront in order to keep our reservation- as most hotels do. It's very unclear to me how guest services would stand by their documentation that this wasn't paid if it was "mandatory". This was a $500 loss since we had booked 2 suites. Clearly a daily audit isn't done otherwise a $500 boost in daily revenue would have been noticed. This was paid in cash and a receipt was given however maid services threw our receipt away our first nights stay.  Guest services refused to contact the staff from our check in and we had a flight to catch which resulted in a significant loss- we visit Vegas often and although the Vdara was a beautiful and very well kept hotel- that all means nothing when it comes with horrible guest services.

Great view of the Bellagio's water show from our corner suite. The bathroom was the best part. You can spend the better part of the day soaking in the tub, taking in the views, then getting ready to enjoy the evening. There are no casinos or celebrity restaurants in this hotel, but that's okay, there are plenty of options at the adjacent properties, Crystals and Aria. Beware, if you're driving, Aria is also where self-park is located, so unless you want to haul your luggage across Walkways, trams, and multiple escalators and back, use valet.

This is a really nice hotel...you won't have to figure out if it has that personality that will fit yours like many in Vegas...nice and very reasonable if you can hook up with one of their internet specials...great for romantic adults and great for families as well....a can't miss...

Oooohhh..this is a tough one to review! 3.5 stars?? Round up to 4 in some aspects and round down to 3 in others! Here goes...

Location - If you're looking for a non-smoking, nongaming hotel, Vdara is a very good choice. The location is GREAT. In City Center, near Aria, Cosmopolitan, and the Mandarin. This is where the action of Las Vegas seems to currently be. A short walk (outdoors) to the Aria next door and an indoor (air-conditioned) walk to Bellagio.

Parking - Valet only. Excellent service. Quick and courteous.

Lobby - Wonderful scent upon entering. Not very busy and the process was efficient (less than 5 minute wait in line). Security at the elevator entrances and the nicest lady - HI DOLORES! who greeted my daughter each and every morning with a warm wonderful smile and always chatted us up.

Cafe - Convenient but expensive. What do you expect?

Room - We had a City Corner Suite. Yes..the controls were super cool (open, close for shades and black out shades). Comfy king mattress but horribly uncomfortable, lumpy and flimsy sofabed. Stacked washer\/dryer (so nice to go home with luggage full of clean clothes)!

The kitchen was equipped with a dishwasher, stove, microwave and full refrigerator\/freezer BUT no utensils, pans, towels, detergent, etc. Yes, you may request some items (no additional fee) but it was a hassle. IMO, this is where MGM Signature shines above Vdara. Signature suites are complimented with all the kitchen amenities (pots, pans, dishsoap, plates, utensils). 

The restroom could use some improvement. The toilet doesn't have a door so if someone's doing their business, one wouldn't feel comfortable or be able to use the sink or bathtub at the same time. There weren't enough hooks or shelves for towels.

Pool - Small but it fit the bill. I also liked that it wasn't highly chlorinated. We didn't smell like we had soaked in chemicals, and our eyes didn't burn. The wind is NO joke. I read about it from other reviewers. So true...Vdara pool was absolutely built incorrectly. It's as if it sits in a wind tunnel. 

Also, drink\/food service seemed to be nonexistent. We went to the pool every day for 4 days and I only saw an attendant once.

Non-gaming, smoke free, modern hotel\/spa that is literally a breath of fresh air. You just can't beat the location! Being close to Planet, Paris, MGM while INSIDE the City Center is fab! I like to walk, so that part might not be ideal for everyone. You'll need a person with a good sense of direction to navigate through CC. I think this place is ideal for a short getaway (spa day!) or for families who don't want to deal with the hustle and bustle of the casino.
The hotel ran out of the specific room I booked so we were upgraded to a corner suite. Nice! Panoramic views and sleek amenities made me feel at home.

Very chic hotel. Love it!  It's pricey but it's worth it, even if for one time.  We fit a group of 6 in here..a couple in the bed, one couple on the floor and then another on the pull out sofa bed.  Plus, there's a kitchen area, so you can def mix your drinks and just party it up in your room before heading out.

I love this hotel. I have stayed at Treasure Island and MGM Signature Suites before, and Vdara is my favorite hotel. When I came here, I stayed with my husband and another couple. We are all in our mid and late 20s, and still like to party! LOL.  We stayed in the "Vdara suite" room. If you would like to see a tour of the room, click on the link below which is a video that I made when I stayed there. 

https:\/\/www.youtube.com\/watch?v=6Tx_hrc5vP4&feature=plcp 

I've listed my pros and cons below. 

Pros:
- No smoking hotel! The hotel has it's own unique smell, which is so nice to come back to after walking around the casinos and clubs
- The hotel has a relaxing atmosphere to it. You get the best of both worlds of Vegas, the wild and relaxing side of Vegas
- Relaxing atmosphere at the pool (It's not a wild pool party) 
- Connected to Belagio 
- Very, very close to Aria and Cosmopolitan (If you are a girl who likes to walk in 5 in or higher heels, you can easily walk to Haze nightclub at Aria without having to take sandals with you!!!!!) 
- The rooms are modern and beautiful 
- Room service was excellent 
- When we first checked in, the receptionist gave us the choice of the 2 different layouts that they had available for the "Vdara suite" room. 
- One more thing.... we always had the music on loud and never got a complaint from any neighbors. =D The walls were either super thick or we had no neighbors. LOL

Cons:
- After room service came to clean our room, they took our dirty glasses and didn't replace them. They did, however, bring us more glasses in a timely fashion after we called the front desk. 
- The Vdara pool area is extremely hot. I was down there for 45 mins and felt like a lost 5 pounds with all the sweat my body released. LOL. ... and I was under an umbrella.
- Check in was a hassle. We tried to do early check in, but they didn't have any rooms available. (The hotel was pretty packed for being a Tuesday!) We didn't get to check in until 3pm, which was their actual check in time! But I would have still liked to have had the opportunity to check in earlier. 

Overall, I would highly recommend anyone to stay here, no matter if you are old or young.

I got a deal for $85 a night here! Super stoked! Walk in and was in awe! Such a nice hotel! Favorite part... no smoking thank Jesus! Get into the room and OMG it's beautiful!! Nicest hotel I've stayed at! Great stay, nice room great customer service... until I check out! I ordered room service that never came! Checked my receipt and I was charged for the room service that never came! Lady at the front desk checked the notes and issued me a refund as no notes were noted about us "not answering room service" great! Got my refund the next day... today makes 5 days since I've checked out. I check my bank statement and they charged me TODAY for the room service!! Pissed me off! Now I have to wait again for my refund! After losing in Vegas, every dollar counts! Went to buy my kids food and my card was declined! Because I have a vdara hold on it! Be careful of the charges here! I won't return here because of this issue! Super nice hotel and with the resort fee you get two free water bottles a day. The bathroom is omg amazing!  Tub and shower! Mini burners in the room for cooking the hotel provides utensils, and pots.

I have one word to describe this place: desperate. Desperate to part you from every single dollar you walk in with. We all know that Vegas in general has moved toward the "nickel and diming" model, but it's really in your face at Vdara. The rates here are not cheap, but we stayed here, like many, because we have children and it's easier with the kitchenette.
