Overall OK but quite gimmicky!
The WiFi is very slow and unreliable - this is a problem for this type of hotel.

1st time staying here and I absolutely loved it!!!!! It is pretty pricey but hey, u pay for what u will get. It was totally worth it! Our room was amazing! And the Bar Lounge downstairs was cool too. I really liked the calm outdoor setting. Definitely won't be my last time at the Vdara. Also on our stay we walked over to the aria buffet and it was phenomenal!!!!!! This hotel isn't on the strip exactly but it's right behind the Bellagio and u just have to walk through the Bellagio to get to the strip.

I stayed at the penthouse on my visit to Vegas and oh boy it was nice. It was 2 stories, 2 rooms and 3 bathrooms. The view was awesome from our room. Kitchen was clean with a washer\/dryer machine for laundry, refrigerator\/freezer, microwave, silverware and a full dining table. 3 big flat screen TVs. I will make sure to come to Vdara every time I visit Vegas now. There is no casino however there is a walkway to the Bellagio and Aria.

What a gorgeous hotel!  Their rooms are pacious, clean, and modern.  We got a room with parital view of Bellagio fountain and amazing view.  The service staffs are polite and friendly.  Only valet parking, no self parking. There is a mandatory $28 resort charge (pool & gym). You won't smell like cigarettes on your clothes and hair because there is no casino inside this hotel.  No cigarette smokes to bother your eyes, nose, skin. I would definitely come back.

The hotel is beautiful. The suites are very modern, functional and comfortable. The staff has for the most has been helpful, the woman at the front desk named Jessie especially. I am definitely considering staying here in the future.

This place was amazing, my friend and I stayed here for a night on a road trip. We had an amazing room and the cost was way lower than what it would be almost anywhere else. You could say we had a bit of a rough morning but the staff were super helpful (I'm sure they see it every day). The place is clean, the view is great and I can't talk enough about the bathroom. I would for sure stay there again.

Had an amazing weekend at Vdara thanks to the friendly staff--namely front desk Erin Serrano! The room was well kept, the views were spectacular and the company was so much fun. Location on the strip is perfect, so close to everything! They ALLOW DOGS in the "V-dog" rooms, amazing because I love when my puppy tags along. There's a dog run just behind valet. Speaking of valet, it's required here, so keep tip cash handy. I highly recommended Vdara!!!!

Totally dissapointed. The front desk service was horrible and they would not help me with a credit that they said I had. The room was much smaller than described online. Also, the pool area is tinny. They have no coffee machines inside the rooms, so you're forced to pay $5 for a coffee downstairs. Also, there are no pedestrian walkways, you have to take the tram to Crystals next door and then you have to walk another 20 minutes to get to Las Vegas Blvd.

My husband and I stayed at the Vdara just this past week. This was our first trip to Vegas and the Vdara did not disappoint.  I loved that the room were condo style. There was more than enough room for my us to be able to hang out together or have some space if we needed it. 

Being from Chicago where smoking is ban everywhere, vegas casinos were a bit overwhelming with the smoking. I was very appreciative of staying in a hotel where there was no smoking. It was also nice not to have a casino in the hotel. It made it simple to navigate around the hotel and not get lost which I found happening to us in some of the other hotels. 

Room service was delightful. We ordered breakfast our first morning there, it was delicious and quick to our surprise. The gentleman that set our table actually made my husband's breakfast burrito in front of him. 

Overall, all the staff we met was professional, sweet, and genuinely wanted to make sure they did whatever was needed to make our stay wonderful. We would absolutely stay here again next time we head out to vegas.

I normally stay at the Venetian but my family & I stayed at Vdara for Halloween weekend & I never want to stay anywhere else in Vegas.  For a family this is great, all of the rooms are suites so you have a kitchen area, living room and bedroom.  We had the cheapest suite and that still had mini fridge that helped us w\/groceries over the weekend.

It's a nonsmoking hotel & there's no casino so if you're going to be busy doing other things while in Vegas, stay here!  You're just walking distance from the Aria, Cosmo and the Bellagio but if you want to get across the street, where there's a ton of things to do, you'll need to walk a ways to a crosswalk.

Most complaints are pretty true, parking and the check-in\/check-out.  Parking is valet only at Vdara so you may have to wait a bit during peak hours but the parking is free, you'll just need to tip the valet.  We were lucky that the check-in didn't take too long but since we had two rooms, I was only able to check-out of one of our rooms directly from our room's TV.  

Not sure if this is a regular thing but when we were checking-out, there was a woman standing there that would take our info, our room # and took my email address so that they guestfolio could be mailed to me.  If there seems to be an employee hovering around the check-out line see if that's what they're doing so you can get out quicker!

Best hotel I have stayed at in Las Vegas. Corner sweet. Panoramic views. Huge beautiful kitchen. Great for group trips. Nothing bad about Dara. Best best hotel rooms ever. Located a step away from the strip .

Loved this spa like hotel! There isn't a casino inside but it also doesn't have that smoke smell like the ones that do. Beautiful room and when we got there we were checking in 3 hours earlier than check in but they were able to give us a room that was available without charging us! Which we didn't ask or expect but it was really nice, and it felt better to leave our bags in our room rather than upfront. Its not far from Aria which does have a casino and the not far from the Bellagio.

Stayed at the the VDara studio suite room 24040 first week in September 2016. I contact the VDara management upon checking out of the room because my wife was severely attacked by bed bugs. We are frequent Las Vegas visitors at resorts that include Wynn\/ Encore, Mandalay Bay\/ Delano, etc. This was our first time at VDara and we were initially impressed with the quietness, location and esthetics. Little did we know they were invested with bed bugs that it would leave welts on my wife's legs. Management has yet to respond to my calls, emails and survey.  If you are reading this review and you are in 24040, look at your legs they are probably chewed up by bed bugs.

Okay. You don't feel like you are in Vegas. It's conviently connected to the Bellagio. Loved the kitchenette. NOT PLEASED with housekeeping leaving my room A JAR when they were done cleaning. NOT PLEASED with hotel manager who did absolutly NOTHING when I reported this.  

Um yeah. It was my 7th visit to Vegas this year. And I'll NEVER stay at Vdara again. 

Thanks, but no thanks.

Best Hotel in Vegas!

First off I'm not a gambler and not a fan of breathing smoky air, with that being said Vdara already had an edge in my book.

The location is great. It connects to the Bellagio and is right next to the cosmopolitan.  
The rooms are amazing. We had a corner suite on the 40th floor and wow, what a view!! We brought food and drinks since there is a full size fridge and cook top(that helped save $$ on food costs)

Service was amazing from the front desk, bell service, and anything we needed they answered promptly.
The workout facility was adequate but not as impressive as some other hotels, but we still had a good workout.
The pool was relaxing. They played good music and there is lots of shade if you want to take a break from the sun.  It's not a party pool or lush gardens but it worked.  

I have stayed at over 10 different hotels on the strip.... This is my favorite. 
Each hotel has a different charm but it nice to be able to get away from the craziness and go right back to it when you want it.

Gorgeous, non smoking, modern, clean and inviting. In a sea of bad taste, this place is designer neat
, spacious and lovely. Fab location and amenities.

Enjoyed my stay here. Stayed in an Executive Corner Suite for my birthday weekend and every staff member treated us like well executives. The hotel is very nice, clean and elegant. Room is very big. Compliment valet. Great, relaxing pool area. Easy access to the strip via Aria or The Cosmopolitan. The hotel provides guests everything from slippers and bathrobes to toothpaste, plates, cups and even laundry detergent. Will stay here again. Great job guys!

This is a very nice hotel. There is no casino at this hotel, so it is a drawback. If you want to gamble, you either have to walk to the Aria or the Cosmopolitan. Besides that, the hotel was very clean, service was good and the atmosphere was good too. Stayed here for my bacholars party. The room had a very nice decor to it. It was modern and had upscale amenities. Would stay here again if ever in Vegas. Parking is valet and if you want to park your own car, you can park it at the Cosmopolitan parking structure.

So, Vdara will be the third hotel on the strip that I have stayed at (other 2 were Monte Carlo and Aria). And I have to say, for the price, it is definitely up there. We booked a corner suite (for 6 girls total) and it had plenty of room. I ended up tipping more than usual for most of the employees I had encountered here. 

Biggest gripe though would be access to Vdara to and from the strip. It's a little further back, just like the Aria. However, there is the Tram (have to walk through the Bellagio) and to just walk through the Aria. The place also only has one place to eat (a market place) in the actual hotel and no casino. Also, if sharing a room with people you hardly know, you will get to know them quickly. There is no door enclosing the toilet and it's next to the glass shower. There are doors to the actual bathroom, but when sharing with 6 girls, privacy wasn't an option.

I did book through a timeshare company, but monitored sales and deals for a couple of months before we went, it still had the best deal for the size and price. I will definitely consider staying here again, but for some reason, Aria still holds near and dear to my heart, even though it is more expensive. 

I really considered 5 stars, especially with the level or service received and the Pool Cabana was a sweet deal with private pools for a section of 3-4 cabanas. (See review under Vdara Pool & Lounge) However, the inaccessibility to the strip, food and gambling makes it difficult for me to give 5 stars!

Vdara is now my favorite hotel.


[How is it different]
-No self parking- only valet (which wasn't that much at all)
-Non-smoking and no casino inside. That's a good thing!
-There are a few options in the lobby such as a fancy market cafe, starbucks, something else I think, and a good size bar.

[Rooms\/style]
-We had a corner suite with 1 king size bed and 1 bathroom. For 5 guys, that was plenty.
-Living room had a couch with a pull out bed (Springs hurt)
-Carpet was just as nice so perfect for my inner Asian. I used a sleeping bag over the couch cushions. Legit!
-Restroom was extremely nice: 2 vanity's, 2 sinks, shower\/tub, toilet with no door, and closet for the fancy clothes. Ironing board+iron+hair drying were in there to use.

-Small walkway held small vertical washer and dryer (bring some detergent and bounce if you need it)
-Master bedroom and living room had flat screens
-Kitchen area was legit


Overall: plenty of room, quieter, less smoking, and checking in was extremely easy. Had to call because flight came early to check in earlier and we had no problems. Very accommodating.

Loved it! I've stayed in a few strip hotels, albeit not nice ones--Bally's, Excalibur, etc. Vdara was awesome because its located on the central Strip with easy access to all of the good stuff on the Strip. Even though the hotel itself is not directly on Las Vegas Boulevard, its really easy to get there (a really quick 5-10 minute walk) and there's a tram that goes to\/from Bellagio\/Vdara\/Aria\/Monte Carlo.There's no casino in Vdara, but it is connected to Bellagio and Aria, so you can easily go from your suite to the casino floor in 5 minutes. I was worried it would feel more isolated and less "classic Vegas" not staying at a casino hotel, but it was actually great. It was quieter and I could actually breathe in the lobby (no cigarette smoke). The lobby area had a few restaurants and a Starbucks. The rooms were awesome! I went with my family and we got two rooms--one Deluxe suite (the standard\/basic one) and one Vdara suite (a slight upgrade from the Deluxe suite). Both rooms were clean, spacious, had beautiful Strip views, nice bathrooms, comfortable beds, and little kitchenette areas. Both rooms also have a large pull-out couch, which was nice because Vdara doesn't have any double queen rooms--only single kings. The Vdara suite was bigger and had an extra half bathroom, separated bedroom and living room, the kitchen was larger, and it had a washer\/dryer in the room. Pretty awesome. Everything about the rooms were very modern--even down to the fancy little buttons that you push for housekeeping\/do not disturb\/etc. The minibar prices were kind of steep, but oh well, that's Vegas. We didn't spend too much time in our rooms but we loved them when we did. The pool area was also great. It was pretty busy (we didn't go to the pool until 2pm on a Saturday), so we didn't get a spot on the lounge chairs by the pool deck, but we still found a spot on some comfy couches and chairs near the bar and private cabanas. There was a larger pool and a few smaller hot tubs. Not too many children in the pool either, thank goodness. The prices for drinks at the pool bar were kind of ridiculous ($8 for a beer, $14 for a cocktail) but the pina coladas we ordered were quite tasty. I never made it to the gym and spa, but I also heard they were nice. Next time I go to Vegas, I will definitely be staying at Vdara again!

I love this place!! This is our second night here and I couldn't be more pleased. We got upgraded to my surprise, which is why I would recommend the corner executive suite if you stay here. Comfy bed, separate living room area and the bathroom is gorgeous.

I would have given 5 stars if it wasn't for the employee Kimberly from valet.

I checked out this morning out of Vdara and had a marvelous experience for my first time, for 4 consecutive nights. Everything was great at Valet- the employees Ebony, Nelson, Shane, and Joselyn were very pleasant, helpful, and welcoming, and definitely deserve to be recognized. Overall Valet was wonderful except for one person- KIMBERLY. My boyfriend and I have never been treated or spoken to with so much disrespect, unprofessionalism, and lack of class by her unlike the other valet employees we encountered.
 
First incident occurred today, 2\/16\/17 at 6:45 when I had called to have my car ready. Kimberly picked up, and I informed her I was heading down. She then said condescendingly, verbatim, "So you want your car?". Her response and tone was very inappropriate, as if she was talking down to me. My boyfriend also called to clarify a valet day pass payment; she was just as rude, short, and even stated she had just spoken to me, showing her frustration.
 
Second incident happened once we got down to valet. I spoke to Ebony first (who provides GREAT customer service and has helped my boyfriend and I during our 4 days there). Kimberly then tried to assist her, and once again brought up that she had just spoken to us and was clearly irritated. Her facial expressions and body language made it clear that she did not want to help us and came off VERY SNOOTY.
 
I then told her that the misunderstanding of information was not an issue, that what was the issue was her lack of empathy for us, and that she was rude. As soon as I said this, she immediately got up, did not let me finish speaking, and stood in the back staring where my boyfriend and I could clearly see her gossiping to another valet employee. The smirk on her face as she walked away from us was one of the most unprofessional, inappropriate, rude, and immature things I have ever seen. Ebony and Shane the supervisor were there and witnessed the whole thing.
 
I was very frustrated and angry after this happened, and asked to speak to Shane the supervisor. I explained that Kimberly's behavior was very rude, immature, and unprofessional. He was very pleasant, listened, and was great, however did not provide any explanation or plan as of to why I was treated with such disrespect. Kimberly never apologized for her rude behavior towards me after walking away, which was very frustrating.
 
For my first time at Vdara, I am VERY disappointed with the customer service Kimberly provided me with, as she simply lacks the sophistication and class that Vdara seems to stand for. Her customer service is horrendous and I am shocked she is even allowed to work at this 5 star hotel and gets away with treating customers like ignorant children. I am a clinician in the medical field, and do not even treat my own patients with this much disrespect and rude behavior. As a hotel guest I enjoyed everything else Vdara had to offer, but after experiencing this much disrespect and rudeness from Kimberly, I will probably go to Venetian or Wynn for my next stay where I feel more welcomed and appreciated. We did not pay to stay in a 5 star hotel without its own parking garage to be treated unprofessionally by Kimberly, whose service is comparable to Wal Mart. Her lack of customer service skills shows with how she handled the situation, and how she walked away from my boyfriend and I with a smirk while conversing. No apologies were ever given, which made the situation worse. Kimberly has left a very lasting bad first impression, and my boyfriend and I are simply in shock and livid that we had to be treated this way on our vacation. Perhaps she will raise Vdara's standards on valet customer service to hotel guests, since she represents everything that you SHOULDN'T do. Kimberly is a disgrace to the Vdara hotel, and needs some in depth coaching on social skills and proper customer service etiquette. 

By the way, this is the FIRST complaint I have ever written about anyone and FIRST time I have ever asked for a manager. I am a very patient and understanding person, but I cannot tolerate being treated as an inferior.

Loved this place! Got upgraded as soon as we got there! Then got to extend our stay for the same price we paid the night before but for a penthouse! LOVED that their was no casino! And no smoking was good too! I would deff come back here.

I reserved this hotel for my upcoming 30th birthday after visiting here a couple of years back while working for CADEM (California Democratic Party).  While pulling up to this beautiful building, I was immediately greeted by the valet attendant who kindly ushered a bellhop over to us to get our bags while we checked in.  The front desk clerk was exceptionally pleasant, although I cannot recall her name to mention for the review.  I checked into my corner city suite and proceeded to my room.  Upon walking in it was simply amazing, it looked reminiscent of a nice manhattan apartment.  The dining room and kitchenette, full size fridge, stocked mini fridge.  The bathroom has a nice sized bathtub that has a view of the mountains and of the aria.  It also has a sit down shower.  There is a living room area separate from the bedroom.  The bedroom has a view of the pool as well as the bellagio.  Tried a couple of items off of the room service menu after coming back late night, the hot wings were cooked perfectly and the eggs benedict  were just to die for...or maybe it was the alcohol, who knows.  Overall, my stay here has been superb.  I wish I could give it a 6 star review.

Would prefer Venetian and Wynn over this. It's nice not to have a casino as it is cleaner with no tobacco fumes, but the hotel rooms are showing signs of wear. They didn't choose to invest in furniture that would withstand time and the foot traffic.

If Bunny and I hadn't stayed at Aria prior to our stay at Vdara, my rating would most likely be higher. However because our last visit to Vegas was such a wonderful experience, Vdara paled in comparison to Aria. Don't get me wrong, I still enjoyed our vacation and had a great time, but no matter how much I tried to be positive, there seem to always be something missing.

Being that I'm not a huge gambler, it didn't really matter to me that Vdara didn't have a casino. With so many hotels in the vacinity, we were bound to find one anyway. The upside in not having a casino was that the hotel was smoke free. The lobby was quite small and there was only a cafe, which closed at 10, and a bar. Not having any restaurants wasn't too big of a day either since we could easily find somewhere to eat within the city center. 

It was quite unique Vdara lacked a casino and restuarants, but the thing which bothered  me was there wasn't a gift shop. I know, going to Vegas was not like traveling to a foreign county or somewhere that not many  have been to. However, I like purchasing keychains, postcards and little knick knacks for some close friends. So I had to go to Elements, the gift store at Aria, to see if they sold any of Vdara's items. Unfortunately that was not the case, so I had settled on a few postcards of Cystals, the shopping center in the city center. Not exactly what I was looking for, but close enough.

The amenities were nice. We visited the fitness center and pool once. There were plenty of machines and equipment. Each treadmill and bicycle had a towel and water bottle. There was one main pool, as opposed to having mulitple pools, like at Aria. While sitting by the poolside at Vdara, you could hear the music from Aria's side.

Aside from the lack of restaurants, casino, hip pool area, the most important part of the hotel met our expectations. The rooms were very spacious, nice and clean. There would be buttons to press when we needed housekeeping, which would alert the front desk. One night, we even had a message on our phone from the front desk apologizing for not cleaning our room when in fact it had already been cleaned. If that's not great customer service, than I don't know what is.

Vdara would not be my first choice to stay at. However if there are some good deals again and the opportunity comes up, I wouldn't mind coming back.

Pros: Very centrally located with great rooms. I received a complimentary upgrade when I checked in. The bathroom and linens were phenomenal and there were great views. There is a really easy tram that will take you between the nearby hotels and Crystals mall. Also I like the fact that you can reserve cabanas all day ($200 for 8 ppl). Service staff was very friendly and accommodating. Checkout was simple and easy with one person on their ipad. 

Cons: Beware!... they charge you for everything! I stopped by business services immediately after I checked in to see if a package I had delivered arrived. It had, and I asked them to deliver upstairs to my room because my hands were full with my luggage. To my disbelief they charged me $10 to tote a little small box upstairs! Had I known that, I would have went back to pick it up myself.

Also, the check-in process for the cabanas is really competitive. You must reserve a cabana in advance and you have to arrive between 9-10am to check-in. At 10am they begin to allow you to choose your cabanas based on the order in which you checked-in (hence why you have to arrive between 9-10am)

I would definitely stay there again, but will always ask first if there is an extra fee associated before doing anything.

This just may be my new favorite hotel in Vegas: smoke free, no casino, easy hotel to navigate, great location, all suites, comfortable bed and nicely appointed bathrooms...what's not to love?  I hear the hotel is pet friendly too, so I will definitely bring my furry friend next time and take advantage of that perk.  I love that they are affiliated with Hyatt, so you can get or redeem your Hyatt Gold Passport points for your stay.

I think this is my new hotel of choice in Vegas.

No casino, no smoking

Beautiful, large suites with great views and tons of amenities including full size fridge and washer\/dryer

Relaxing pool scene with good food and drink

Great location between the Aria and Cosmopolitan

Great, responsive service

Cons:

Room layout, while large, is not perfect e.g. no separate bathroom (toilet) area despite a huge bathroom and it overall feels like they could make better use of the space (e.g. desk in living area vs. bedroom, etc.)

Room service menu and other dining options super limited

Gym not awesome compared to the Aria and closes too early

Pool closes too early

But otherwise, a great overall choice to feel like you are on a bit of an oasis while in Vegas!

We have stayed here before a few times but this will likely be our last time due to our interaction with management. 

We arrived quite early on August 6, 2017, but attempted to check in anyway at 10:30am. We were not dismayed or surprised that our room was unavailable. Phil told us that our room would likely be ready by 2pm. At 3pm we had not received a call yet, but since this was normal check in time, we decided to proceed to check in. We spoke with Bri who told us that our room was still not ready, but she told us for the inconvenience that she would provide us with a food and beverage credit and would call hopefully soon with a ready room. 
At 6pm we had still not received a call on the status in our room, so we popped by the front desk. Mariah told us that our room on the 20th floor was ready and gave us keys. We proceeded to our rooms, and as we were on our way up, we received a call from the hotel. We assumed that it was just someone unaware that we had just checked telling us that our room was ready. We got to our room and called for our baggage to be brought up. While we were waiting, I checked my voicemail only to hear someone telling us that our room was ready, but we had been moved to the 21st floor and to come pick up new keys. My wife, in the meantime, noticed that there was hair on the bedding in several spots and noticeably large stains on one pillowcase. She was very upset since we had waited 3 hours after check in to get this room. I told her about the voicemail, and she said we should call the front desk to see where we were actually supposed to be. I called the front desk and was told that we should be in room 21.001, so we went downstairs to get new keys. While we were downstairs, we told Nathan of the annoyance of switching rooms again, and my wife also let him know that room 20.001 was still not clean and had dirty bedding, and it should be taken care of before someone else got that room. Nathan was very apologetic and offered to remove our resort fees. 
We headed up to our new room 21.001. We were in this room about 10 minutes when water started dripping from the ceiling in the bathroom from the room above. This was not entirely the hotel's fault though we were told by maintenance that the loose faucets on the tubs cause them to leak. The maintenance man-he was also very nice-asked if we would like to be moved so we would not have to hear the constant drip of water and have a usable tub. He called the front himself and made the request. We were told to only room available was 20.001; I told them that we had previously been in that room, and it had been dirty. They assured me that it was cleaned. 
Once again we changed rooms only to find that the bedding in 20.001 was still dirty. We called the front desk and asked to speak to a manager. We were transferred to Raj (or Rog), and when I introduced myself and began to explain was was happening, I was rudely cut off and told, "I'm aware of the situation with you." He then proceeded to say he had been there with housekeeping and saw that it was clean. My wife cut in to inform him that the exact same hairs in the same places and stains were on the bed. I told him that he could come up himself and see. He said he was sending the housekeeping manager up and hung up. The housekeeping manager came within 10 minutes, saw what our concern was, and asked if we wanted a new room. We told her that all we wanted was clean sheets. She send in Veronica to change our sheets. Veronica was very friendly. 
In all this ordeal took up 3 hours of our time. We received a room at 6 (3 hours after check in) and did not have a clean room until almost 9pm. This is not the service we expected from this hotel at all. We have previously stayed here a couple times without incident and only positive things to say. However, we would have been satisfied despite this mishap had it not been for the manager's attitude. This is not how we wanted to spend the evening- in fact, we are fortunate that we had made no plans such as dinner reservations or shows this could interfere with, and all we would have liked is for a sincere apology from the manager. When we called about the bedding all the manager needed to say was, "I am so sorry. Let me send someone up to change those sheets now." This is unfortunately not what happened, and his attitude implied that we were looking for something more. We actually never asked for anything except a room and clean sheets. Raj needs a lesson in customer service- maybe he can get that from some of his staff. Our interaction with him has soured us on returning to any MGM Property if this is the type of manager being hired at them. 

On a final note, my wife never did get to use the tub as after running the water for about 5 minutes, she noted the water leaking from the top of the faucet and did not want to flood our bathroom in the same way we had experienced with the room above us previously.

The service: Mediocre. I came early and could not check in for four hours, it took them about an hour and a half to get my luggage up to my room, and I had to call them three times about it. 

On top of this, my friend and I reserved two city corner suites. I got the corner suite, but he did not. INSTEAD, they DOWNGRADED him to a regular room and still ended up charging him the same amount. His room was SIGNIFICANTLY smaller than my room. What kind of hotel does that?

The room: Beautiful. It was huge and completely worth the very reasonable price that I paid for it. There was a small kitchen\/dining area, a full size fridge that they stock with complementary water for you, two huge flat screens, a separate bedroom with the comfiest bed ever, a HUGE bathroom with a very deep tub with bath salts, and a separate shower with an amazing view. Did I mention a washer and dryer that I (unfortunately) did not get a chance to take advantage of.

Note: It takes a while to get a cab because most of them  fill up with passengers at the Aria before driving away past Vdara.
Why would you waste your time with mobile check-in if they are not going to have your room ready anyway? And you wait 30 minutes at the front desk anyway.
New year's eve with the girlfriend. Automatic upgrade to panoramic suite on the 53rd floor. Great view, no casino and no smoking. It's awesome and so beautiful.

If you want to get away from the traditional Las Vegas hotel and casinos, Vdara is the place to go. Clean, quiet, friendly staff, with a Starbucks inside. The room service was great and the setup was perfect. Our room was definitely somewhere we wanted to spend more time in but when we wanted to hit the casino it was a short walk away. The tram was very useful to head to other casinos. Overall great experience.

This is our second time staying here and it was an even better experience!  We took an early flight to Vegas and planned on leaving our bags with the hotel since we could not check-in yet. We were assisted by Marisa who was so kind to give us a room upgrade and told us we could already go to our room. Marisa is so friendly and personable. Come to find out, she has family in Hawaii! We had such a nice conversation with her.

The room was very clean and the view was awesome!  We could see the Bellagio fountains and the mountains. Their parking used to be complimentary if you stayed there, but now it is $18 per day. That is probably the only downfall to our stay there. 

Everyone was super friendly and nice there!

Booked two deluxe suites for veteran's day weekend and when I got there to check-in, they told me that there weren't anymore deluxe or vdara suites available due to a sudden surge of customers arriving for a conference. Bummer! 

But, they asked, if we would like to be upgraded to a two bedroom hospitality suite  instead? Score! Thanks for the excellent service, Vdara! This was definitely a great start to a fantastic weekend :)

This hotel was tremendous! Customer service was exceptional! I booked an executive suite in January for two days for my birthday and I was blown away! The view of the strip was just beautiful! I slept comfortably. The hotel does not have a casino and is quiet at night. It did not bother me one bit because who likes commotion when you are ready to call it a night? and smells of cigarettes? I don't! Oh, and it does not have a restaurant inside which also did not bother me because Aria was just a 3-5 min walk away. The reason why I booked the executive suite instead of the panoramic suite is because it has two restrooms and the panoramic only has one. Still a great view!

Absolutely love my room. The bed is so comfortable... I have gotten the best sleep of my life. The room is big with 2 tv's, a huge window, and the bath tub is to die for. The room beside the bar is amazingly relaxing as well. It's very quiet here. Can't wait to come back.

Limo driver was rude.
Bags were lost for the entire first day
No turndown service as requested
Concierge just left in the middle of my question with no explanation.
No blackout curtains in Vegas.
Pool was tiny
Overall poor experience

The air in the lobby smells like vanilla lavender creamy awesomeness.

Vdara is a non-smoking, non-gambling hotel. Definitely a change of pace for your typical Vegas stay. I kind of liked it.  If you want to gamble, you can just walk across the street to Cosmopolitan. If you want to smoke, you can step outside.

The room has an amazing view and the decor is sleek and sexy. Service is amazing as expected. Overall, I enjoyed my stay. My only complaint is finding this place if you have a rental car can be a pain in the ass. Once you figure it out it is easy enough, I suppose.

When searching for a great resort stay with my family, I'm thinking about my little one; he's almost 18 months old.  Vdara gave me the best option for my family situation.  This resort has no casino, so there's no smoking in the building and also offers a full kitchen along with a washer and dryer.  I enjoyed the contemporary modern look of the hotel.  I also loved the glass windows all through out my room giving me great views of Las Vegas. 

First off, the smell when you walk in is amazing! Very clean and tranquil; they don't call this a resort & spa for nothing!  Check in was a breeze and we checked in early!!  We called in a day before arrival and talked with Nate at the front counter who made some heavy notes for when we arrive.  He was a great help during our stay!

Upon arrival before noon, there was a lady at the front desk who did her best when we asked about our room.  We didn't receive the results that we wanted so we decided to have brunch at Aria.  Upon returning, we came back to the counter and another gentleman was able to check us into a different room on the 41st floor and we were given an upgrade to an Executive suite!  I was extremely thankful because we checked in early with upgrade.

Our room was clean and in the perfect spot; right in the corner of the building.  This Executive suite had windows all through out and reminded me of a Modern City apartment suite.  Everything was looked great!

Later that day we received chocolate covered strawberries as a thank you from the gentleman at the front desk.  Whenever we needed service, they came through as promised.  I was a little disappointed on our last day.  My husband was dealing with an upset stomach and so this delayed our time for leaving.  I immediately requested for a late check out (ahead of time) but what irritates me the most is when house keeping shows up early asking us why are we still in the room?

A 4-star rating for a great stay!  For a 5-star rating, I would recommend better communications with the front desk and housekeeping.  Also upon arrival, we had to call for a crib and for kitchen items.  We requested these items ahead of time and should be documented without having to requested for them again.  Other than that, a very nice and friendly staff; we loved our stay and will recommend to others.

This place is great.  You get an amazing room for super reasonable prices.  Ive stayed here a coupla times and as long as you dont mind a casino not being downstairs you'll be fine.  The Bellagio is about a 10 minute walk from the lobby and Aria is about 7 minutes.  If you're coming to and from the strip it can be a little tiresome, but seriously, it's totally worth it.  

Rooms are pretty damn luxurious.  Ive had the corner executive suite both times ive stayed here and the view was amazing.  Big double sink bathroom with shower and tub, a tv in the living room area and in the separate bedroom.  Bed and pillows are ridiculously comfortable.  The room has a full kitchen!  Not like a little fridge and microwave, a full kitchen with a big ass fridge and stove and sink!  Which was great for leftovers from big ass Vegas meals.  Also great for holding a bunch of booze nahmean!!

Service is super friendly.  When we were there the pool was closed one day because of lightning.  When we checked out we asked if the resort fee could be waived for that day and they were totally cool to do so.  Asked for extra pillows, good to go.  

Seriously, this is one of the better deals in Vegas if you dont mind your hotel not having a casino and walking a bit.  Give it a shot!

Second time staying here and yet again, I am not disappointed. I got here prior to the check-in time and the front desk was able to accommodate me and assign me to an available room on the 36th floor. This time, I had a different view - not the Bellagio fountain like the first time, but instead, the Luxor pyramid, Delano, etc. (which is just as beautiful.)

Of course, I forgot to pack the basic necessities (toothbrush, paste, etc.) but didn't forget to pack that sexy Vegas dress, right? I paged the Front Desk from my room and asked if there was a store nearby that sold toothbrushes, etc. and the lady responded, "We can bring that right up to you, how many do you need? Do you need anything else?". Well, that was easy! Within minutes, a gentlemen rang my doorbell (yes, doorbell) with a tray with toothbrushes and toothpaste. Um, thank you!! It saved me a trip to the store. Extremely convenient and helpful, they are. 

The weather was beautiful and warm this time around so the poolside was taken advantage of. I'm a bit bummed that I didn't get to try out their Spa - but I will definitely next time. I look forward to staying at the Vdara on my next trip to Vegas.

When I go to vegas I always stay at Vdara because it's very clean and non smoking hotel.  But this time (March 2016) their service was horrible!!  Below is the issues I had during my stay:
1. Mattress was very wavy!! So I had to change the room
2. Hot water doesnt come out in the shower.  Water was warm.  Hot water works on sink.
3. Worst housekeeping ever!  They didnt bring my request (shampoo - there was no shampoo when I first checked in) at the first time and it took them forever.

I complained about this issues at front desk and she said service was horrible because it is spring break and they are busy. Does that make any sense??

I'm never going to stay here.

Our experience at Vdara this past May was great! 4.5 star rating!! :) :) 

I would definitely stay here again and have recommended it to a number of friends since. The location of the hotel is so convenient - walking distance to the cosmopolitan and aria, and shuttle to Bellagio, except the price is much less. Definitely a great bang for your buck. I understand it is not a casino hotel, but you are so close to casino hotels, you barely miss it. 

The rooms were phenomenal - especially for a large group like we had. The 2-story penthouse suites is what we really wanted, however they were sold out by the time we made our reservation. We ended up getting the 2-bedroom penthouse hospitality suite. It was so spacious, clean, and with great views of the strip. The kitchen is stocked with waters everyday (which is necessary in the Las Vegas heat and all the alcohol consumption). Our second 2-bedroom suite accidentally got upgraded and when we notified them that that wasn't what we had asked for, they gave it to us complimentary at the price of the original room (yay!). 

Unfortunately, one of our suites didn't get cleaned any of the days we were there, even when we had specifically called. They would show up in the evening, which just was so inconvenient given that we were all in the room trying to get ready for the night. They ended up giving us a $75 credit towards room service or the hotel room cost (I'll take that!). 

We really enjoyed our stay at the Vdara and it was great being able to all stay together in 1-2 suites, which tends to be a major downfall of many Vegas hotels - they don't accommodate for groups and everyone has to get individual rooms. Will definitely be going back to this hotel :)

We were impressed by the service from the moment we checked in, especially Kali.  The concierge was very helpful in arranging all of our different activities, as well as the air race show. The views were incredible, and the location of the hotel is central and has easy access to the Bellagio and Aria.  The room itself was large, the bed was very comfortable.  Our only negative would be that although the weather was beautiful, the pool closed at 5pm, and we would have liked to relax by the pool until a later hour.  Overall, Vdara went a long way towards making our birthday celebration a memorable and special occasion, and we will certainly stay again the next time we visit Vegas.

We had a corner suite, the staff were very friendly and room service was great. If you don't mind taking a taxi everywhere, then this is the place. We went next door to the Cosmopolitan for brunch at Wicked Spoon.

There is no casino in here and its not on the strip, which I liked! 

Also, love the fact that it smells amazing when you walk in. The lotion they provide also has that same smell. I took a few bottles of lotion home. =)

The last time I was in Vegas I stayed at the Vdara and I have to say it's been one of my favorites. It's a smoke free facility and there's no casino, but I don't mind because I don't gamble or smoke. I heard  this hotel was built more so for people doing business which is why it's more clean and sleek than most other hotels in Vegas. I loved the interior of our room and most of all the bathroom. The bathroom is most important to me because lighting for make up is everything :) the only thing is I feel like not a lot of young adults stay here so it felt a bit awkward walking out of the lobby in our club attire, we were literally the only ones both nights...awwwwkward not really. But I would def stay here again

We recently stayed at the Vdara Hotel in Las Vegas.  We chose this hotel because of it's location, lack of a casino, and because it looked beautiful and elegant, which it was.  Atmosphere was friendly and staff seemed dedicated to making our stay a success.  

Now for the downside...unfortunately I left an expensive swimsuit behind upon leaving.  Hung it in the closet in the bathroom to dry.  Called the hotel to report this and had a tough time getting to Lost and Found.  FInally on the 3rd try got an employee who stated he'd check and call me back.  Never did.  Then I emailed guest relations and didn't receive a response for almost 24 hrs.  Very difficult to make contact with anyone to help you with a lost item i.  I was told that my swimsuit could not be located.  Hmmmm, and then was told that they hoped I would be able to locate it.  Really?  How could I do that when it was at the hotel or now more likely in someone's possession that works at the hotel.  

Surprised that a hotel of this caliber does not have more honest staff working there.  Disappointing to say the least, in their response time and lack of any offer for compensation, and I could have provided a receipt for this.

Nice hotel, great service. We didn't have any issues with theft even though we left valuables all over the place. The pool wasn't bad, nothing special. The whole place is non-smoking which can be annoying for some and refreshing for others. Others have complained about the boring rooms, but we got the corner room\/panoramic suite which was great and more like a one-bedroom apartment than a hotel room. The main drawback was the pull-out sofa bed. The worst I have ever slept on. I am literally in pain two days later. It feels like I slept on metal coils with no cushion. Multiple spots around my body are throbbing. Seems like they could do something about that. Valet only.

Randomly decided to stay at Vdara and so happy I did! These rooms are super spacious (they are all suites) and very clean\/modern looking. Beds and pillows are also super comfy!

I loved that I didn't have to wander around a casino for half an hour to find the front desk because there is no casino!! haha, you get to literally walk in and the front desk is right there. 

Valet only parking and there is no direct way to go from the hotel to the strip. You have to connect through Bellagio or Aria. I got confused a few times when i was heading BACK to the hotel! 

Now that I've stayed there once, Ive been getting lots of promotion emails from them and their rates are not bad! Would def consider staying here again!

I debated between giving Vdara a 4 or 5. I am going with 4. The place is perfect except for a few things:
1. To get to the strip is kind of confusing and difficult. The best way is to walk through the cosmopolitan. We didn't realize this on day 1, and then I realized that there is a tiny sign saying for pedestrians to do this. We almost got hit by cars the first day! Maybe a bigger sign?
2. The pool closes at 4. We were walking around a bit one day, and wanted to hang out by the pool before dinner. Not a late swim, but maybe like 5pm, I looked out our window and it was completely empty. That's not cool. Keep it open til like 7!
3. There is a full kitchen, but you need to call for plates, bowls, utensils, etc. I understand you don't want me to steal them when I leave, but I don't want to be boarding my airplane with  a new dining room set anyway!
4. The line at the front desk is always pretty long. I don't know how this compares to other hotels, but it takes a while to get through it. We didn't know when check in was, and we had to stand in the line just to ask which took  a bit of time. Maybe a sign saying "check in at 2pm" would be nice 
5. Resort fee -- like 22$\/day. Seems kind of silly. I guess it covers wifi, pool,  gym, etc. I don't pay $22\/day for my wifi at home!
6. Gym is pretty small for such a large hotel -- but this is only a minor complaint because I didn't come here just to work out!

So those are my cons, here are some pros, just so I can be positive...
-BEAUTIFUL room, amazing views, super friendly staff, comfy bed, nice bath tub, pretty quick staff for room service, bag drop off, etc, quiet hotel -- no casinos, I can't hear the people next to us or the elevators or the random children (why do you bring your children to vegas, this is the adult's disney world), not smokey smelling, pretty new building -- nothing has been severely damaged, quick access to a tram, etc, etc, etc

The best Hotel I have stayed in in Las Vegas. The rooms are gorgeous and absolutely amazing. The service is fantastic and the fact it is completely smoke-free is great. The bar at the ground level is not open 24hrs, but if you walk across the street to Aria, they have one that stays open. Price was not too bad, 250 a night, and we were upgraded to a suite.

Overall positive stay here.  Rough edges are all maintenance and housekeeping related. Shower needs adjustment, requested, not done.  Requested dishes for room, not done. Wrong number of towels, etc.  only stayed here 4 nights.

Having said that, low key hotel with great gym and friendly staff. Love the fact that there's no smoking anywhere here and no hassle.  Beautiful decor that is understated but not stodgy.
Service and price was inline with our needs. Deluxe room w\/ great view, gambling at the aria, earing at bellagio with a evening snack from the market. Burger was a 10!
My favorite place to stay in Vegas hands down!!! It's perfect for the kids because of the no smoking and no casino, however you are super close to the Aria if you feel like winning some money ;-).

Stayed here the week of March 26th, 2012.  Mmmm, the smell in this place is heavenly!  It's not lavender as someone else stated, it is fig.  So fresh and clean (and btw you can buy scent sticks in the spa and take a piece of Vdara home with you.)  Loved the outdoor lounge area w\/ the "swings".

Requested a "lake view" (aka Bellagio fountains) but upon check in was told we had a suite with view of the pool.  Was disappointed, but they were willing to change our room the following day.  We decided to stay in the room we had, as the view of the mountains and sunset was amazing.  Yes, $25.00 resort fee is ridiculous, but hey, we knew that at time of booking.  You need to request your robes, slippers and kitchenware (all items were delivered promptly).  Water was delivered every day.  Saw the maid in the hall and she even gave me two extra bottles : )   You have to go to the front desk to get the newspaper (do this as early as possible if you're into reading the news.)  The hairdryer is in the drawer in the bathroom.  There is NO coffemaker like you see in the pics and videos.  The lights and shades are a little tricky (you"ll figure it out though) and the blackout shades are wonderful if you want to sleep in.  Speaking of sleeping, the bed and pillows are amazing (also available for purchase).

Security always made sure everyone going onto elevators were guests.  I felt safe and relieved to know not just anyone off the street was just wandering around the guest floors.  I do have to agree with others, the elevator is extremely warm!!!  They really need to do something about that issue!

The spa is small, however, for $25.00 I think it was well worth it!  My advice would be to go early (I had the whole place to myself).  The tea is wonderful!  Try the white ambrosia, it's truly sensational.  Loved the fruit and nut mixtures, and they also have fresh fruit and bottled water.  The meditation room is so relaxing.  And the showers and vanity area provide you with all the essentials.

Being a non-gaming establishment is wonderful in itself as you don't have to walk miles to get to your room.  If you choose to gamble, you can take the walkway to Bellagio, tram to Monte Carlo, walk to Aria (its right there), or take the steps or elevator outside (by silk road) to The Cosmopolitan.  You can also take the shortcut through Aria to get to Crystals.

All, in all, Vdara is a great place to stay.  Would definitely stay there again!  If you need anything from the store I would advise going to CVS or Walgreens.  They are both withing walking distance.

One more thing I would like to add is the incidental charge of $100.00.  Please be aware of this!  It will tie up your money if you pay with debit card, so be sure to use your credit card.

Hope this was helpful!  Enjoy your stay : )

Gorgeous hotel.  Great views.  No smoke filled casino to get through.  LOVED it.  You are a little off the strip, but I liked it.  We got our car out of valet to drive down to the Neon Museum (DO IT), but other than that, pretty much walked everywhere.  The rooms are huge, the bathtubs are AMAZING, and the housekeeping is great.  The front desk clerks are very nice and the maintenance staff is very quick.  I would stay here again and again.

I was really excited to stay here because it was 100% smoke-free and no casino, but we found out quickly that we would have rather stayed elsewhere. 

room: no media package, as claimed. So no iPod charger\/alarm clock, no DVD player, nothing. The nightstand lamps didn't even have switches so we had to get out of bed to turn on the lights (it defeats the purpose of a nightstand lamp). No coffee maker in the room! What? Hard to find outlets. No robes (for a new\/modern hotel within that price point we expected to see them there). The rooms were pretty basic, they had a white comforter but no quilt, there was no color in the room. The toilet paper was crap. there was no safe! We're in Vegas, where's the safe? They have bad soundproofing, we could hear pool music at 8am. 

Service: one of the worst in Vegas and we've been here a few times. We were asked what floor we wanted and if the 36th floor was ok, we said yes, but then he said we'll upgrade you to a pool view after another worker whispered into our attendants ear. We ended up really disappointed with the room we had and the floor we were on. Constantly saw employees meandering around when there were lines. The person with the iPad, what do they do? When we were checking out there was no line and 2 attendants available, but because they didn't call us over we just walked to the front of the line. Except that two women behind us just ran up to the attendants and they helped them. I couldn't believe it! none of the front desk staff looked happy or at least welcoming. They didn't even ask us how our stay was; obviously they didn't care. 

Overall, unprofessional, mismanaged, and kids are running the hotel. We won't be going back

This is a nice looking hotel. The lobby is cool and modern looking. I'm unimpressed by the rooms and location for the price. You have to walk through a mall and Aria to get to the strip. No self parking, so you're stuck paying $18\/day for valet or parking at Cosmo amd walking your stuff in.

We absolutely love this hotel!  It is a non casino, non smoking hotel.  Once we are done for the day walking through all the other casinos to get to the strip\/ restaurant or see a show, we are able to head back to a quiet, clean air hotel.

The customer service and hospitality is impeccable!  We had an Executive Suite on 40th floor - it was a corner suite, the view was great.  We are able to see the Bellagio foundation.  Our bed was super soft and uncomfortable so I called housekeeping- we were so lucky Anthony (supervisor) picked up the phone.  Chatted with Anthony regarding the bed and he agreed to come to the room to check it out.  After inspection, he confirmed that the bed is old and it's in the process to get changed out.  At 10:30p that night, he brought over a brand new mattress (after confirming with us that it is not too late, otherwise he would change it in the morning)!!!  Another amazing service was that he didn't want us to wait for someone to put on the sheets, hands and knee he did it for us!!! WOW!!!  That is going the extra mile!  It made our stay incredible not to mention a good night sleep!

My one gripe about this suite is that we have a beautiful full kitchen equipped with full size refrigerator, dish washer, stove and a microwave, however there are no dishes, utensils or a coffee maker.  What hotels, even in a standard room that does not have a cheap coffee maker???  When I called housekeeping inquired about a coffee machine, it will cost us $20!  What hotel suites with a kitchen doesn't have any dishes, pots or utensils?  This is the first for us!!

Another funny part is that they have a scale in the bathroom.  Who wants to weigh themselves during vacation especially in Vegas.  First time seeing a scale in a hotel bathroom.  They fork out a nice scale but no coffee machine in a full size kitchen?!?! (Scratching my head)

This would have been 5 stars but had to take out a star for the kitchen without the coffee maker and other supplies.

Love this hotel, will definitely come back and tell al my friends about it!!!

It was definitely nice staying in a non smoking hotel in Vegas. Rooms were large and accommodates a family of 4 well. Two tv's so the adults could watch their show and kids could watch theirs in the living area.  Nice bathroom. Nice view of the Bellagio fountains.  Valet parking, no walking far to get to your room. And yes the lobby smelled great! 

Only bad things were sofa bed was not the most comfortable, no restaurant downstairs and low water pressure.

I stayed at Vdara for 4 nights beginning on 8\/25\/11.  I've stayed at almost all of the other 4 & 5 star resorts in Vegas, and Vdara would be near the top of my list of places to stay again.  The front desk staff was very nice, especially Kendal, who went out of his way to make sure our large group was able to have close\/ joining rooms.  I just wanted to mention his name so management knows that he was very nice and professional.

Our group had serveral different room types.
Standard room-25003: very nice and reasonably priced
Standard room w\/ lake view- 25008: very nice size, and spectacular view of water show. (I just wish I could have figured out how to play the music from the water show on the TV in the room)
Panoramic Suite-25001: great for 2 adults, but crowded for 3 adults. Decent views, but we couldn't see the Bellagio water show. Also gets a little hot when the sun comes up in the morning. 
2 Bedroom Penthouse Suite- 54004: very very nice.  It's basically a very spacious\/upscale 2 bedroom condo.  It has some of the best views of Vegas I've ever seen!  Sleeps 4 to 5 people comfortably, and has 2 full bathrooms!.  If you're going to have 4 people in your group, and you're getting 2 hotel rooms, spend the extra couple hundred a night and experience this room if you can! 


Overall Pros\/Cons: 
Pros: 
-new, modern, clean, non-smoking.
-3 minute walk to Bellagio and Aria, 
-great service, friendly staff
-pretty laid back atmosphere, not a lot of action going on. 
-priced extremely reasonable.  (almost half the price of staying at Bellagio, and they are connected, so it's like staying in a new\/modern wing of the Bellagio for half the cost!)

Cons: 
-no casino (but with how close Aria & Bellagio are, this wasn't a con for me).
-no restaurants except a lobby cafe with average food. (not a prob. though with how close my favorite restaurants at Bellagio and Aria).
-pool was average, not huge like other resorts, but it wasn't too small.  
-Sleeper sofa mattress was extremely uncomfortable to sleep on as a bed, but when folded up it was fine to sleep on as a regular couch. 
-We couldn't figure out how to use the media input for the ipod, so we couldn't play our own music.  I didn't ask for any assistance from the hotel, so maybe there was something I overlooked, but I'm pretty familiar with ipods\/ect. 

Overall very nice place to stay, and I look forward to staying there again.

Wow! Most rad room I've ever stayed in while in Vegas. It's a sweet suite, complete with a kitchenette (stove too) and a nice living space and mega bathroom. Our view is sensational from 50th floor. The pool area is lovely but the pool itself is tiny- like a kid pool, really. Excited we have access to the spa and fitness center as well. Right now I'm giving this a 4-star review based on esthetics alone. Maybe it will earn a 5 after I stay a while?

The two star rating is specific to the hotel itself.  We'd like to call out that the spa should be considered on it's own merit and would receive a 5 out of 5.  Specifically Kelsey in the Salon section does a great haircut.

Overall assessment: Vdara is the shell of a great hotel.  The design is outstanding - the touches of art and contemporary style are exactly what a great hotel on the strip should look like, but aside from that - all the "little things" about it that make a great experience were lacking.

Let's start at the very beginning... when checking in the front desk employee named Francis said that he was upgrading our room (yay!) and informed us that the pool was closed, but we could use Aria's pool instead.  As it turned out, he gave us the exact room we booked, misinformed us about the pool (it was open and we were later told that there was no affiliation with Aria), and yet, our breakfast that came with the booking was to be redeemed at the Aria (what??)

The room itself seemed smaller than described because a huge amount of sq footage was dedicated to a seemingly useless kitchen.  There is a kitchen, but no coffee maker.  Oh yeah, and then they charge you out the ass for a basic cup of coffee downstairs in the cafe (more than Starbucks!)  And to top it off, at one point, room service came up to drop off a box of Keurig k cups and when we pointed out we had no coffee maker they basically ran out of the room. The room was a king bed with a pull out couch.  The pull out couch was like sleeping on the coils and metal bars holding it together.  When we asked the front desk if there was another room with a better mattress (we were staying for four days and wanted to be comfortable, not too much to ask in my opinion) they said - we have nothing, but we can put 5 or 6 mattress pads on it and it will be okay.  OK is at best how I would describe it.  From a brand new hotel we expected some quality in the mattresses supplied in the bedrooms.  When the remote control stopped working in our room the front desk representative told me to pop out the back and make sure the batteries were in correctly then hung up.  

Our biggest issue with VDARA was that every single person who worked there seemed miserable to be there.  They were not there to make the experience comfortable nor pleasurable and hospitality was not on their minds.  Housekeeping was rude, the front desk was misinformed and snippy and the concierge did not want to be there.  We had good experiences with the man who delivered the linens for the pull out couch, the pool attendants and room service.  Icing on the cake; if you wanted to stay at this god forsaken place for a late checkout they were going to charge you for it, whether you're flight was delayed or not; oh and there is a $25 per day resort fee that is charged at checkout though there is no restaurant or resort to speak of.  
Aside from the Spa and hotel design Vdara promises a luxury experience and does not come remotely close to delivering.  NOT WORTH THE MONEY.

I booked here for my bday back in February 7th 2015
I haven't had the time to write a review now that I do let me just say. I wasn't happy at all. It was Cheap and that was fine it was my bday and our anniversary weekend. we decided to say one night down town and one in the main strip we stayed in golden nugget and as sad as this sounds the room was 3 times cleaner and smelled so much better! I if I remember right we stayed in the 22 somewhere there in a suit. First off we walked in the room it smelled like chicken wings! Like someone had just ate there like the smell was strong! The floors were not to clean and the glass door to the restroom was nasty dirty hand prints and stains. We also found empty soda cans in the closet! And water bottles half way next to the bed. I'm someone who likes nice and clean things and places. The room was so dusty I made my boyfriend whip everything with tissue and water. I was beyond mad! I was so mad but still didn't want to get the housekeeper in trouble she said it was her first week. So I didn't want to hurt her job cuz she said she was new. She was nice but the room was so bad. So I had to suck it up and clean myself! In Vegas! Cuz it feel nasty and musty and smelled like chicken wings! Though I love chicken wings it's a so called (5) star hotel and spa. I was very disappointed and won't be going back. We didn't say anything when we checked out but I hope that house keeper got more training cuz it did ruin my bday and anniversary that Saturday night. I didn't go to relax I went to clean a damn room. Seriously if I was someone mean I would have told and went off but the house keeper needs to do her job right. And mangers should be checking in on them. With that said in a short story I wouldn't stay here again. I hope a mangers sees this so that they can get on them. I hope they step it up and that this don't happen to anyone els.

Billed as a 5 star hotel, the issues we had should not have happened.

We stayed in the Vdara Suite, from Saturday, April 24, 2016 through Friday, April 29, 2016. For the most part, our experience was definitely at the luxury level. But, there were small things that in a less expensive place would have been acceptable. In a 5-star luxury hotel, they are not.

Pros
The Vdara is a beautiful. It's situated off of the main strip behind the Aria. This removes you from the hustle and bustle and noise. If you are looking for a quiet place to stay, this is a good choice. No dance club to keep you awake, no binging and bonging casino, no smoke to cling to your hair and clothes and stink up your room (if you are a non-smoker, this is a great feature; if you need to smoke go somewhere else - there is no smoking anywhere on the property).

The customer service is second to none. Any problem you have will be rectified as soon as physically possible. (See below.) When I needed detergent, they ran it right up to the room in just a few minutes at no charge.

The housekeeping was amazing, to a point. We are slobs. The housekeeping staff was great about dealing with that. They lined up all of our toiletries, collected all of our loose change and put it into a glass, etc.

The room service was great, too. Food was very good, and when it was delivered the person set up our dining room table with place mats, silverware, even a small vase of flowers. A great touch.

Cons
The shower head and shower stall are designed such that the water hit me chest high (I'm 5'-9"), and I couldn't back up.  So, I had to contort myself and stand on one leg to rinse the lower bits. For the size of the stall, they should have an adjustable height showerhead or a handheld head.

As great as the housekeeping service is, we did have an issue. [The hotel does not know this story. We didn't tell them because we didn't really know what to say and, further, how and even if, it should or could be rectified.] While preparing for bed one night, I noticed that there was a jar of Vick's Vaporub on my night-table. We both hate Vick's Vaporub. Yet here was this jar on the night-table. I got a tissue and grabbed the jar. The top lid was covered in dust. Expired November 2014.  Assuming the person who left it behind was using it within the expiration period, this jar had been in that room for a minimum of 18 months. Probably just an oversight, but gross nonetheless.

Lighting in the living room was dim. Only one lamp on the desk and the wall switch didn't control it. We had to walk over to it and use the switch on the lamp to turn it on. Not a big deal, but there should have been more light in the living room. (See below.)

The blackout drape doesn't really black out the light from the windows. There is a blackout drape and a shade, and they have holes in them that line up and let in the light.

The washing machine stinks, and when I washed my clothes, they came out with the same odor

Bits you should know...
When it was time to go, we were in a rush to catch our plane.  We tend to freak out a bit when we leave a place because we are always terrified of leaving something behind. Because of this, the following three things happened:
     1. While was packing and zipping an overstuffed bag, I leaned on it wrong, it slipped to the side, landed on the living room end table, breaking it. My fault. It made a loud noise, and when it happened I screamed out a very loud eff***. My wife called from the shower, two rooms away, to ask what happened. I yelled back that I broke the effing table. Then I cut my foot and efffed again. 2 minutes later there was a knock on the door. Security. Accused me of beating my wife. Wouldn't go away until they saw her. Good I guess, but annoying. If they had seen the blood from my foot, I probably would have been arrested.
     2. In my haste, I forgot to tip the housekeeping staff. My fault, and I feel bad, but...
     3. I got a call the next day about the end table, which was resolved in minutes (I paid for it).  But the manager, who was VERY nice about the whole thing, also said that housekeeping said that I was responsible for a missing glass desktop (which is a six-foot long sheet of glass) and two missing end table lamps. These objects were not present in my room when I checked in. But how do you prove that?  It turns out that I had used my phone to take a bunch of pictures of the room when we got in so I could show family\/friends (because it was so nice). It's a good thing I did because those pictures showed that those items were not present at that time. If not, I would have had to pay for them as well. I think the housekeeping staff accused me of this because I didn't tip them. Why go six days without mentioning it? Why even let me check in to the room without mentioning it? Shady.

Anyway, the Vdara is beautiful, but make sure you take pics of the room so you can prove you didn't steal anything.

The Vdara is a very solid hotel choice for someone looking to stay near the Las Vegas Strip. It does not, however, have the feel of a luxury five-star hotel across the board. First, the good: the rooms are very nice and spacious, with stunning views from the higher floors, comfortable beds, large bathrooms, and a relatively modern look. There is no casino, so that gives the lobby a quieter feel and helps you take a breather from the commercial cheesiness of Las Vegas. There is a complimentary valet, an extremely relaxing spa area (with purchase of a reasonable day pass), and a friendly\/attentive concierge. On the negative side, the pool area leaves something to be desired. It felt crowded and lacked an air of tranquility, to the extent that I would highly recommend daily rental of their "private" cabanas instead, which are pretty awesome (though undivided, so you're basically sharing with the cabanas around you). The hotel also lacks personality. It very much has the feel of a giant condo building, with a transient lobby area, a sad excuse for a bar, and a tiny market\/sandwich shop in lieu of a proper restaurant. The location is decent but not amazing. Yes, it's close to the Aria, but getting to the Strip required a very long, circuitous walk - a bonus if you're eating like a fat whale, but slightly limiting if you're looking to shoot back and forth from the hotel to certain attractions. Finally,the bath products are downright nasty - the same kind of cheap, overdrying soaps and shampoos you'd expect to find at a Holiday Inn Express, not a five-star hotel. Overall, it's a GOOD hotel, but it's definitely worth exploring other options.

Very nice hotel with very nice amenities.  It is very modern and has amazing views.  We have stayed in the Panoramic Suite, the Fountain View Studio and the Vdarra Suite.  All were nice but the Panoramic Suite kills the view (means it was AMAZING, WONDERFUL, Breathtaking).  Love the kitchen because I have kids and they can take food into the room and reheat it later or we can eat at the nice table while looking at the view.  Always ask for a fountain view.  (tip: On Priceline this hotel is usually around 89 to 99.00.  It does not have dice because they have no casino.  When you bid, look for South strip with no dice and you will get, Aria, Cosmo or Vdarra...Vdarra is the cheapest hotel..5 star with no dice. Bid around 80.00 and you can get in and upgrade your view upon arrival).  One last thing, the walkway to the Bellagio is quick and can be accessed within 5 minutes of leaving your room.  Easy in and easy out.  Good for families.

I always have a great experience at this hotel. The suites are nice and the penthouses are exceptional. Service has never disappointed. If you are looking for a resort setting without the cigarette smell, the atmosphere is great! There is a small pool, and no casino within the facility but the Aria is just a 2 minute walk with a fun nightclub inside. Planet Hollywood, Bellagio, Crystals Shopping Center, and number of other hotels are well within walking distance. I always recommend this place to friends and family.

Very impressed with the cleanliness of this hotel!  Not only that check-in and out were both extremely quick and easy.  Service was great.  This was my first stay so they bumped me to a top floor view room for free!  This is by far the best hotel I've stayed at in Vegas.

The room we stayed in was fantastic. New and well designed. I love that the hotel doesn't have a casino inside. It's nice walking into the lobby and not being inundated with the smell of cigarette smoke and the sound of slot machines. But, if you wanna gamble your mortgage away, you can just walk right next door to Aria. Love the set up and will stay here again for sure.

Pleasantly surprised!! I am not a huge fan of Las Vegas so I think my expectations were quite low to start.
Speaking to a guest in the elevator on the way to my room - he said, "You will LOVE it!". ok I was getting a little pumped.
WOW, I loved my room...45th floor with a clean sweeping view of VEGAS and it actually made my stay!! I am a big bath person and find great pleasure in ending any evening with a hot soak....this tub was a beauty. Suddenly I found myself yearning to end the evening earlier just to try out the tub...sigh.
The automated black-out blinds and blush shades, dark woods contrasted with white linens...spacious bathrooms and a whole wall of window....
I will be back :)

REALLY enjoyed my stay. Rooms are new clean modern attractive. Location is fantastic. It's nice to stay in non casino hotel. Aria and Cosmo are 3-5 min walk so close enough for casino action and excellent food options in both. Easy access for Uber Lyft transportation from Vdara. Very helpful staff. Will definitely stay here more.

meehhhhhh... this hotel is ALRIGHT... had some troubling experiences here during EDC weekend....... I don't really want to talk about it too much on here. Let's just say their staff is unprofessional and not very friendly and courteous. It's not what you expect from a 5 star resort. It is very modern and beautiful, that I will agree on... but their rooms are not very impressive. We booked the corner suite and thought it'd be nice and a bit spacious.. when we arrived it felt cramped and I felt claustrophobic because it was so small and basically you are stuck in a square. Everything is connected and the guy from house keeping told us that Vdara was suppose to be condo's and you can definitely see it in the layout. The suites come with a kitchen (stove, dishwasher and fridge) but none of the tools to cook.. you have to call house keeping for pots\/pans and forks and plates. It was weird how it wasn't just stocked in the kitchen for guests to use. I felt like a pain in the arse to house keeping because everything I needed was not in the room beforehand. I don't know if I'd stay here again, plus it's pretty expensive and I could spend that much elsewhere and be much happier.......
A non smoking hotel, no casino. It's very clean, nice, and near everything. Also, pet friendly.

We loved the Vdara!! The staff was extremely accomodating, and very very nice. Valet staff was also excellent. Our suite was very luxurious with an awesome view of the mountains. We loved the location, close to City Center, shopping and dining. I loved the bathroom in our suite!! The shower was awesome and the tub was huge! I always judge a place by their room service food and Vdara passed with flying colors!!! It was damn good and i ordered room service than once!! I would definitely revisit here :)

So had a last minute trip to vegas and needed somewhere to stay but it always seem like I always stay on either ends of the strip but never in the middle.. So whats more middle than the new city center..

Vdara is one of the finished buildings of city center that houses a non casino hotel for those looking for the more quiet but close to action type of accommodation. This large hotel is located on the back of the city center and connected by walking bridge to Bellagio as well as aria and crystals by tram..Now you would think getting out of Vdara and getting on the strip would be an easy task with so many options,, but think again.. this property's location is so much in the back getting to the strip and back by walking will become quite a task after a few days of staying here.

Arrived unexpectedly earlier than check in time and was taken in with a smile.. My room choice was a 800 sq ft sutie room which included a dining room, 1 guest restroom, 1 full bathroom, living room, master bedroom and kitchen.. Beautifully layed out room with with almost all the modern ammenities you would want..

A few notable features of this hotel room that i have not seen in similar sized rooms was the fact that you get a water dispenser on the full size fridge, automatic shades in both bedroom and living room, new card scanning doors with button request for house cleaning and privacy oh and how could I forget a full washer and dryer built in..

Besides all the little surprises here and there, this room included many interesting storage closests that help you store your bags or watever you may need to hide from public view, perfect if you are planning a party in the room and don't want your guest to trip over all your crap.

Simple things such as bathrobes and shoes that are fitted for his and her sizes and not just one size fits all are those little details that make this a four diamond hotel.

However with all hotels there are always a few details that always need more attention.. Vdara is lacking ipod or iphone intergrated devices
which many other major hotels are now carrying.. Tvs in the bathroom always is a nice feature especially when your room already has a soaking tub.. One major detail I am now seeing not only here but other hotels that carry keurig coffee machines is that they provide a room for 2 with one coffee cup and 2 k cups.. Give more k cups and more than one cup saves us from calling to request more..

After staying at similar hotels like the encore and The Hotel the modern features in Vdara gives it that extra half a star that will put it to the top.. Service was top notch but sometimes a little annoying such as a person checking in on you to remind you that check out is at 12, ten minutes before check out time.. Totally don't like this feature and hope they get rid of it.. Also the check up call to see if you received what was requested earlier.. not necessary..

Vdara was a great hideaway hotel in the middle of the action, equipped with the must have modern touches and service to back it up..
