Cons: food options in lobby are absolutely terrible and overpriced ($8 for bottled water and extremely low quality food - although, it is a pretty quick walk to the other casinos' restaurant options), starbucks' prices are almost doubled, some aspects of hotel are out dated (remotes for TVs did not work, switch for blinds was obviously old and broken when we got into room and had to be fixed twice, remote was broken, some lights were out), the "black out" blinds that are advertised are NOT black out and light pours in, I was never blown away by the staff or service - it was just o.k., and valet is pretty slow


I really want to give this hotel 5 stars because the location is great and the hotel itself is so unique to Vegas; however, it is not quite a 5 star experience. I think this place could really be an amazing destination; although, it simply falls sort. We ended up staying our extra nights at the Bellagio because it was slightly cheaper and I was underwhelmed by this hotel.

Having said that, I would consider giving it another shot in the future based on the atmosphere and no smoking environment while being sooo close to the Vegas experience!

Hard to review this hotel. In the last year I spent over 2 months here and at the end I always come back to Vdara because it's nice, modern, all rooms have a kitchen and it's well connected to City Center.
On the other side, the staff is abysmal: they are always late when you call, the maids forget to come, and the keys regularly stop working so you need to go downstairs and get a new one every other day.
If they could fix these issues it would be a 5 star.

I've stayed here twice this year and I like it! It's pretty new, clean, and no casino. Haven't tried the restaurant or bar but the cafe is OK. They have cute desserts! Pool is small. The service is good.

The basic room is called a "Suite" but they are relatively spacious and include a fridge, and kitchen. 

It's a close walk to Aria, Bellagio, and Cosmo. So if you like to gamble...don't worry!

Also, I love their robes :)

If I was looking to live in Vegas I would definently consider the condos in Vdara

I usually stay next door at the Aria. I tried Vdara vecause of a room rate deal. As far as the hotel goes, it is just fine. With no casino, it was a nice quiet refuge from the strip. BUT, LIKE EVERY STORY IN VEGAS, WITH THE GOOD, COMES THE BAD .... (or semi-bad).

Vdara is valet parking only. I can only presume that they have some crazy figure 8 Hot Wheels set up in the parking structure that precludes recreational drivers from parking their own cars.  

Okay, so we roll with the valet. However, when my clean ride comes back, there's a new door ding. Ba-bam! I'm not a sniveler by any means, but they made me use the car jockey. It wasn't my choice. So, I make a claim. And, I have have to say I didn't have any expectations that Vdara (or big brother Aria) would accept responsibility for the damage.

And, what do you know, I - was - right.  Here's my telephone exchange with Aria Risk Management representative "Al." 

Al - "I checked the video and see your car already had the damage." 
Me - "Really?"  
Al - "Yup."  
Me - "The ding is about 3\/8 of an inch. How could you even see that?"  
Al - "We have a hi-tech high resolution video system."  
Me - "I'm cool with that, just email me a copy of the photo image from your system."  Al  "Oh, I can't do that. It's pr-o-p-r-i-e-t-a-r-y .... They would fire me on the spot."  
Me - "Dooh ... So, you can't send me a photo of my own car?"  
Al - "No, you'll just have take my word on this."     
Me - (Words not for publication)            

My suggestion - If you wanna stay at the Vdara, park in the Aria garage and walk to Vdara. That way, if your car gets door dinged, you'll be upset, but there's no clear suspect to be pissed at.

IMPORTANT UPDATED INFORMATION

Well I'll be damned!  After I sent a letter, Aria\/Vdara took a second look at my situation took care of my issue.  I won't disclose the details, but I'm presently in a renewed happy place about Vdara.  With that, I'm adding back a couple of stars to the rating.  

I've actually returned to Vdara many times all with positive experiences.  I really like this place. It is well run and without a casino inside (yet Aria close), it is a relatively quiet and mature refuge from the Strip.

My fiance (now husband) stayed here when we came to Las Vegas to get married and honeymoon.

We had a wonderful experience and I would definitely stay at Vdara (or any MGM property) again.

Every single staff member was helpful, especially that first day when we were getting use to the lay of the hotel.

Unlike some reviewers *ah hem* I always make sure to read my paperwork before signing up for anything.  Read up on all the amenities, resort fees and taxes and included this in my planning. Just makes sense.

The room was spotless, and was cleaned daily and checked at least 2x a day.  There was an optional turn down service, but we turned it down.  The waters left in the room by staff we highly appreciated! We left a tip for the staff every single day.

The windows were huge and really let you take in the mountains in the background, and the city at night. You could not beat the view from our room. 38 floors up we could see the Eiffel tower, Bellagio fountains and the High Roller (new 550ft observation wheel, tallest in the world atm)

Since we were there a week but only brought carry-on luggage, we also made use of the washer\/dryer.  It is just a small stacked set made to handle shirts and pants, not larger items, which was fine.  The Vdara provided complementary detergent and dryer sheets on request.

There was an in-suite kitchen, and being able to save leftovers and heat them up properly to eat tomorrow was a blessing. 

The Market Cafe in the lobby was nice because of convenience (but you will pay for it of course)

It was very nice to 'get away' from the city when you were ready to sleep.  No casino, no smoking, quite and peaceful.  And if you are a night owl is is a short walk away are Bellagio and Aria, both are excellent properties to visit. Bellagio has the gardens and fountains, both have casinos. Also there is a free tram to Monte Carlo and Crystal Shops. 

To those complaining about walking, why on earth would you choose a Las Vegas Vacation? And why on earth would you stay here if you wanted to be on the strip?  Do you not know how to read a map scale?

My boyfriend and I stayed here over the spring break week (4 Days) in March of 2015 and we really enjoyed our stay!! An upgrade from Caesar's Palace... We stayed in the Studio Suite 1 bedroom and it was amazing! We got a deal on Sams Club Travel so i would recommend booking on their website than Vdara's website.  We were impressed with how modern it looked and how clean it was. It's definitely more quieter than the other hotels since it does not have a casino inside and it is smoke free.  The room was very spacious (about 582 sq. ft.) with a small kitchenette including a microwave, one top burner, small refrigerator, medium sized table, lounge couch, kind sized plush bed and tub in the bathroom. The pool is a good size too but when we went it was too cold to go in. The housekeepers were very very nice too and always came on time or came back when you needed them too. They even straightened up our own belongings and made them look nice!!  The service was great when we first arrived too! The valet men were on their feet the whole time (running to get everyone's cars) even when we needed our car pulled out a couple of times during the week. The front desk employees were very nice and helpful too. We payed an extra $30 to check-in early and it was worth it. Inside the lobby there is a Starbucks and mini cafe to grab a bite to eat. There's even plenty of sitting areas that look like you are in a rain forest lol. Also they have "hotel guards" that stand in two places when you enter the service elevators to go up to your room. Sometimes you may need to hold your key card to make sure they know you are staying here. In this hotel you really can't hear anything outside of your door or next to you. It's that quiet! One plus about this hotel is that it has easy access to the Bellagio Hotel since  all you have to do is walk around the corner at Starbucks in Vdara and access the bridge into Bellagio. This hotel is located right next to Aria and Cosmopolitan too so you are right there basically on the strip just pushed back...For the price of this hotel, its worth staying here! Nothing bad to say about Vdara! We had such a great experience. ;)
 
P.S. If you order room service make sure to get their pancakes!  They are huge!!!

Vdara is a beautiful Hotel. I enjoy any Hotel in Vegas that doesn't smell like cigarettes and alcohol. Unlike others, our view looks over a parking garage and The Rio was in the distance, so sadly our view sucked. So be aware, that you won't get a great view every time. Rooms are big, clean, and the bathtub is perfect for a soak after a day of non stop shopping. The only con is that you have to do a bit of walking in order to get on the strip. Either you can pass over a walkway that goes into the Bellagio, and then out to the strip, or you can walk across Valet parking to the Aria and walk through the Aria to get to the strip. On day 1 it didn't seem that bad of a walk, but by day 2 and 3 I dreaded that walk. Would we return? Um, Maybe? It wouldn't be my first choice every time though. Caesars is still my number 1.

This is 4.5 stars, but I'm rounding up because my experience exceeded expectations.

I come to Vegas on a regular basis and am pretty jaded.  I often come for work, so have to keep it cool for much of the week, as I'm unable to self-medicate with coffee or Red Bull in the morning.  My company had booked a 2 bedroom suite for entertaining clients, and myself and one of my coworkers ended up benefiting from this arrangement.

The view from the suite was amazing.  We were looking due south on the 45th floor, and had a clear view of the 15, the Luxor, the Mandalay Bay, etc.  I pulled rank on my coworker to get the view to the southwest from my bedroom as well.

It's not right on the Strip, but Harmon offers pretty easy access to the frontage road (Dean Martin) paralleling the freeway on the West.  This is a fast way to get around without dealing with the traffic crush and rubberneckers on the Strip.

There is no casino.  If you consider this a downside of this hotel you might have a gambling problem.  There is a casino less than 1\/4 mile from the front door (Aria).  The Cosmopolitan is walking distance if you're craving more clubs and eye candy.  Since the Vdara isn't really a 'destination', the cab traffic can be somewhat light but the taxi lines sort of match, so getting a cab isn't that much of a time suck.

There were only a couple of misfires that didn't really dampen the whole experience:

The wall safe in the walk-in closet was mounted and hinged so that I could not see into it when it was open.  But hey, walk in closet.

There were no outlets near the bed, but there were enough outlets in the bedroom that I just coped with having my phone over on a small table instead of near me on the nightstand.

There were a few problems with the keys when we checked in, but that might have been because of the way we were getting multiple keys for many coworkers.

One of the valet attendants was pretty rude when we asked for the favor of leaving our rental up front, despite us being willing to tip heavily to make it happen.  The rental was an Escalade, so it wasn't the ugly car factor (since there was an Explorer in the front row).

The blinds leave small slits so it's not as blacked out in the morning as I've seen in other hotels.  This wasn't a deal killer, but you might consider bringing a sleeping mask if you plan on partying hard and light keeps you awake in the morning.

Those were very minor, and were washed away by all the greatness I observed.

Service (apart from the aforementioned valet attendant) was fantastic.  Everyone was super-friendly, even the elevator guards.

The suite was fully appointed, by which I mean you could live in it, which I'm led to understand was the original point of the hotel.  Dishwasher, instant-hot faucets, oven, full-sized built-in fridge, range, big built-in trash can, washer and dryer, and a flatscreen TV in both bedrooms and the main sitting area.  It was \/big\/, bigger than any two bedroom apartment I've ever rented.  It had a small half bath in the front and full private bathrooms for each bedroom, including separate shower and bath.  The blinds were remote controlled.  The bed and pillows were exceptionally comfortable.  Exceptionally.

Internet access was free and mostly usable, if you don't mind occasionally hitting a clear http site to 'reset' the connection.

We plugged our laptops right into this fancy access panel under the TV via HDMI and were easily able to deliver presentations.

Walking into a hotel after a long evening in Vegas after a long day working a trade show and being greeted by a pleasant smell and the blissful ABSENCE of slot machine dinging and blinking made the evenings wind down more pleasantly.

Maybe I just like this place because i'm getting old, but I will definitely stay here again!

I thought the hotel was very nice. I got a good rate through bidding on priceline. It was nice that the hotel was smoke free and there was no casino to walk through. I suggest asking for the full kitchen items since they are only available upon request. Otherwise you have to call the desk and request them and the wait can be up to half hour. Another thing to remember is that there will be a $20 resort fee added per day plus tax. Also room service is very expensive. I wrote more in my Vegas blog at letsjetset.com

Stayed here for my birthday and just love this hotel....so nice and convenient location. This time I booked a room through Hakkan who was more than gracious and got us a great deal on a really busy weekend! This hotel is very modern and quiet and NO SMOKING! Gotta love that and they pipe vanilla through the vents which makes the hotel smell very nice and fresh and if you want to gamble you can just walk over to ARIA with all their fabulous restaurants too. LOVE the free valet for guests! 

My only complaint this time is the housekeeping was a little lacking...no coffee or utensils in the room and they never cleaned our room.....and had to wait a long time for more towels\/blankets.

We had a great corner suite on one of the top floors with a nice view of the strip!

DOS: 3\/7 and 3\/8\/2015

I LOVED the Vdara! My husband and I stayed in a corner suite for a total of four nights.The room was spacious and the view was amazing! I also loved the fact that the hotel did not have a casino and was non-smoking! It made for a much faster taxi line, especially when it was raining and no irritating cigarette\/cigar smoke (I wear contacts so all of the smoke was really irritating my eyes).  

Housekeeping was also very friendly and efficient when it came to cleaning our room. They were always on it when we needed something brought up. For instance, the Keurig in our room was missing and they brought one up for us as well as extra cups and k-cups. However, I did deduct a star because my things were constantly being moved. I.E. My hairbrush and facial lotion would constantly move from my side to that of my husband's. 

I also loved that room service was offered for 24 hours a day. We enjoyed ordering room service, but I despised the fact that it would take hours to fulfill an order. For instance, on Saturday night at about 2AM, we ordered two salads. We were told that it would take 30 minutes, but it ended up taking 2 hours. On Friday night, the same thing happened, however, this time, we had fallen asleep by the time that they delivered our food so we didn't get our food, but were still charged for the order. BOO! The other times that we did order room service, the food arrived within a reasonable time frame so room service was definitely hit or miss. 

I would still recommend the Vdara because it isn't as crowded as other hotels and it has easy access to the freeway.

Memorial Day weekend was very memorable at the Vdara. Check in with no problems, room was ready and cleaned. The atmosphere, let's just say there is plenty of eye candy in the hotel. I would recommend any couple to book this hotel for a weekend getaway.

Nice hotel but don't waste your money on the panoramic suite  This hotel is great if you are on business because it is set way back off the strip.  This makes it inconvenient for anyone in town for vacation.  The panoramic suite is nice for the first 5 minutes.  The blackout shades allow a lot of light to come in the room and since the rooms face the strip all the neon lights still shine through.  The panoramic room has a full kitchen but no supplies.  No silverware, no dishes. no coffee pot, nothing.  What is the point?  Why spend the money to have a kitchen when you can't do anything in there.  There is no extra bedding even on the pull out sofa.  When I did call for an extra blanket it took an hour and 2 phone calls.  The bed is OK, it is a bit hard though.  The front desk is slow at checking people in.  The café is overpriced as is the Starbucks in lobby.  It's a nice quiet hotel but if you are in Vegas for a vacation you can do better.

OMG I love this place! ok, so I have been to several hotels, and I have always had one complaint or another. I have stayed at TI, MGM, and Excalibur and I'm sure others. I should preface this by saying that you should only stay here if you do not want to be near a casino, or smoking, so you like a very quiet atmosphere which is laid back. My boyfriend and I booked our vacation here after taking a look at several hotels. It was a little bit pricey, but the website sold us. When we got there, we realized that there was only valet, no self parking. But we don't like valet and so we decided to park at the Bellagio. That turned out to be a great idea. The Bellagio is connected to the Vdara, so the parking was really close to our hotel.

We reserved just the basic room, which was fabulous. We were on a lower floor, and didn't hear a single person in another room the entire time we were there. No drunks, smokers, partiers! The room had a coffee maker, with coffee cups. The blinds were electronic, so the blinds could be darkened with a touch of a button. When the shades were up, the view was pretty good. The bed was very comfortable. AND THE BATHROOM IS AMAZING. There is a deep soaking tub and a huge shower with a sitting area. The living room furniture was a little bit worn, but we spent most of our time on the bedroom side of the room. The bed was very comfortable, and they offer a ton of channels on the tv. The pool is outdoor and when there wasn't a party, it was  a great place to lounge. The staff was nice and the housekeeping staff is amazing! If you're looking for a get away inside of Vegas, then you should stay here. 

Overall the place was great. The only complaints that we had were 1. no self parking 2. no convenience store or stores of any kind in the hotel. 3. in room dining was too expensive 4. Only one restaurant on site.

Vegas is known for all things glam, over the top, and totally blinged out.  And the more bling, the better.  So when someone decides to build not just one hotel but a block of hotels, high-end shopping, casinos, it better live up the hype of Vegas.

And sadly, Vdara was just a poser hotel.  Not even a casino.

I stayed here with a group of friends in May.  One of my friends had a code for a reduced rate that came with bottled water, in-room dining credit, in-room movie (like anyone watches TV while in Vegas?), and pre-paid resort fees.  I had high expectations that Vdara would live up to its glamorous marketing images and staying here would be a life-changing event.  

Highlights:
--rooms were generously sized with full-bath, kitchenette, dining room\/table.  I thought it was cute to have a door bell.
--staff was very friendly and hospitable.  And the check-in girls have the cutest business suits on
--workout room was stocked with towel and water (for those who like stocking up on free water and towels) and very clean
--easy to access tram

Lowlights:
--Hotel could have been in Anywhere, USA.  There was nothing distinct about it that made it feel like I was in Vegas.
--I felt like I was at a business hotel, as the check-in staff was wearing suits the whole time.  I get that the hotel is supposed to be professional, but suits?  Let's be a bit more creative, yes?
--So pricey for a basically boring hotel w\/out a casino and a small pool area.  
--You have to request a fork, spoon, knife, plates, cups which although easy, just seems like a hassle to wait for the housekeeping crew to bring a spoon to you  
--Pool was small.  Just one pool and about 20 rows of white recliner chairs.  $18\/day resort fee for something that was just dull.  The people at the Monte Carlo pool looked like they were having much more fun.
--Complicated curtain system that had an operating control on the other side of the room.  
--Lack of restaurants in the hotel.  Yes, I could have walked to Aria, but then I am on vacation and totally lazy.  I don't want to spend 20 minutes walking through another hotel\/casino to find a place to eat.  

I definitely won't be staying here again unless I get a rate for $50\/night.  The hotel was generic and incredibly boring.

This place is AMAZING!!!! The rooms are gorgeous and the service is impeccable.  I love the fact its a non gaming and non smoking hotel.  It feels good go down the elevator and the first thing you smell is cigar or cigarette smoke.  

The rooms are all suites and its very spacious. The views are amazing and its a hop, skip and a jump from the Cosmopolitan and the Aria.  The have free WiFi and did i say AMAZING??  I think this hotel will be my go to hotel from now on when I go to Vegas.

Vdara is one of the newest Hotel\/Casinos on the strip.
It has that whole modern\/clean look, the designers here,also executed the remodel beautifully.
It's pretty small and crammed between others though, so that its hard to figure out when you are in which Casino\/Hotel.
Not big enough to spend the entire day in but nice to stroll through and stop to have a drink\/meal\/gamble in a gorgeous atmosphere.

Amazing. Loved it really! The service was great, everyone was nice and polite, all of them willing to help out! The room that I got was absolutely amazing! haha the view was incredible and I enjoyed that the most. I enjoyed the design of the room and it was very elegant and clean looking. I definitely loved the bathroom design and it was actually the design I was gonna remodel my bathroom to. 

There's actually no smoke at the Vdara and no casino, so it's great for children and families. The only thing they have is a little bar near the front entrance and elevators but that's about it. 

Overall the service was amazing, the rooms amazing, my room view amazing, and I would definitely go back if I am ever in vegas again.

A hotel on the strip with NO casino and NO smoke?!?! Yesss, Welcome to Vdara :) 

I actually enjoyed not having to deal with the usual Vegas crazy hotel lobbies full of people walking through to get to the casino. This place was quite and relaxing. All the rooms are suites, which was more then enough space for me and my bestie. We enjoyed a good night's sleep in their super comfy bed. The place was clean and I noticed no stains. The decor is modern...more like Ikea stuff though, nothing fancy. 

You cannot self-park, it is vallet only. 

The only downside was not having a restaurant in the hotel, but we didn't have to go to far. The hotel is conveniently located in the middle of the strip that was definitely a plus!

We arrived at the hotel and they gave us only two big towels, nothing else. When we asked for more towels and more blankets, they asked how many people were in the room. It was so annoying. Anyways, the hotel is cheap and the service was bad.

I've only been here about 15 minutes but man...this is a high class operation here.  Upon arriving they offered a room upgrade for an extra $60.  Took the offer.  The suite (these are all suites here) is huge.   There are two bathrooms, one large walk in shower, a hot tub, two large screen TV's and even a washer and dryer to use, also complimentary...with complimentary detergent they offer.  This is a straight hotel with no casino so there's technically no smoke around here.  The Cosmo and Aria are right around here so walking to a casino is no problem.  You get the actual rest and relaxation method here since noise is minimal.  I typically crash at Palms Place but this may be my new go to spot in Vegas.

This hotel is so beautiful and truly smoke free since it's non-gaming and I want to like it SOOO badly but it's done me wrong so I can't!  

The good:  Decor, architecture, newness of everything, super delicious food, good size rooms, amenities in rooms are nice including the Aveda stuff, valet guys are nice and the pool is decent.  Great value for the price.  

The bad and ugly:  it took us almost an hour to check in our two rooms.  I used to work at a hotel for several years and I would say that's completely unacceptable.  We had to ask three times over the course of four hours to have our room cleaned by housekeeping.  Couldn't figure out how to use the bathtub faucet and when I called the operator, she said she had no idea...??   I emailed them and wrote them a letter about my experience two weeks ago and still haven't received ANY response.  Again, NOT good customer service.  

Until they work on customer service and improve I would not recommend this place to anyone.

As of Jan. 2011, also want to note that I emailed and snail mailed a complaint letter to their management and never got a response.  I used to work in a hotel and that is totally unacceptable.

Very impressed with the staff and the hotel. We had a great experience here and our penthouse was very nice and reasonably priced. It was a little far from all the good day parties and pool parties but a 10 dollar cab\/limo takes care of that even though it is definitely annoying. 
My dad has a penthouse at the Hilton Elara and pays twice as much for way less room, not as nice, and a better view. Vdara is a win in my book.
We loved our suite with our amazing view. The best part enjoyed the fresh air. The market place and Starbucks made it very convenient. We would definately stay here again.

I really liked this hotel and I am not a Vegas lover. If you are looking for a hotel that does not remind you at every moment that you are in Vegas this is the place for you.  Like THe Hotel in Mandalay Bay (another awesome non-Vegasy place), Vdara is smoke, slot-machine free.  And I also noticed a deficit in sock and sandal wearing tourists.  Bonus for sure.  Quick and courteous staff, although the concierge seemed to be a bit overwhelmed when I tried to set up some basic transportation.  The cafe on the first floor is cool, pricey...but when in the City of Lost Wages....oh! And the kitchenettes in the room are nice; you could actually have a pre-party in your room.  Last,but not least...the pool, by Vegas standards is sub par.  Find another pool to post up at if you can.

We stayed here for 6 days for my 30th birthday.  Got a cabana at the pool and I must say, for the price of the cabana..it should include a bottle.  I had about 8 people total, the cabana itself was $200 that included an apple, an orange, 4 bottles of water, 1 kind bar, some chips, a safe, a tv, chassis lounge chairs, and a little couch.  When we got our final bill after buying some snacks and a bottle of grey goose($165 for the bottle). The bill was over $600!!! I was appalled. Ive had a cabana at the stratosphere for cheaper and it came with a bottle. I mean I understand location but thats a little ridiculous if you ask me. When we didn't have the cabana we had purchased a couple of pitchers which served 4(my hubby and i shared 2 pitchers and we didn't even catch a buzz) $44 each i think they were. If your gonna charge that much for drinks the least you could do is make them so you can actually catch a buzz\/get drunk.(I mean, why else do people drink alcohol?!) It was a nice hotel with good happy hour in the lounge downstairs but thats about it. We did order room service one time for dinner on my birthday and after we had told her how much we spent at the cabana she felt so bad that she actually hand delivered some chocolate covered strawberries to us at no charge. We thought that was super cool of her to do. Valet was extremely fast when it came to getting our car which was also another plus. The AC worked extremely well and kept our suite nice and cool the whole time. I had a friend stay with us for a few days and she stayed on the pull out couch but after the first night she just slept on the couch because it was a HORRIBLE pull out mattress FULL of springs sticking out! The so called "blackout" curtains weren't blackout curtains. I actually got woken up EVERY morning from the sun shining in through the cracks in the curtains.  Like i said it was a nice hotel with a great view of the Bellagio fountains, the Eiffel tower, and the high roller, but we will never stay there again...just way too pricey unless we were at happy hour.

Would be a great hotel in anywhere else, but in Vegas it a meh. But hated their check-in scam. Tried to add $18\/night to rate (was told it was required) for WiFi - I have an iPhone). When I asked to see the manager, it was "waived".

This is a little late, but I stayed here on the 12th of march, and it was amazing. Upon check in we were upgraded to a one bedroom penthouse on the 56th floor. The view was amazing, as was our room. The bed wasn't to soft or to hard, the bathroom had an amazing shower and tub. There was even a TV in the bathroom that I can watch from the tub. The place was amazing. My fiancé got a massage down in there spa, and she loved it. It sucks it isn't a gaming casino but still way better than any where else I stayed. The bar down stairs,  vice versa was amazing. There suites are reasonably priced to.

This hotel has excellent hardware, new and good location. But definitely need to improve software, services! They did not come to clean the room for one of two house keeping days, which is very rare for a five star hotel! Another funny thing is that front desk told us they are fully booked(Christmas time?) when we wanted to extend a day, actually we later on booked online with low rate. What stuff!

Coffee in room?  Oh no that is $20 per day.

Workout room, 1 bike,alas broken.
Limited weight machines.

Suite was great and nice non smoking non gambling hotel

I recently travelled to Las Vegas for a large convention that was held at the Cosmopolitan Hotel.   The Cosmopolitan is huge, busy and noisy, like most Vegas hotels, so I booked my room at the Vdara which is located right next door in City Center.  That was the best decision of the trip.  While I enjoyed the entire experience of Las Vegas it was wonderful to return to this lovely hotel at the end of the day.  The Vdara is an all suite, no gambling, no smoking hotel.  It is modern and serene, more like a NYC hotel than a Vegas hotel.  It also has a cool bar and great marketplace with fresh foods for dine in or take out in the lobby.  I did not eat at the hotel restaurant or go for spa services but their gym is very nice and well-equipped.  We booked a two room suite for two people which worked well and would be comfortable for up to four people. Not only did it have a very comfortable bedroom and living room with surprisingly comfortable pull out couch but it had a HUGE ultra modern bathroom with glass shower stall, soaking tub and double sink.  There was also a half bath and full kitchen equipped with stainless appliances, full size fridge, mini dishwasher and stove top. There was also a washer\/dryer in the room.   The best part is the central location.  The Vdara is connected to the Aria and the Bellagio and a very short walk to the Cosmopolitan.  We actually had a shorter walk to the conference facilities at the Cosmopolitan than our friends who stayed at the Cosmopolitan because that hotel is so enormous.  I would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to any friends who would like an oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas.
Amazing time!  The room, the service,  the hotel staff and security all top notch!  Great time and we will be back!

Oww it was a long check in on Sunday. They really should have staffed accordingly. Oh and there is no separate line for check out either. 

Their pool was the shape of a half moon and by Hotel standards it was too small. The spa pool was pretty big for a spa pool( almost as big as the actually pool). There were two or three other pools that looked like lap pools but were considered private. I'm sure at the right price you could get your own lap pool. 

Some negatives there was mandatory valet unless you want to walk thru Aria. Also the valet was always too busy to pull our car and we always had to wait downstairs for them which I believe is another staffing issue. 
The only cafe in the hotel closes at 8pm and I found hair in the bath tub (Kind of gross, but I don't take baths in hotels, so it didn't bother me too much). 

This could be considered a minus point but not for us, there was no casino and this meant it was a smoke free property. ( Yeah for my Lungs!) The robes and slippers are complimentary but you have to ask for them and be prepared to wait 30 minutes. The room is very spacious and it is a king bed with a living room area and a dining room area. Plus you had two closets. The beds and pillows are very comfortable! I thought the shades provided enough coverage, the room wasn't pitch black but it's dark enough. They provided a fridge but you can only use one side the other side is full of stuff you have to pay for. There is a mini kitchen (with sinks, garbage disposal, microwave, and stove with 2 burners). Oh and we were on the 34th floor and the view was awesome (even with a view of the back of the strip and in-n-out). 

You can really tell this property was never meant for a hotel but I think they did their best adjusting it. I think at the right price I wouldn't mind buying one of these rooms. ;-)

I may not be the first to review the Vdara but I can still say that I was the first person ever to stay in my room and sleep in the bed! I may never do that again at such a luxurious billion $$$ Hotel and Spa. 
A large group of friends and I hit Vegas for a birthday celebration and to do a little running in the Rock n Roll Marathon. I just so happened to be the only single person on the trip and missed out on the Southwest Airlines package deal for the Bellagio. So my good friends super Internet savvy neighbor scoured the net and found the Vdara was opening the week of the race. One quick call to the reservation specialist and I had a fantastic suite for less than the Bellagio. 
First sight of the building from the strip and it gleams in the sun with it's curved walls of glass. Bell hop right out to the limo to grab my bags and off to my room with a quick stop to the front desk. Lobby is nice and quiet with two bars and an area to just chill. Something to be said for a piece of mind away from the hustle and noise of the casinos. 
My room was a modern design of glass, dark woods and an Asian flair with sliding doors. Kitchen, dining area, living room, bed room and a monster bathroom with a massive tub. Giant LCD TV and windows shades for day or night lighting. But why close the shades it will only hide the sweet view of the strip and the Aria and new mall. 
I have been to Vegas several times and stayed at a variety of Casiono-hotel combos at all price levels. I can say by far this is the best place in Vegas I have ever stayed. Even though the idea is not to spend any time in your room, Vdara makes you want to stay in.

Over the past year I've stayed at Aria and Palazzo around 15 times for leisure and more than half of those experiences were challenging....

Que Vdara for my Bday Weekend.

Check in was a breeze took less then 3 minutes I got my request, High floor, Lake view and off to the suite I went.

The non smoking, spotless, modernistic, fashion-forward, high quality, upscale environment was what I wanted from a Vegas experience for a long time and I finally found it.

The suite was spotless, fresh and felt brand new. The bathtub gorgeous...My only wish would be jets for the tub.

The pool area was really nice...I was curious about it having a view from aria into Vdara so many times and was surprised. Really high quality guests, quiet and clean area and had a good time.

I gamble sometimes and frankly dont care if the casino is in the lobby or not Aria was 50 steps away and Bellagio is connected inside Vdara.

Net Net I didnt have a single challenge for the staff...

I'll be back shortly.

Teddi Alvarez was magnificent!  I asked her to change my boring look to something wonderful for the holidays! WOW!!! I can't wait till my family sees me for Christmas!  I Absolutely Love It! Thank you so much! WOW!

Girls weekend was spent here at a fairly reasonable rate for a brand spankin' new hotel of $175 per night. But would I ever come back again? Here's the tale of how the weekend went at Vdara....

Driving in from OC to Vegas meant that by the time you see the hotels on the horizon you are DYING to get out of the car, into the room and on with the shenanigans! This was definitely the case this time around except here's how my story went.

First, try figuring out how to even get to the Vdara is going to confuse the hell out of you. Granted I didn't write down the street name before arrival, because like all Vegas strip hotels, you should be able to figure it out since its right in front of you. Well wrong story here! There's still a lot of construction going on, so when your coming up the Strip you need to make a left on Harmon. Well, its right next to Aria, but don't be fooled into thinking that the Aria will somehow take you into Vdara because it doesn't. Or if it did, I didn't figure it out...had to ask the valet at Aria how to get to Vdara (take Harmon!),

Get to the valet (I only valet'd as that seemed the only option) and into the lobby we went. We wait in line for about 15min and get greeted by the friendly front desk gal. She tells us rooms aren't ready...and that's when we look around and see quite a few people laying around the elevator\/lobby, which we assume they are waiting for rooms as well. Well this ain't good because I have reservations at Rosemary's Restaurant in an hour. The gal swiftly let us up into Spa Vdara to get ready for free, so I was a happy gal.

Spa Vdara is small and modern with all the spa amenities needed: shower, jacuzzi, sauna, steam room, vanity area, etc. Not bad for a free visit to the Spa in lieu of having a room ready (day rate for the spa itself is $25).

Went to Rosemary's and then came back at around 9pm to learn that they are comping the "resort fee" of $15 per day for our troubles and gave us a room facing the Bellagio fountains. Nice, I'll take it.

Here's where it got interesting: Get back to the room at 3:00am and I'm really looking forward to kicking off the heels and going to bed. I'm not in the room for more than a minute and the freakin' PA announcement goes off telling us to leave the room as fast as possible due to an emergency. Not willing to chance it, we walk down with the rest of the hotel guests down 37 flights of stairs!!! Lucky for us it was 37 flights and not 50something like some of the others!

An hour of hanging around the lobby and in a conference rooms leads to a conclusion that there was no emergency and that we can all go back to our room. GREAT...We get back to the room and they proceed to apologize for the inconvenience on the PA system a total of 9 times! Enough already, there were kids and babies that got whipped out of sleep and now you're going to wake them all up again!

Anyhow, morning comes and we head down to eat but guess what, there's only one restaurant (Silk Road), no coffee shop, no nothing...so we ate outside the hotel.

Overall, it was A-OK because its brand new so the rooms themselves are really nice, but its still a bit inconvenient. At least for right now, its seems that the hotel still has some quirks to fix out, like getting the rooms ready for the influx of guests checking in and making sure alarms don't go off to vacate the premises for no reason. But it would be nice to have more dining choices. Also, if you want any food or drinks (Bar Vdara was dead empty...) you're best going to Aria as it is the closest...

Final rating: "Been there, done that

I should have read some reviews about VDara before booking this hotel! My fault!!! VDara is located in Aria properties but you have to walk 5 minutes to get to Aria. There is no casino in VDara and you should go to Aria to gamble. Really boring compare to other hotels in Vegas! If you think this place is similar to Cosmopolitan hotel, you are wrong!

Got an awesome upgrade for Mexican Independence Day weekend! They overbooked the standard room so my friends and I were upgraded to the 51st floor (of 56) corner suite! Nice!

1.5 bathrooms, one king bed, a pullout sofa (which sucked -- better to sleep on the reg sofa -- more cushioning), and a kitchen which was perrrrfect for having pre drinking parties. 

Great service (friendly, prompt, and accomodating when we asked for 7 glasses and a whole case of water for the day after) and the hotel staff was super friendly about sneaking people in heehee... 

oh and the gym was pretty naice (though I have never before worked out while in Vegas so I really have no point of reference)

Things Against?
-No casino!! Although it may be a bonus that I couldn't gamble away all my $$
-the pool, while gorgeous, is a bit small and underwhelming
-the room was set up sort of weirdly -- so it felt small even though it was big
-the bathroom with the glass doors everywhere and open toilet -- be prepared to friendship to that next level w your friends

Honestly, this hotel was fantastico but Vegas is VEGAS. It's supposed to be increeeeible and I wasn't blown away by this hotel. I could stay here again but I'm down for adventuring to other places as well.

Decided to stay here for a short vacation because it's was about 20 bucks cheaper a night than staying at Aria (which is about a 2 min walk away). No casino, but again, Aria is right there, and the Bellagio is connected via a walk way. Great room. Had one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. In fact, I'm thinking about buying a mattress from them once I get the money saved up.

A great place to stay, if you're okay with not having a casino in your hotel. I think it's definitely worth the savings, and sometimes it's kinda nice not staying where people are milling around a casino and smoking downstairs. I'd stay here again for sure.

Oh, they have "free" wifi and bottled water, but really, you're paying for it in your daily resort fee (which I think is like 20 bucks a day).

I love staying here. I visit Las Vegas often and this lately has been my hotel or choice. It's non-gaming and within walking distance to Aria, Crystal Shops, and a tram offered to others. The rooms are nicely designed with large bathrooms, and a kitchen area. The kitchen area is a huge plus for those wanting to bring snacks( which I suggest) since the cost of everything is higher. There is a Starbucks on ground level, great pool and spa with a decent gym. For room service I always get the spa breakfast which is excellent!! Stay here and you won't be disappointed:)

Loved just about everything about this hotel! The bed, pillow, comforters, and towels are very relaxing, clean, and fresh. I wanted to give a full 5 stars, but the fee for valet and resort fee per night was eh...  Room service\/in-room dining was a great experience especially when I did not want to go out for breakfast. I really enjoyed the stay and the view. The lobby was comforting as it isnt as noisy as other hotels with casinos along with the smell of cigarettes  (which was a plus since I had my kid with me). The staff at the front desk was the best customer service I ever experienced so far from previous Las Vegas stays at other hotels. Can't wait to return and stay here again!

We've stayed at Vdara at had a really great stay.  We stayed in a corner suite which was huge and floor to ceiling windows, gigantic flat screens, kitchen, jacuzzi tub, the whole 9 yards.  It was priced right and the air was super clean throughout the hotel.  This is a non-smoking, non-gaming hotel.

For gaming, restaurants and booze we went to the Aria which was about a 2 minute walk across the parking lot.  The sports book in the Aria is 5 stars all the way.  Drink tickets for every $50 bet so we never paid for a drink.  There is a sports bar connected to the book which is really nice as well.

Slight knock for the rest of the gaming at the Aria and the pool was shut down at the Vdara which sort of blew.  All in all we had a great time and will definately be back.

Fast checkin. Great design. Would give five stars but the whole place smell like sweet fart oder including the room possibly due to mop detergent. Microwave and fridge a big plus. Near cvs and walgreens.  The TV menu system was SLOW and PAINFUL if you plan to stay in the room alot.  WYNN was much better in this department.

Excellent hotel and accommodations for Vegas.  I've stayed there two years in a row for the NAB Show and had a great experience.  Excellent views either direction of the hotel.  Beds, showers and rooms are very comfortable with a nice dose of chic.

I booked thru Expedia and got a decent rate. I was staying late Jan on a Tuesday and Wednesday so I didn't expect the rates to be super high anyway. We went into our room I jumped into the shower and the shower was backed up, ok that's no big deal. Well when you need to go to the bathroom and you take a number 2 guess what the damn bathroom is literally right next to your bed. Sure there's a door and a fan but the fan doesn't eliminate the odor and the door doesn't help any bit either. Then there's the bed, it's beyond uncomfortable our bed dipped in the middle the pillows are flat. I did not sleep at all the two nights I was there. I will not be staying at this hotel ever again. I should have known better. I'd rather pay more and buy a restful night sleep then ever stay here again. BTW there's no casinos in this hotel.

Stayed here for my Bday. It is my kind of spot!

Pros:
-non smoking
-gym\/spa was newer and well kept
-our room was a full on suite with a lovely large bath tub
-complementary water
-centrally located
-digging the decor! :)
-proper concierge is a plus!
-free Wi-Fi

Cons:
-have to walk through Cosmopolitan to get to Vdara most of the time (not really a Con per se ... but after having a bit too much of adult bevies, and swear you are done for the evenin' or mornin' and Cosmopolitan does have lounges with lovely drinks ... let's face it ... I had a bit of a challenging time getting back to our suite! *hahaha*)
-Resort Fee was not included! *boo*

Verdict:
Will stay again, and will recommend to fellow non smoker and non gambler, especially! :)

I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here.  Bed was great, service great, clean, friendly. I like that there is no casino so that you can come home to a quieter not smoky refuge off the strip.  Lower rooms can hear pool music so bring ear plugs for a daytime nap or request higher room.

The vdara
Location: the location is great in my opinion as you are right on the strip with quick access to aria, Monte Carlo, bellagio and Caesars palace. Most of which you access without having to leave he comforts of air conditioning. 

Hotel: LOVE how this hotel is smoke free! Check in was quick and staff were helpful and friendly, We dealt with Kyle and he was really good about upgrading our rooms and quickly sent house keeping up with everything we needed for the kitchen which was awesome cause we were hungry! Checkout was quick staff was friendly. Concierge was helpful, house keeping was thorough and pretty quick. 

Rooms: LOVE the rooms. We upgraded to a corner suite with a view of the pool, and it was AH-mazing. First off the view was good as you looked out at aria which is a aesthetically pleasing and the pool was really pretty at night. The bathroom was big with great lighting for doing your makeup :-). The living room area was comfortable we watched get hard one night it was hilarious. The kitchen was great it had a full 4 person table, there was a full size fridge (and there was a smaller separate mini bar), a 4 top stove (no oven), a microwave and a small dishwasher. If you call house keeping they are happy to bring up a pot & pan, cutlery and dishes. Also beds super comfy maybe a touch too soft if that's even possible. Pillows were better than any hotel pillow I've had to use before. And I almost forgot I finished almost all my post trip laundry before we left as they have a both a washer and dryer for clothing.

Pool: pool was a decent size with plenty of lounge chairs and umbrellas. The highlight of the trip for the boys was throwing a mini football around the pool. It was fun that they were allowed to do this and they met a lot of cool people that joined in.

Gym: if you like cardio like me this is a perfect little space for you. If you like lifting weights mad require anything. Heavier than 50 lb dumbells and your own body weight then I suggest looking else where or paying to use Aria's gym or driving to Edge fitness on Rainbow. Vdara should really consider asking Aria to use their fitness facility for free on a case by case basis at a minimum as Vdara's gum really has nothing to offer in terms of weight training.

Overall: really loved the hotel and would love to go back if they were arrange something to allow guests to use Aria's gym for no extra charge. I also think that they should also allow cats to stay at the hotel as they are quieter than dogs and typically litter box trained.

My wife and I loved our stay at the Vdara. We had a nice view on the north side overlooking the Bellagio fountains. Out room was clean and comfy. The day we arrived it was about 110 degrees outside. We noticed our room was a little warm at 76 degrees. We set the temperature to 70 degrees and left for a few hours. When we got back the room was still too warm and the temperature had not gone down. We called the front desk and asked them about it and they promptly sent a technician up to work sone magic. Whatever he did helped as the room cooled down a lot. I was pleased with the prompt and courteous response. 

The bed and pillows were nice. The room had a nice feel to it. We just felt comfortable and relaxed the whole time we were there. 

I would recommend staying here and we will come again.

In one way, I know why people prefer Vdara, it's a condo-hotel - quiet without the casino hub bub but still within the strip.  They also accept dogs (cat?) with restrictions (size etc.).  Each room is a suite from studio to penthouse (loft).  We have the "Dog Suite".  I guess they designate rooms that are dog friendly to both customers and dogs.  I will talk about this more later.

We had a short stay, 2 nights.  The connection to the tram  (between ARIA, Monte Carlo, Bellagio\/Vdara) and Bellagio is nice because Brian my husband prefers that hotel for breakfast anyway.  it's an option for a casino besides Aria (still higher minimums on the table but slots should be avail in all denominations (Penny and above).  Valet parking is another cost, option is to park in Aria (free if you have Pearl or above designation on your MLife rewards card).  i got to Pearl by gettng an MLife Credit Card.  I discovered this was only valid until the end of Sep 2017 (the bump on the MLife rewards - I only got the cc on end of July). Valet was not covered. I paid $25 a night.  Besides paying more for a Dog suite than a regular suite, I was charged $50 extra per night for my dog.  All this charges add up.  

In comparison, there is no charge for parking in Cosmopolitan, my room charge is normal cost plus the pet fee (which I know I am charged for in any hotel that accepts dogs). The only thing I received for staying in Vdara is quietness (I myself couldn't care less but the other person in the party prefers it and I don't mean the dog).

Vdara views were fine.  The room was decent, clean, and newish. I have seen great rooms (new Cosmopolitan), so so rooms (new Flamingo) and really bad (Rio\/Planet Hollywood). I do have to say that most of those other hotel stays were complimentary so I can't complain about the rooms too much.  I liked that I had a tub and a shower in the bathroom but to only provide one set of towels was a bit underestimation of your number of guests.  Housekeeping was able to provide more towels but for some reason I got two large towels and enormous amounts of face towels.

I would love to love Vdara but as the person paying the bills, I don't know if it's worth it when you wind up spending as much as you would in a nice room in Caesars Palace with my dog.  The only difference is the suite (there is an actual electric stove top) but the small fridge with it's broken door (mini bar broke in all sense of the word) also was a hassle for me.

So Suite Yes (Space was nice)  Costs No (Valet parking, dog fee etc.)  

You shouldn't have to ask for more towels (after turndown for the first night, we did get a set of two large towels and two towel mats - less face towels).

I have to be honest, I really wanted to like this hotel. Based on all the yelp reviews, I had high expectations. As soon as I entered the hotel room, I felt I was on a business trip. Although I'm not a smoker nor do I gamble really, coming to Vegas to experience a "normal" hotel was not my expectation. Every dark wood "modern", "luxury", "sophisticated" detail did not put in the mindset of vacation nor Vegas, but in the mind of sleep and work. If it weren't for the large windows to remind me it was Vegas, I may have worked the whole vacation.

It's clean and the staff were all nice. The rooms are rather small and dark (I said it twice now) unlike the other "luxury hotels" I've visited in Vegas. The kitchenette was ok. The microwave would have come in handy if my left overs didn't spoil in the mini fridge that doesn't get cold enough to chill water. 

The staff was really nice and though I paid for the patio daybed so my daughter and I could fully enjoy the pool without direct sun torch, the pool was small and just ok. 

All Vegas strip hotels seem to have a resort fee, for Vdara I'm still not sure what the fee covered. Maybe includes
 - Access to the small pool where there's a fee for padded seating. 
 - Or maybe it's the 2 burner kitchenette that didn't include any utensils, pans etc. (available upon request for another small fee?)
 - Maybe...the two mini waters
- Free version of the really slow Wifi
Basically I have no idea why the daily fee of 30+ dollars.

PROS -
*Comfortable bed
*Clean
*Pool and Bar food great
*Large Windows

CONS - 
*Small bathroom
*Fairly small room
*Dark furniture 
*No shuttle to anywhere
*Small pool
*Limited necessities (snacks, meds etc.) in the Vdara Market Café

Overall, my 5 day vacation was fine. In comparison to Wynn, Encore, Bellagio or even Caesar"s Palace, I think the hotel experience does not equal the rate for the room. This would be a great boutique hotel for long term rentals, business trips etc. Not really ideal for family vacation or the grandiose feel we normally get when we're on the Vegas strip. I'm not sure if I'd return at the same rate again.

Stayed at the Vdara this past July 4th weekend.  It was a pleasantly enjoyable experience.  

The first thing I noticed when arriving at the Hotel is the fresh smell of roses in the air.  It was wuite refreshing compared to being in the casino hotels where your are breathing in smoke.  The people at the front counter were really nice and informative.  We had asked for directions to a few different places and they gave us the quickest route to take.  There are no casino area so don't expect to do any gambling at the Vdara, but you can just hop on the tram and go right next door to the Aria and gamble away.  I like that it has no casino area because I can sleep at night without having to hear the slot machines going off from my room.  Plus the hotel is not crowded compared to a hotel with a casino.

I stayed in a deluxe room on the 45th floor and it was more spacious than I thought, especially the restroom.  The room was decorated in a modern style.  There was a kitchen area for the people that like to cook their own food or warm up the left overs from last nights dinner.  There are shades located on the glass windows that you can open and close.  A 40 inch LCD TV (with HD channels) mounted on the wall and it displays your name on screen to welcome you.  You can also use the TV to check out.  How cool is that !?!  There were plenty of towels \/ robes located in the restroom.  The bed had plenty of pillows and was comfortable to sleep in.  

The accommodations: You will have access to the pool and gym area.  The local news paper will be delivered to your front door every morning.  Free internet included with your stay.  Maid service is amazing.  We had stuff all over the place and the maid service cleaned up the entire room.  Organized our belongings and provided up with fresh towels.  It was outstanding.  This is coming from a guy that normally does not want maid service when staying in a hotel.

The location of the Hotel is good and bad.  In a good way its located in the middle of the Las Vegas Strip and you have access to anything on the strip within walking distance.  You just have to take the tram to Bellagio or Aria and make your way on the strip.  The bad is it is located in the middle of the strip and traffic is quite a pain on Las Vegas Blvd.  Always busy and congested.  

One last small thing that bothers me about the hotel is they don't provide plates, silverware, pans, or any other kitchen items even though they provide you with a kitchen.  Other than that, everything about the hotel was close to being perfect.

In conclusion, it was a great stay for me and my gf.  A clean, comfortable, quiet place to stay at.  A great hotel with outstanding customer service \/ accommodations.  What more can you ask for.  Highly recommended.  You won't regret it.

Enjoyed my stay here. I liked the fact that it is smaller and quieter, but still within very close walking distance to the larger hotels. The bridge is great to get to Bellagio with very minimal time spent outside (108 degs!), and we went all the way to Caesars through the mall. Genius idea to connect everything.

The deluxe suite was decently spacious for 4 people. I luckily got to sleep in the bed, which was luxurious enough (not too squishy, firm enough for back support, soft and cozy). The friends who slept on the pull out sofa said the mattress was super squishy, and they probably had aches after the weekend. We had to call for many items: sheets and blankets for the pull out bed, more bath towels, hot water kettle (which they didn't have, gave us a pot instead), and more toilet paper. The house cleaning light is a smart idea, and we turned it on after a couple of days after our room became more... lived in. We had the a\/c on at 72 but it was still freezing. If we turned it off, it became stuffy and unbearable.

The bathroom had spacious counter space, and actual square footage inside where we could all stand in there to brush our teeth at the same time (we have a cute selfie LOL). No complaints about the shower, and I wish I had some bubble bath or salts to use in the soaking tub! We only used it to soak our trashed feet after the clubs ;)

We grabbed a quick dinner to go from the downstairs Market Cafe one night, and our chicken sandwich and fries took 30 minutes to come out. Their take out presentation was very nice though, but seriously, it wasn't even busy. Another day, we chilled at the pool for a few hours, and the food there is the same in the Market Cafe. Pricey but not unexpected, just meh. The pool is a bit small, and the water warm and murky.

Overall, the rooms are nice. It's nice to go home to quiet after a night out.

Stayed in a 1 bedroom loft. It was nice. After thinking about it though square space seemed to be like a normal full room (with kitchen). The only difference was they put stairs in the room.  

Anyway I was extremely happy with the front desk assistant. Long story short I made a mistake with my reservation. Aaron at the front desk really helped me out and I appreciated it.

I'm new to the Vegas scene, I've only ever been once when I didn't have a lot of money and stayed off the strip, so I was definitely impressed the Vdara! It was a little difficult to find at first as my navigation directed us to the Bellagio, and then once you pull up the hotel entrance, there are loops and turns everywhere. So it was a tad overwhelming, especially since we were towing a trailer through everything. The valet were very accommodating and helped us get our load settled in the Vdara oversized lot, which not all hotels have so that was awesome! The hotel lobby is beautiful, and the decor is hip and luxurious. We were on the 30th floor and had an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains and the bustling city, and our king bed was so comfortable! We had just traveled 7+ hours with a 1 year old and it was a long day, so we decided to stay in and order room service and a movie. The room service was so expensive, even for Vegas, and they charge $4.95 per person to deliver it plus tax and tip. But the food was amazing-best creme brûlée we've ever had-and the portions were big. Pay per view movies are $11.99 which is expensive but actually cheaper than one of the last hotels we stayed at in Disneyland, so we splurged and ordered one. We slept great and it was so quiet, only once did I hear people outside the door. The blackout shades didn't quite blackout the morning light, but I couldn't wait to open them again and see that view! We had a wonderful stay here and will definitely return for weekend getaways in the future. I think they take pets too, if that's your thing.

Fitness Center: Cybex Treadmills, Cybex Arc Trainers, Cybex bikes. Cybex VR3 selectorized strength equipment.

The suites are crazy beautiful - from the large size of sitting room, dining room, 2 bathrooms and a huge master - damn!

No smoke - no casino - no maze - no loud noises - ahhhh this is a place to stay with my loved one and be able to enjoy Vegas in a non-20 year old way...

Honestly i HATED my stay here! So when i was looking for a hotel to stay at to celebrate my birthday i thought to myself i wanted to splurge a bit and treat myself to a hotel ive wanted to stay at. The choice was between cosmo, aria and vdara. I chose Vdara but i feel I shouldve chosen something else. 

 So we got in at 1 on march 11th day of my birthday and we get our room keys and the room we will be staying in. So we made our way up dropped our bags off and left to go shopping before we had to get ready for our night. Fast forward to 5pm when we are back at our hotel and i am just getting out of the shower, threw on a tank dress and someone just WALKS right in to our room! Shocked i asked Excuse me in a upset and shocked tone to which without even apologizing for walking in asks me in a very rude and demanding tone what i was doing in the room. I then told her this was my room and to please leave. Startled i walked back in to the bedroom area and then the room phone goes off and its front desk. Again without apologizing i am asked in a demanding tone what i was doing in the room. I then at this point heated answer that i was checked into this room at 1pm and that if they were accusing me of waltzing up here and coming in here on my own withought checking in this was bs. He then finally apologized n hung up. This was 1 of the 4 calls i got. It was then followed by a 2nd call asking how many room keys i had and who checked me in. 3rd call i was asked how i got the room and what time. 4th call i was pissed at this point but what lead after set me off, he then demanded at this very moment i come down with my card because they apparently didnt have my card on file when there was clearly already a charge hold on my card from that afteroon. I then responded that i was not able to come down because i was not dressed and that it would take me a moment to which he then was still in a VERY rude demanding tone tells me YOU NEED TO COME RIGHT NOW. Pissed and irritated i told him that i will be down when i am down and that he will just have to wait until i am ready and i hung up. When i get down i speak to a female and let her know of everything they have put me through in a 4 hrs span. She was polite and credited me $75 in hotel credits and tells me she will be charging my card the full amount of 427. So fast forward to 4am when im coming back from the club celebrating my birthday me and my girl are tired and obviously intoxicted a bit and all we wanted to do is sleep. Well that was not going to happen. We get back and we tap our card and they've locked us out of our room! Furious at this point i make my way down i go to front desk and im telling her about everything AGAIN eveything that the hotel has put me through  and the fact that im literally staying 1 night in this hotel and that this is total fucking bullshit!! Finally we get our room and things back and get to finally sleep. Im the morning we check out and when asked how the stay was i honestly answered with "the worst hotel ive stayed at in vegas by far" 

So here i am now 3 days after sunday and i check my bank statement and they charged me 200 extra on my bill. Took me 20 minutes to get someone on the phone to talk to someone about it. 

Its clear to say i am never going to stay at vdara again. I wish i could give them 0 stars but the 1 will do i guess but even that it is not deserved. Honestly not even a 24 hour stay and this shit. Oh and did i mention none of our televisions even worked~ Great Job Guys!

Check in staff was very helpful.  Pool area is beautiful. Hotel rooms are modern, clean and luxurious.  Down stairs cafe has a lot of food selections.  

Walking distance to the aria and city center makes this hotel one of my favorites on the strip.   

I will stay here again.

My husband and I stayed here over the 4th of July weekend. We were so looking forward to the stay after looking at the website and loved that each room had a kitchen and that the resort had no casino.  In the past we've stayed at other nice resort\/hotels in Vegas that had similar set up without the casino and check-in was always so much faster and easier. Vdara disappointed us from the get go. First the entrance to the hotel is difficult to find even on the strip. The signs are tiny, the road takes you in loops and is overall a BIG headache. Most hotels on the strip have a back entrance, not this one. The only way in is from the Strip. That sucks considering the traffic on the strip is horrible. It can take you 15 minutes to go one block! Upon finally getting to the hotel, the only way to park is w\/valet. No self parking? Come on! Sometimes I don't feel like tipping everybody 10 times a day! But Vdara says that's what the resort fee is for. Yeah, right. So the check-in counter was a pain in the ass. 3 long ass lines.  Why don't they get smart and make one line for all of us to stand in. That way we can go to the first available person? 

On to the room. The furnishings are nice and modern. But there were some major issues with the room. 1) No pots, pans, cups, utensils, etc. in the kitchen. Completely bare when you open the cupboards. You have to call housekeeping to bring each and every stinking thing you want up and that takes them at least 30-45 minutes. Such an inconvenience, when I wanted a cup of tea like an hour ago! They don't even give you a coffee maker. Also, the refrigerator is the size of a medicine cabinet. I kid you not. Go ahead and try to fit a few things, and you will see how ridiculously small this is. 2) Bathroom door was one of those sliding doors. Ours was already broken and the lock didn't even work b\/c it wouldn't slide all the way closed. 3) The blackout shades are broken into 3 sections and each section has a 2 inch gap in between that lets in all the bright sun in the morning. Forget about sleeping in past 6am, unless you put a pillow over your head. 4) No robes in the room. You have to call housekeeping to bring it up and that takes 40 minutes. Again, a pain when you wanted to use it a 40 min ago and are now waiting to take a shower b\/c the robes haven't arrived. 

So one morning since there is no coffee maker, my husband goes down to the only cafe in the whole hotel to grab a cup of coffee. The line was about 15 people long and he asked the cashier if he can just order a cup. She tells him no, and he has to wait in the big a$$ line. Another person asks, same answer.. wait in the big a$$ line. So a third person asks and the person says OK. WTH? By the time my husband gets to the front of the line he tells the guy they should be consistent or have a line just for coffee.  The guy rolls his eyes and shrugs with a look like "I don't give an F!" So my husband goes to the front desk to see if they have a comment card he can write on. They tell him "No, we don't have one. You can fill out an online survey that we will email you." Husband tells front desk, I have my comment fresh in my mind and want to write it down now. Front desk tells him "Go write it on the room stationary."  Husband is pissed, but goes up to the room and finds there is no room stationary. Only the little 4x6 notepad. So my husband writes his complaint on the little notepad and said he expects a call or email from their manager. Husband turns the card in to the front desk. Over a week later, we still have not received any response from Vdara. This place just sucks and they don't care about the customer at all.  Vegas is a hospitality town. We had great customer service everywhere but here and we go to Vegas at least 3 times a year.  Go somewhere else until Vdara improves their customer service. Trust me. These little things add up to a frustrating stay anywhere. We will not be returning. Vdara, you lost our business.

Vdara was a dream come true. The service was excellent, and the hotel itself was cozy, unlike so many of the massive properties on the strip. 

The photos online make the Vdara look modern in what seemed like a cold way, but the rooms and lobby were surprisingly inviting. Also, the tub was magical! It was the msot comfortable tub I have ever been in. We had a room pretty high up, and we had a very nice view of the Bellagio fountains, which was so romantic and lovely. While the rooms were not as large and impressive as, say, those of the Venetian, I would rather stay in the Vdara.

Note: Don't let Google Maps fool you. It's not as far off the Strip as it looks. There is a covered walkway that connects the Vdara to the Bellagio; it takes maybe two minutes at most to get from one to the other. The Vdara's location was extremely convenient as it is located basically in the middle of the Strip.

I would definitely stay here again. In fact, I'm rather hesitant to try new properties because I like the Vdara so much.

Despite being MGM's biggest money pit, this place is still accommodating for guests such as ourselves, maintaining a good level of service and having very classy rooms and furniture. Staying in their suites means you get to stay inside one of the rooms they originally intended to sell as a condo, you can tell by the washer and dryer. Therefore, if you're gonna stay in Vegas for more than four days for a convention or what not, definitely try and get one of these Vdara suites. 

The rooms are fairly dark; you can see they're going after a very modern feel just as with the casinos and lobbies of Aria. 

Our suite was pretty damned big; a bedroom with one king bed, a living room with a plasma and roll away couch, its own kitchen, and a larger than normal bathroom with a tub, stand up shower, two sinks, and a powder room counter. 

We landed our suite at 180 a night, thanks to Priceline. It's one heck of a bargain, and I think you can consistently land this hotel on that site, as well!

Great hotel. Great service from the front desk. Have no complaints about the hotel. 

The only downside is the walk to casinos, though not too bad if you want to go to Aria. 

Definitely worth the stay.

If you want a nice, relatively quiet place in Vegas, the Vdara is definitely for you.  That's generally not what I want in Vegas, but the Aria is so close, it makes that less of a factor.
Lots of cool touches
-doorbells on the rooms (nice to not have to hear people knocking at doors down the hall).
-button inside the room for Do Not Disturb and Housekeeping that changes the color of the light around the doorbell to alert the housekeeping staff
-Market Cafe has good food, although they're pretty slow.
-Master light switch that cuts off all lights in the room
-Automatic shades
-two free 12 oz water bottles left in the room each day by housekeeping.  
-housekeeping exceeded expectations with lots of nice little touches (like putting my dirty laundry in a laundry bag).  
-overall, the rooms are very nice aesthetically - but I'm more of a functional guy, so this doesn't carry a whole lot of weight with me beyond that it's clean and has a good TV.  

Things I didn't like:
-The alarm clock is idiotically designed. Any alarm clock that you can look at for more than 3 seconds and not know how to set the alarm is poorly designed.
-The bed is a bit hard for my taste
-There was a pair of dirty tighty whities sitting on the shelf in the closet when I arrived. Seriously. Although I guess this was good for a few laughs, which is  a positive!
-The shampoo\/body wash they provide is in a square bottle, and you can't really squeeze them out. Really, really stupid design.
-uber-cheap towels - felt like sand paper. This is just unacceptable for a place trying to be high end.  More like an EconoLodge.
-Similarly, really cheap toilet paper.  Hey, little things like this are important!  =)
-Drinks at the bar are absurdly expensive (typical for the high end places in Vegas).  $11 for a Jack and Coke.  
-Electrical outlets weren't very well placed - this is inexcusable for a new hotel.  There was no outlet were I could plug in my phone and leave it within reach of the bed, and finding an outlet accessible for the iron was impossible without moving stuff around.  

Vdara falls into the category of "I'd stay there again, but it's far from my top choice.

Came here for my anniversary. we just checked out today. I called ahead of time to see if they could give me an upgrade for my anniversary but they said due to the 4th of july weekend I had to wait until check in to see if there was availability.

So we check in July 3rd and as soon as we get to the room to my surprise they upgraded my room to a bigger suite. I was so happy.

Later that night they delivered a card and chocolates to our room for our anniversary. I travel to vegas a lot and never stayed at vdara but it is by far the best hotel Ive stayed at thus far.

Pros:
great staff
clean hotel
no casino

Cons:
you have to pay for parking
no self parking

You absolutely must stay at this hotel. The bed was perfection. The suite we had was amazing as well. Bathroom was fabulous, with a nice shower. Excellent water pressure, and sleek furnishings. Again, the bed alone is reason to stay at Vdara. My boyfriend and I appreciated the smoke free atmosphere as well. We ordered some things from housekeeping, and they were brought up in a timely manner. We ate at the marketplace downstairs a few times, and the food was great. We are staying here from now on!!

Continuing my theme of doing Vegas right, staying at the Vdara is doing it right. 

City Center is the new hotspot in Vegas with all the popular restaurants, clubs, hotels all located in one area. While the Aria and Cosmopolitan are nice, I feel like they are overpriced for what you get. 

Vdara has plenty of suite options that are very reasonably priced. I stayed in the 1600+ sq foot hospitality suite and was pretty impressed. With 2 bedrooms and 2.5 baths, a full kitchen and every amenity you can imagine, its a great suite. 

I'm still a Palms Place fan but if I'm staying on the strip, I think Vdara is the best option! Will be coming back for sure.

A very nice hotel just off the strip.  I like hotels in Vegas that don't have a large casino you have walk through just to get to your car, a restaurant, the lobby, the strip, etc.   It is nice to go straight to your room.  Clean upscale and simple.

However, the reason I couldn't do five (5) stars is the parking and resort fee scam that Vegas is now implemented on its costumers.  

There is no self parking, only Valet.  To get your car or items you have to wait for the Valet  to retrieve your car.  Very hard to get your stuff in and out of the hotel.  Plus the parking is separate from the "resort fee".  

The resort fee at some of the strip hotels makes sense, includes the parking, the wifi, the pools, concierge, common plants, flowers, etc.   

However, the Vdara is a simple hotel, with minimal pool and facilities, yet they have an expensive resort fee.

The rooms are nice modern style.  They have a mini bar, safe, closets, windows with drapes that have electronic up and down.  Each room has a large bed and a separate couch bed with a television wall that has minimal privacy. 

To get to the strip you can walk through the Bellagio Casino or take the ramp.   I would definitely stay here again!

LOVE LOVE LOVE this hotel. I went to Vegas for the first time a few weeks ago and stayed at Vdara. I really enjoyed the 'clean' atmosphere. There was no cigarette smoke to choke me and I didn't have to listen to the annoying sounds of a casino. This hotel is clean, modern, and welcoming. Definitely recommend this to anyone who is visiting Vegas!!

So yeah, it's pretty pricey, but as far as pricey hotels go, this is the first one I've stayed at that I walked away thinking, "yep, that was totally worth the price". Granted, I got two free nights free from myvegas (just paid the resort fee), but I did still pay for Saturday night, which was a couple hundred dollars - wanted to fly in Saturday, and didn't feel like fiddling with having to stay somewhere else the first night, so I just ate the cost. Arguably worth it, which is something I don't generally say about hotels that pricey.

I was impressed with a number of things staying here: the staff was super friendly, checkin and checkout were super fast and painless, even the cheapest room was still enormous (featuring both a couch and a full desk, a king-sized bed, a giant bathtub *and* a shower, and a dining room area we never used, but still), it was classy as *frack*, with nice art all over, both in the room and around the hotel, there were zero issues with the wifi, and of course, it's hard to beat the location (right off the strip, so it's not full of loud drunk people or smokers, but *right* off the strip, so you can walk out of the hotel and be on the strip in maybe 5 minutes.
